title: Frank Martins Formula for Success: You Figure It Out
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Frank Martin held another roomful of people under his sway on Friday, delivering lessons that are essentially unchanged from his days working in front of a classroom. After more than 30 years of coaching, including more than a dozen at high schools in his hometown, Miami, Martin finally has an audience commensurate with his outsize personality.

title: Whos Worth What at the White House: The Financial Disclosures
description: The Trump administration released the financial disclosure forms from members of the White House staff. Here is some of what they reveal.

title: Quotation of the Day: In Lawsuit After Lawsuit, Its Everyday People v. Trump
description: It was never my intention to go against the president of the United States. I was just following the law and doing everything the way its in the books. And it came to this.

title: White House Ends Bar Associations Role in Vetting Judges
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration has sent the American Bar Association into exile, ending the groups semiofficial role in evaluating candidates for the federal bench.

title: An Expansive View of a Forgotten People
description: Adam Ferguson sensed the moment was right: Everyone was simply waiting  but there was an air of suspense, too, with people looking off in different directions. I made the decision, on the spot, that this was going to be it.

title: And Now, the Dreaded Trump Curse
description: These days, the last thing you want is to be known as a Friend of Trump.  Hes doing great  hes president, for heavens sake. His kids are getting jobs, his hotels are getting promoted 24/7. He goes golfing more than your average Palm Beach retiree. Meanwhile, the people he hangs around with are watching their reputations crumble into smithereens.

title: After Murder, a Second Chance
description: Early next week, the New York State Board of Parole will hear the petition of Judith Clark, who has spent 35 years in prison for her role in the 1981 robbery of a Brinks armored car in Rockland County that resulted in the murder of two police officers and a guard.

title: Francine Hughes Wilson, 69, Domestic Violence Victim Who Took Action, Dies
description: On March 9, 1977, Francine Hughes decided that she had had enough. Thirteen years of verbal and physical abuse from her hard-drinking, fitfully employed husband, James Hughes, known as Mickey, had led to a horrendous fight at their home in Dansville, Mich.

title: Oregons 3-Point Past Catches Up to the Present
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  The statuette positioned at the top of Oregons 1939 N.C.A.A. tournament championship trophy appears to be preparing to take a two-handed set shot. That is how long it has been since the Ducks last played in the Final Four.

title: Man Who Killed Bus Driver With a Stolen Truck Is Found Guilty
description: A Georgia man who stole a truck after a night of drinking and rammed into a crosstown city bus, killing the driver, was convicted on Friday of aggravated vehicular homicide and manslaughter on Friday by a Manhattan jury after a three-week trial in state Supreme Court.

title: President Trumps Leaky Ship of State
description: Near the top of President Trumps enemies list, along with the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit and Nordstrom, are the leakers who fuel his running war with the media. These leakers, they are disgusting, he said last week. These are horrible people. These low-life, criminal blabbermouths, he vowed on Twitter, will be caught!

title: U.S. Beats Canada in Clash That Almost Didnt Happen
description: PLYMOUTH, Mich.  Just two weeks ago, the American and Canadian womens hockey teams almost seemed to be allies.

title: Albany Works Overtime as Budget Deal Proves Elusive
description: ALBANY  The state budget is late. The only question now is how late.

title: Venezuelas Descent Into Dictatorship
description: A ruling this week by Venezuelas Supreme Court stripping the nations legislative branch of all authority  and vesting that power in the court itself  moves a country already beset by violence and economic scarcity one step closer to outright dictatorship.

title: Mexico Welcomes Possible U.S. Shift on Nafta, but Mistrust of Trump Persists
description: MEXICO CITY  For months, President Trump warned Mexicans that the Nafta they had enjoyed for decades would soon be a thing of the past.

title: North Carolinas Dominance Fails to Cover Cheatings Stain
description: Such glorious days these are for the University of North Carolina Tar Heels. The basketball team is in the Final Four, a championship so close as to put the campus into a state of vibration. And Roy Williams, their down-home coach, finds himself celebrated for hill-country wit and hoops acumen.

title: Presidents Growing Trade Gap: A Gulf Between Talk and Action
description: WASHINGTON  Increasingly, when it comes to foreign trade, the Trump administration is talking loudly and brandishing a small stick.

title: For Russian Exemplar of Grace, Olympic Hopes Require It
description: HELSINKI, Finland  Still just 17 years old, Evgenia Medvedeva already skates like one of the greats, as she made clear by defending her womens title with steel and grace at the world championships here on Friday night.

title: White House Accepts Political Reality of Assads Grip on Power in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has abandoned the goal of pressing President Bashar al-Assad of Syria to leave power, marking a sharp departure from the Middle East policy that guided the Obama administration for more than five years, the White House said on Friday.

title: Go Gonzaga! But Who Is Gonzaga?
description: In the 1980s, as H.I.V. and AIDS ravaged sections of Manhattan, a Jesuit priest named William McNichols hit upon the perfect saint for that troubled time and place.

title: The Cartoons of Jack Ziegler
description: Jack Zieglers satirical, silly and observational style enlivened more than 1,600 cartoons at The New Yorker.

title: Jack Ziegler, Cartoonist at The New Yorker, Dies at 74
description: Jack Ziegler, whose satirical, silly and observational style enlivened more than 1,600 cartoons at The New Yorker beginning in the mid-1970s, died on Wednesday in a hospital in Kansas City, Kan. He was 74.

title: Alex Tizon, Journalist Who Wrote of Alienation as Asian-American, Dies at 57
description: Alex Tizon, a Pulitzer Prize-winning reporter whose well-received 2014 memoir documented his insecurities and alienation as a Filipino-American, was found dead on March 23 in his home in Eugene, Ore. He was 57.

title: Taking Things for Granted
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  The first thing I would like to say is that you are not insane. And before you send a strongly worded email to The New York Times, please know that the answers to todays puzzle by Howard Barkin are, in fact, correct. They just might not be what you expected.

title: Review: A Mesmerizing Hairy Ape Brings Existentialism to Park Avenue
description: A warning to the residents of the Upper East Side, especially those of you who live on one of those blocks so clean yuh could eat a fried egg offen it. Yank (probably better known to you as the Ape), that existentially challenged brute whom you humiliated into a suicidal spiral, has returned to your neighborhood. And hes still as mad as hell.

title: Foreigners Have Long Mined Indonesia, but Now Theres an Outcry
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Crowned with spiky feathered headdresses and daubed with face paint, scores of protesters gathered outside the Jakarta offices of an American mining giant last week, chanting, waving signs and throwing uncertainty into global commodities markets.

title: Corrections: April 1, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Confused by the Trump Surveillance Drama? Heres a Timeline
description: WASHINGTON  It was a mystery that gripped Washington for the better part of two weeks, filled with clandestine meetings at the White House, classified intelligence documents and confidential sources. And a central question was unanswered: Who showed the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee reports indicating that President Trump or members of his transition team may have been incidentally caught up in foreign surveillance by American spy agencies?

title: Pamela Edstrom, Who Helped Shape Microsofts Public Image, Dies at 71
description: Pamela Edstrom, a communications strategist who shaped the public image of Microsoft and its founder Bill Gates during the companys reign as the most powerful technology player in the world, died on Tuesday at her home in Vancouver, Wash. She was 71.

title: A.C.C. Is Open to Holding Title Games in North Carolina
description: PHOENIX  One day after North Carolina repealed a law that had caused the N.C.A.A., the N.B.A. and the Atlantic Coast Conference to remove events from the state, the A.C.C. announced it was again open to placing neutral-site championships there.

title: Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal Will Meet for Miami Open Title
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Roger Federer cannot quite figure out why his longtime rival Rafael Nadal has never won the Miami Open.

title: Protests Erupt in Paraguay Over Efforts to Extend Presidents Term
description: Protesters in Paraguay stormed the Congress and set fire to part of the building on Friday after the Senate voted to amend the Constitution to allow President Horacio Cartes to seek re-election, raising concerns over renewed political instability.

title: 3 Arrested in Fire That Caused Atlanta Highway Collapse
description: ATLANTA  City Fire Department investigators arrested three people on Friday on suspicion of involvement in the fire that caused a crucial elevated stretch of an Atlanta highway to collapse a day earlier and could cause months of major traffic headaches here.

title: Penguins Defeat Rangers in Overtime Contest Worthy of the Postseason
description: When the Pittsburgh Penguins visited the Rangers at Madison Square Garden on Friday, both playoff-bound teams were primarily trying to stay healthy and iron out lineup kinks with just over a week left in the regular season.

title: Gilbert Baker, Gay Activist Who Created the Rainbow Flag, Dies at 65
description: Gilbert Baker, a self-described gay Betsy Ross who in 1978 hand-dyed and stitched together eight strips of vibrantly colored fabric into a rainbow flag, instantly creating an enduring international symbol of gay pride, was found dead on Friday at his home in New York City. He was 65.

title: Bannon Made Millions in Shaping Right-Wing Thought
description: The personal wealth and holdings of President Trumps chief strategist, Stephen K. Bannon, were detailed for the first time on Friday in a filing that showed a large chunk of his income coming from right-leaning political news, film and consulting companies.

title: Five Must-See Shows if Youre in New York This Month
description: April, known as the month of deluges, is certainly flooding New Yorks theater landscape. There are 14  count em 14  shows opening on Broadway, with more off-center forms of entertainment cropping up like wild crocuses all over the rest of the city. Audience members can submerge themselves in everything from the brassy manipulations of a little old matchmaker named Dolly (embodied by a little old diva named Bette) to the more recessive mysteries of humanity according to American theaters patron saint of the inarticulate, Annie Baker.

title: Style on Taipeis Streets: A Brando Look and a Lot of Berets
description: Taiwan itself has a huge influence from Japanese culture, Chinese culture and now, more and more so, Korean culture, Mr. Xu said of the month he spent in Taipei. So it is present in the culture, in entertainment and in its fashion.

title: Connecticuts 111-Game Winning Streak Ends With Loss to Mississippi State
description: DALLAS  Sixty.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie and Red Dwarf
description: Seeking amusement at the end of a tense week, sweetie darlings? Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie arrives on HBO. Keep up the British theme all weekend with full seasons of Catastrophe and Red Dwarf.

title: At Home in Vancouver
description: Downtown, try any of the ramen joints on Robson Street. Or, go for the cutting-edge Royal Dinette (905 Dunsmuir Street; royaldinette.ca). The smoked Castelvatrano olives alone justify the visit.

title: And They Wonder Why We Still Need Feminism
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: My Vancouver: An Ever-Unfolding Story
description: Vancouver has what you might call an improvisational air. The city makes itself up as it goes along because we are all really complete newbies here, excepting, of course, the Musqueam, Squamish and Tsleil-Waututh peoples on whose unceded territory the whole Vancouver project has been and continues to be built.

title: A Real Estate Boom, Powered by Pot
description: QUINCY, Mass.  At the edge of an industrial park in this suburb south of Boston, past a used-car auction lot and a defunct cheese factory, is an unmarked warehouse bristling with security cameras and bustling with activity. Until recently, the cinder-block structure was home to a wholesale florist, a granite cutter and a screen printer. Today, it is home to just one tenant: a medical marijuana operation called Ermont.

title: Can Marijuana Real Estate Maintain Its High?
description: Across the country, medical marijuana operations are repurposing old, industrial spaces. But as legal weed gets cheaper, will the high cost of retrofitting pay off? Tour a new, indoor operation in Quincy, Mass., in this 360 video.

title: Peretti Siblings Share a Sense of Humor, Not Just Genes
description: LOS ANGELES  Get Out is totally about our family! Chelsea Peretti, the stand-up comic, actress and writer, said as she punched her brother, Jonah Peretti, on the arm.

title: Love Lessons From the (Very) First Couple
description: On a family trip to Rome a few years ago, I had the brilliant idea to take my sleep-deprived young daughters to the Vatican. It didnt go well. This is boooring!

title: My Son, My Daughter: A Mothers Evolution
description: Isabel Rose, the telegenic heiress to one of New Yorks best-known real estate dynasties, has always had an ability to make her publicity-wary family squirm.

description: Robert King conducts the Kings Consort.

title: John Brownes O Maria salvatoris
description: Performed by the Tallis Scholars

title: International Court Says Violence in Congo May Amount to War Crimes
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  Recent acts of violence in the Democratic Republic of Congo, including the murder of two United Nations researchers and the discovery of 23 mass graves in the Kasa region, may constitute war crimes, the chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said on Friday.

title: Benjamin Brittens A Hymn to the Virgin
description: Mark Williams directs the Choir of Jesus College, Cambridge.

title: Herbert Howellss A Hymn for St Cecilia
description: John Scott conducts the St. Pauls Cathedral Choir.

title: William Byrds Infelix ego
description: Performed by the Tallis Scholars

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: When Twitter Confuses and Facebook Copies
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Nico Muhly on Why Choral Music Is Slow Food for the Soul
description: Nico Muhly is a composer whose work has included collaborations with Bjrk and the choreographer Benjamin Millepied. His opera Two Boys was produced in 2013 by the Metropolitan Opera, which will present his Marnie in the 2018-19 season.

title: Bill OReilly Thrives at Fox News, Even as Harassment Settlements Add Up
description: For nearly two decades, Bill OReilly has been Fox Newss top asset, building the No. 1 program in cable news for a network that has pulled in billions of dollars in revenues for its parent company, 21st Century Fox.

title: A Pentagon Test for Boeings Mr. Fix-It
description: In 2007, Boeings chief executive, W. James McNerney Jr., put out an S O S call to the head of the companys military business. Boeing had bet its future on a revolutionary passenger jet, the 787 Dreamliner, and the project was imperiled by delays and cost overruns.

title: Dealing with a Mouse Infestation
description: Q. My daughter, son-in-law and their three little children live in a three-bedroom co-op on the Upper West Side. The apartment is infested with mice, which run across their pillows while they sleep and leave droppings in the babys high chair. Management and a pest control company set sticky traps and made other fixes. The contractor who combined their two apartments did some repairs, too. But the problem continues. Another neighbor on the same line also has mice. Surely other tenants must have them, too. What is the co-ops responsibility?

title: A Voice From Paris on Climate Change
description: Anne Hidalgo, mayor of Paris, is also chairwoman of C40, a network of the worlds biggest cities committed to addressing climate change. As mayor, despite strong opposition, she has closed parts of the city  including along the bank of the Seine River  to traffic. Recently, I asked Ms. Hidalgo about her interest in environmental issues and why women are important to the solutions. Her answers have been edited and condensed.

title: How Women Over 50 Can Keep Their Careers on Track
description: For Debra Dixon, a principal with TwinLogic Strategies, a boutique lobbying firm in Washington, staying on top of her career has required flexibility and fine-tuning.

title: Policyholders in Limbo After Rare Failure of Insurer
description: Something unusual happened last month: A good-size American insurer, Penn Treaty of Allentown, Pa., was ordered to liquidate and wind down its affairs. Its demise will orphan tens of thousands of policyholders  people who bought its long-term-care insurance to shield their families from crushing nursing home costs.

title: Womens Crucial Role in Combating Climate Change
description: The link between climate change and womens rights may seem baffling to some.

title: Moscow and Mongolia, Bridged by Skype
description: Christine Ning-Chiun Yarng and Galen Murphy-Fahlgren were married March 28 at the brides apartment in Arlington, Va. Dr. Apichai Shipper, a Universal Life minister and friend of the couple, officiated.

title: Stephanie Davidson and Dov Waxman:Long Walks Lead to 14 Questions
description: Stephanie Elaine Davidson and Dov Lucien Morris Waxman are to be married April 2 at Alden Castle, an event space in Brookline, Mass. Rabbi Leonard Gordon is to lead the ceremony.

title: After Brexit, Scotland Lays a Path to Another Independence Vote
description: EDINBURGH  Nicola Sturgeon, Scotlands formidable first minister, knows how to play the long game.

title: Spains Desire for Gibraltar Complicates Brexit Talks With E.U.
description: LONDON  To the formidable list of problems facing Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain as she negotiates the nations risky withdrawal from the European Union, add one more: the future of the rocky outcrop of Gibraltar.

title: Conservative Split Over Import Tax Imperils Trumps Overhaul
description: One conservative group produced colorful flow charts warning millennials that a border adjustment tax proposed by Speaker Paul D. Ryan would raise prices on the Jose Cuervo tequila thats in your happy hour margarita.

title: Haitis Violent Politics Are Taken to Court. In Boston.
description: A mysterious death, a decade-old murder and a human rights lawsuit in federal court in Boston are casting a light on the patronage politics of Haiti and its culture of impunity.

title: Variety Puzzle: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  The human brain is an amazing thing, and we have yet to know how it works. We know a few things; but the full scope of how it drives so many different systems is still beyond us.

title: Philippines Leader Vows to Pardon Police Accused in Mayors Death
description: MANILA  President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines suggested on Friday that 19 police officers accused of killing a politician should spare themselves a lengthy trial and plead guilty because he planned to pardon them anyway.

title: Tribes That Live Off Coal Hold Tight to Trumps Promises
description: CROW AGENCY, Mont.  The pale yellow halls of the Crow government building here are nearly empty these days, with 1,000 of this tribes 1,300 employees recently laid off.

title: How Does Populism Turn Authoritarian? Venezuela Is a Case in Point
description: When Hugo Chvez took power in Venezuela nearly 20 years ago, the leftist populism he championed was supposed to save democracy. Instead, it has led to democracys implosion in the country, marked this past week by an attack on the independence of its Legislature.

title: Trump Couple, Now White House Employees, Cant Escape Conflict Laws
description: WASHINGTON  The husband-and-wife team of Jared Kushner and Ivanka Trump, now both senior federal government officials, has been alongside President Trump as the White House has hosted dozens of chief executives and a handful of world leaders in recent weeks.

title: Meet the Obama Holdovers Who Survived Trumps Sweep
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trumps new Middle East envoy began haggling over the details of an agreement with Israel to curb construction of Jewish settlements in the West Bank, they turned to a politically improbable adviser: Yael Lempert, a 43-year-old diplomat who worked on the issue in Barack Obamas White House.

title: Venezuelan Court Revises Ruling That Nullified Legislature
description: IQUITOS, Peru  Venezuelas Supreme Court on Saturday reversed parts of a decision to strip the national legislature of its powers, an abrupt shift that came amid mounting domestic and international criticism that the country was edging toward dictatorship.

title: They Can Hit 400-Foot Homers, but Playing Catch? Thats Tricky
description: In the 40 years that Jack Thomson has been coaching high school baseball, he has seen a noticeable rise in the talent of players trying out for his team.

title: Dazzling Free Skate Lifts Yuzuru Hanyu to World Title
description: HELSINKI, Finland  Javier Fernndez was standing in the interview area on Saturday afternoon after the mens competition at the World Figure Skating Championships.

title: James Rosenquist, Pop Art Pioneer, Dies at 83
description: James Rosenquist, who helped define Pop Art in its 1960s heyday with his boldly scaled painted montages of commercial imagery, died on Friday in New York City. He was 83 years old.

title: In Trump Country, Shock at Trump Budget Cuts, but Still Loyalty
description: TULSA, Okla.  Rhonda McCracken is a kindergarten teacher and a Republican who voted for President Trump. Now shes wrestling with the consequences.

title: Abortion and the Democrats
description: To the Editor:

title: Obamacare Can Survive Trump
description: What will Paul Ryan and the Trump administration do now that they have failed to repeal Obamacare? Theyll try to sabotage it.

title: My I.C.U. Patient Lived. Is That Enough?
description: He is breathing better and the doctors say his lungs will recover, but he cant remember his appointments or where he put his keys.

title: Video Games Arent Addictive
description: Is video game addiction a real thing?

title: Pick Your Favorite Ethics Offender in Trumpland
description: President Trump and his administration are offering the country a graduate-level course in the selling of the presidency. Much attention has focused on how Mr. Trump is using the White House for personal gain, but many other officials, including members of his family, friends and close aides, also stand to rake it in at the publics expense.

title: Why Is This Hate Different From All Other Hate?
description: On March 23, a Jewish teenager was arrested in Israel, accused of being behind the wave of bomb threats that had terrorized Jewish organizations since President Trumps election. For people alarmed about the uptick in religious and ethnic bigotry in the Trump era, this was a shock.

title: First Day of School. Try Not to Stand Out.
description: Nadir and Sandra worry about fitting in, getting home and finding a place to pray.

title: Black and Proud. Even if Strangers Cant Tell.
description: My 11-year-old is understated, but not shy. He likes to bake, loves video games, is loyal to his friends and, biased as I may be, is a pretty good-looking kid. He gets mad sometimes, though, that people dont immediately register him as black. Youre so lucky, he said to me a few months ago. People look at you and know that you are black.

title: Jerks and the Start-Ups They Ruin
description: The tech industry has a problem with bro culture. People have been complaining about it for years. Yet nobody has done much to fix it.

title: El Salvadors Historic Mining Ban
description: The prospect of job creation and short-term returns has prompted several governments in Latin America to welcome mining companies and keep regulation to a minimum. In remote areas, unauthorized miners have sucked up natural resources without regard for the environmental and social damage they leave behind.

title: Who Needs Charters When You Have Public Schools Like These?
description: TULSA, Okla.  The class assignment: Design an iPad video game. For the player to win, a cow must cross a two-lane highway, dodging constant traffic. If she makes it, the sound of clapping is heard; if shes hit by a car, the game says, Aw.

title: Trump Needs a Brain
description: THE series of columns Ive been writing lately, floating implausible proposals for an ideologically unstable age, has been a useful way of avoiding the depressing subject of the Trump administrations first 100 days  because really, in the face of such incompetence and chaos, what is there to say?

title: Manhood in the Age of Trump
description: One of the dippiest, catchiest commercials of my youth was for Campbells soup. I remember it precisely; I can still sing the snippet of song at its center.

title: Why I Chose a Historically Black College
description: A black school? But youre so smart, you could go anywhere.

title: The Government Gorsuch Wants to Undo
description: At recent Senate hearings to fill the Supreme Courts open seat, Judge Neil Gorsuch came across as a thoroughly bland and nonthreatening nominee. The idea was to give as little ammunition as possible to opponents when his nomination comes up this week for a vote, one that Senate Democrats may try to upend with a filibuster.

title: Yankees Acquire a Taste for the Fountain of Youth
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Confetti rained and fans packed the downtown streets here on Saturday night, as the procession rolled slowly forward. Brett Gardner sat behind the wheel of a flatbed truck that carried Greg Bird and his hairless cat, Mr. Delicious. Aroldis Chapman cruised past in the white Lamborghini he once bought to race his fastball. Dellin Betances poked his head through the sunroof of a stretch limousine that was chauffeured by the team president, Randy Levine.

title: Chechen Authorities Arresting and Killing Gay Men, Russian Paper Says
description: MOSCOW  First, two television reporters vanished. Then a waiter went missing. Over the past week, men ranging in age from 16 to 50 have disappeared from the streets of Chechnya.

title: Mudslide in Colombia: Death Toll Surges to More Than 230
description: More than 230 people were killed, many of them asleep in their beds, when a giant wall of water carrying tons of mud and debris surged through a city in southwest Colombia on Saturday after heavy rains caused a nearby river to overflow, officials said.

title: A Small Guard Upends UConn and Breathes a Little Life Into Her Sport
description: DALLAS  Mississippi State lists its starting point guard, Morgan William, as 5 feet 5 inches.

title: U.S.-Led Coalition Counts 229 Civilian Deaths Before Mosul Strike
description: WASHINGTON  Facing mounting pressure over civilian casualties in American airstrikes, the United States-led coalition fighting the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria said on Saturday that it was likely that at least 229 civilians had been unintentionally killed by its operations since they began in August 2014.

title: Clippers Give Coach Doc Rivers His 800th Victory
description: Blake Griffin scored 36 points, Chris Paul added 29, and the Clippers beat the Lakers in Los Angeles on Saturday, 115-104, giving Coach Doc Rivers his 800th career victory.

title: What Does It Take to Earn Respect? A Puck in the Face.
description: VOORHEES, N.J.  To really irritate Ian Laperriere, the assistant coach in charge of the Philadelphia Flyers penalty-killing unit, all a player needs to do is avoid an opponents slap shot. The Flyers know Laperriere certainly never did that when he played hockey.

title: Sharing the N.H.L. Experience, With a Roommate
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia  It was past midnight when the Pittsburgh Penguins walked into the lobby of an upscale hotel in downtown Vancouver. On the fourth night of a recent trip, they had just flown from Edmonton, where they defeated the Oilers in an overtime shootout.

title: How Much People in the Trump Administration Are Worth
description: A look at the personal wealth of top officials working for President Trump.

title: Qatars World Cup Rsum: Zero Games. 2022 Host.
description: When Brazil beat Paraguay on Tuesday in So Paulo, it became the first nation to lock up a place alongside host Russia in the 2018 World Cup. But hours earlier, and half a world away, another result might have been just as significant.

title: Contract Fight With U.S.A. Hockey Over, Hard Work Begins for Womens Team
description: On Tuesday night, Jocelyne Lamoureux-Davidson and her twin sister, Monique Lamoureux-Morando, helped the United States womens hockey team earn a major victory for gender equity in sports.

title: Initial Description
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  There are all sorts of -nyms in language, with synonyms and antonyms being the best known.

title: Quotation of the Day: Tribes Pinning Hopes on Coal Hold Tight to Trumps Pledges
description: I care about the environment; I really do. But when you see that money, then you dont care. Because youre getting the thing you need.

title: Michael Flynn Failed to Disclose Income From Russia-Linked Entities
description: WASHINGTON  Michael T. Flynn, the national security adviser who was forced out of the job in February, failed to list payments from Russia-linked entities on the first of two financial disclosure forms released Saturday by the Trump administration.

title: Johanna Konta Wins Miami Open to Reach No. 7 in Rankings
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  The WTA Tour is an endless sea of opportunity at the moment. And as each new tournament begins without Serena Williams, the same question arises.

title: Gonzaga Beats South Carolina in Final Four for Shot at Another First
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Mark Few wrote the introduction for a book by his college roommate about the power of perseverance. On Saturday night, the Gonzaga mens basketball team, which Few has built from a midmajor curiosity into a championship contender, provided him with material for a postscript.

description: James Rosenquist helped define Pop Art in its 1960s heyday with his boldly scaled painted montages of commercial imagery.

title: Bill de Blasio Speaks at Funeral for Man Killed in Racist Attack

title: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, Poet Who Stirred a Generation of Soviets, Dies at 83
description: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, an internationally acclaimed poet with the charisma of an actor and the instincts of a politician whose defiant verse inspired a generation of young Russians in their fight against Stalinism during the Cold War, died on Saturday in Tulsa, Okla., where he had been teaching for many years. He was 83.

title: Richard Bolles Dies at 90; Wrote What Color Is Your Parachute?
description: Richard N. Bolles, a former Harvard physics major, Episcopal minister and career counselor whose own twisting vocational path led to his writing What Color Is Your Parachute?  the most popular job-hunters manual of the 1970s and beyond  died on Friday in San Ramon, Calif. He was 90.

title: The Authorities Yielded: Professor Speaks as Ordeal in China Ends
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Feng Chongyi said he ran to the airport in Guangzhou on Saturday as soon as he received the message from Chinese officials: Go.

description: President Trump has surrounded himself with an extraordinarily wealthy group of advisers, who have sprawling assets and income sources.

title: Loose Attitudes and a Tight Finish Put the Tar Heels Back in the Title Game
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  It had been 78 years since Oregon last played in the Final Four. And North Carolina Coach Roy Williams wanted to be clear: He did not remember the game.

title: 10 Baseball Terms That Will Help You Become a Better Crossword Solver
description: Knowing more about America's pastime will help you with your crossword pastime.

title: Luissa Chekowsky, Peter Campbell
description: Luissa Joy Chekowsky and Peter A. Campbell were married March 27 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member in the office of the City Clerk, officiated. On April 1, Jelly Helm, a friend of the couple, led a ceremony, which included Jewish traditions, at the Housing Works Bookstore Cafe in New York.

title: Chunkit Fung, Scott Hartman
description: Dr. Chunkit Fung and Dr. Scott Gregory Hartman were married April 1 at the Down Town Club in Philadelphia. The Rev. Adriene Thorne, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Isabel Garca-Ajofrn, Malcolm Oliver
description: Isabel Garca-Ajofrn Romero-Salazar and Malcolm Khalid Oliver are to be married April 2 at the Ladies Pavilion in Central Park. Lenny Negron, a Universal Life minister, is to officiate.

title: Cole Boyle, Richard Reutter
description: Eleanor Cole Boyle, a daughter of Cynthia Maresca Boyle and John N. Boyle III of Campobello, S.C., was married April 1 to Richard Ragsdale Reutter, a son of Caroline Ragsdale Reutter and Chick Reutter of Spartanburg, S.C. The Rev. Michael E. Bowers, a United Methodist minister, officiated at Jacksons Grove United Methodist Church in Landrum, S.C., where he is the pastor.

title: Lucy Alexander, Braden Murphy
description: Lucy Bruce Alexander and Braden Mathias Murphy were married April 1 at the Georgetown Presbyterian Church in Washington. The Rev. John Graham of Grace Episcopal Church in Washington officiated, and the Rev. Dr. Camille C. Murray, the senior pastor of the Georgetown Presbyterian Church, led the ceremony.

title: Catherine Riley, Yael Tzipori
description: Catherine Virginia Riley and Yael Rebecca Tzipori were married April 1 at the Barn at Gibbet Hill, an event space in Groton, Mass. Ms. Rileys brother, Thomas C. Riley, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Addar Weintraub, William Levi
description: Addar Weintraub, a daughter of Michelle Weintraub and Shlomo Weintraub of San Jose, Calif., was married April 1 to William Ranney Levi, a son of Nancy Ranney Levi and David F. Levi of Durham, N.C. Rabbi Miriam Senturia officiated at the Inn at Park Winters in Winters, Calif., with Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. of the United States Supreme Court taking part by offering personal remarks about the couple.

title: Katie Baron, Andrew Hendrickson
description: C. Katherine Baron and Andrew John Hendrickson were married on April 1 at the Prospect House, an event space in Dripping Springs, Tex. Natalie Finstad, a friend of the couple who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Gina Castellano, Martin Kafafian
description: Gina Marie Castellano and Martin Richard Kafafian were married April 1 at Tappan Hill Mansion in Tarrytown, N.Y. Denny Chin, a judge of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit, for whom the bride served as a law clerk from 2008-9, officiated.

title: Lindsay Eichler, Benjamin Gordon
description: Lindsay Nicole Eichler, a daughter of Terri S. Eichler and Kurt M. Eichler of New Vernon, N.J., was married April 1 to Benjamin Howard Gordon, a son of Barbara L. Gordon and Robert J. Gordon of Birmingham, Mich. Rabbi Arianna Gordon, the grooms sister, led the ceremony at the Rainbow Room in New York City.

title: Hadas Gold, Christopher Hooton
description: Hadas Gold and Christopher Alex Hooton are to be married April 2. Alex ODonnell, a friend of the bride and a Universal Life minister, is to officiate at the Desert Foothills, an event space in Scottsdale, Ariz.

title: Marta Fabrykowski, Matthew OGrady
description: Marta Christina Fabrykowski and Matthew William OGrady were married April 1 at St. Cecilia Parish in Boston. The Rev. John Unni, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Hilary Lister, Daniel Roberti
description: Hilary Elizabeth Lister and Daniel Francis Roberti were married April 1 at St. Marys Church in New Orleans. The Rev. Thomas F. Lynch, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Kevin Korney, Juan Villaseor
description: Kevin Martin Korney and Juan Luis Villaseor were married April 1 at the DeGolyer Estate at the Dallas Arboretum and Botanical Garden. William M. Korney, a brother of the groom who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the event, officiated.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The Finale of Big Little Lies and the Season Premiere of Call the Midwife
description: Big Little Lies, the David E. Kelley mini-series starring Reese Witherspoon and Nicole Kidman, comes to the end of its delicious run. And Call the Midwife begins a sixth season with an unfriendly face.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $450,000
description: 235 East 87th Street, No. 4G, Upper East Side

title: Selfie Lessons From a Chimp (She Stole Our Camera)
description: While reporting at Sweetwaters Chimpanzee Sanctuary in Kenya, Sam Wolson had his 360 camera stolen by a chimp. What resulted: possibly the worlds best 360 video recorded by a chimp.

title: China Learns How to Get Trumps Ear: Through Jared Kushner
description: WASHINGTON  When President Trump welcomes President Xi Jinping of China to his palm-fringed Florida club for two days of meetings on Thursday, the studied informality of the gathering will bear the handiwork of two people: Chinas ambassador to Washington and Mr. Trumps son-in-law, Jared Kushner.

title: Escaping Boko Haram, Women and Children on the Road to Nowhere: A 360 View
description: People fleeing Boko Haram have made their homes along the road, waiting for an end to the violence.

title: Jared Kushner, SpaceX, Baseball: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Gonzaga Earns Chance to Prove It Belongs Among Basketballs Elite
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  Dressed in crisp Nike uniforms, boasting tall and talented players, competing for a coach who has been with the program through 19 straight N.C.A.A. tournament appearances, the Gonzaga Bulldogs looked as blue-blooded as any member of college basketballs aristocracy on Saturday night.

title: Readers Respond: Which Racial Terms Make You Cringe?
description: This is a version of the weekly Race/Related newsletter. To get it in your inbox, sign up here.

title: Key Moments Since 1992, The Year of the Woman
description: The Year of the Woman grew out of the 1992 election, in which a record 47 women won House seats. Heres a look at some major events for women since then.

title: Why Theyre Called to Action at Women in the World
description: This week at the eighth annual Women in the World Summit, led by the journalist Tina Brown, activists will talk about the experiences that ignited their sense of purpose. Here is a sampling.

title: Millicent Fawcett Is First Woman to Get Statue in Londons Parliament Square
description: LONDON  Britain, which has its second female prime minister and a queen who is the worlds longest-reigning monarch, is getting its first statue of a woman in Parliament Square in London, where there are 11 statues of men.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Attack in Jackson Heights Leaves Two Transgender Women Living in Fear
description: Nayra and Gabriela dont go out much these days, and not just because the two roommates are homebodies. When they venture outside their apartment in Queens, their hesitation is caused as much by emotional wounds as by physical injuries. The two friends are trans women, and though their Jackson Heights neighborhood has a reputation as a welcoming community for gays and lesbians, hate crimes against transgender women have alarmed many in the area.

title: Camden Police Policy on Escorting Victims
description: A directive from Chief John S. Thompson of the Camden Police Department on how police officers should treat seriously injured people.

title: Changes in Policing Take Hold in One of the Nations Most Dangerous Cities
description: CAMDEN, N.J.  Every few months, the police chief here asks which officers wrote the most tickets.

title: 20 Are Hacked and Beaten to Death at Pakistani Shrine
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The men and women arrived late on Saturday at a Sufi shrine in a village in central Pakistan. Followers of a self-described mystic, the pilgrims were accustomed to rituals in which they received spiritual guidance and sometimes removed their clothes to be cleansed of their sins.

title: The Boss Baby Bests Beast, Barely, as Box Office No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES  Show business rule of thumb: Never underestimate a tough-talking tot.

title: At Least 9 Civilians Killed as Coalition Strikes Taliban Arsenal, Officials Say
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Officials in Afghanistan said on Sunday they were investigating claims that at least nine civilians, including six children, had been killed when Afghan and coalition forces blew up a Taliban weapons depot in southern Helmand Province.

title: Xi Jinping, Ivanka Trump, Colombia: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Colombia Mudslide Sends Rescuers and Relatives on Race to Find Survivors
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Gildardo Ramrez reached Mocoa on Sunday, only to find a scene of rubble where his Aunt Claudias neighborhood had been. He looked desperately through the ruins for his missing aunt, who he said had not been seen since a flood of mud and debris plowed through Mocoa the night before.

title: Heng on Hong Kongs New Leader
description: A committee dominated by supporters of the Chinese government chose Carrie Lam as Hong Kongs next leader on Sunday, opting for Beijings preferred candidate in a move likely to dismay residents who see the citys freedoms as being under threat from China.

title: Peak Performances Devotes Season to Works by Women
description: When Kaija Saariahos LAmour de Loin opened at the Metropolitan Opera in December, it was the first opera by a woman to be performed at the Met in 113 years. The work opened a discussion about the gender gap in classical music and other fields, and  organizations such as Opera America and Prototype have recently made efforts to provide equal opportunities for female creators. Now Montclair State University in Montclair, N.J., is going a step further: Its upcoming Peak Performances season will entirely consist of new works by women. The lineup features premieres across music, theater and dance, including from the composer Ashley Fure, the choreographer Pam Tanowitz and the theater director Karin Coonrod.

title: Facebook Pushes Outside Law Firms to Become More Diverse
description: Like other Silicon Valley giants, Facebook has faced criticism over whether its work force and board are too white and too male. Last year, the social media behemoth started a new push on diversity in hiring and retention.

title: The Ad Feels a Bit Like Oscar Bait, but Its Trying to Sell You an iPhone
description: Carrie Brownstein, the actress known for the series Portlandia, wrote and directed a short film last fall that pokes fun at the exaggerated comments people post under pictures of celebrities on social media, showing what would happen if reverential remarks like Mom or marry me played out in the real world.

title: In One Crime-Ridden City, Police Try a New Tactic: Patience
description: In Camden, N.J., one of America's most violent cities, officers are being trained to exercise restraint in situations where they may have previously resorted to deadly force.

title: 2 Survivors of Canadas First Quintuplet Clan Reluctantly Re-emerge
description: NORTH BAY, Ontario  The tiny log house alongside the Trans-Canada Highway is easy to miss among the strip malls, fast-food outlets and car dealers. But 83 years ago, it was the eye of a publicity maelstrom because of a one-in-a-billion event: the birth of five identical baby girls.

title: In Ohio County That Backed Trump, Word of Housing Cuts Stirs Fear
description: KINSMAN, Ohio  For years, Tammy and Joseph Pavlic tried to ignore the cracked ceiling in their living room, the growing hole next to their shower and the deteriorating roof they feared might one day give out. Mr. Pavlic worked for decades installing and repairing air-conditioning and heating units, but three years ago, with multiple sclerosis advancing, he had to leave his job.

title: Township High School District Settlement
description: The legal agreement an Illinois school district reached with the Department of Education.

title: A Transgender Student Won Her Battle. Now Its War.
description: PALATINE, Ill.  Tall and sylphlike, an athlete with delicate features and a blond topknot, she changes clothes behind a privacy curtain in the girls locker room at her high school. But just being allowed to set foot in that locker room was a huge victory for the girl. She is transgender.

title: Legal Team That Includes Giuliani Pushes for Deal, Just Not With Prosecutors
description: The case of Reza Zarrab in federal court in Manhattan has been far from routine.

title: Moonlight Wins at Glaad Media Awards
description: Tally up another award for Moonlight. The movie won for outstanding film, wide release, at the 28th annual Glaad Media Awards on Saturday night, presented by the group formerly known as the Gay and Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation. Moonlight depicts the coming-of-age story of a gay protagonist who reckons with his sexuality amid a tumultuous upbringing in Miami, and it won the Oscar for best picture in February.

title: Now Batting: 14 New Baseball Books
description: It happens every spring. Its time to play ball, so publishers fill out a new lineup card of biographies, team histories and other baseball scholarship. This season must begin by acknowledging the surreality that after 108 years, the Chicago Cubs are again World Series champions. The Plan (Triumph, $24.95), by David Kaplan, is a chronicle of the project to turn one of the worst organizations in baseball into a dynasty in the making. Kaplan starts with the 2009 purchase of the franchise by Tom Ricketts, and the subsequent wooing of Theo Epstein, the general manager behind two titles for the formerly cursed Boston Red Sox. Chicagos farm system is stocked and Joe Maddon, the Tampa Bay Rays manager, is signed ahead of the 2015 season. Add youngsters like Kris Bryant and Kyle Schwarber, and free agents like Jon Lester, and a long-losing club is finally No. 1. Theres too much front-office esoterica  one appendix lists clauses from rooftop-seating contracts for buildings around Wrigley Field  but Cubs fans wont mind.

title: Review: Diving Into the Lake for a Respighi Rarity at City Opera
description: During 70 adventurous if sometimes financially shaky years, the old New York City Opera regularly presented overlooked, even forgotten works. That valued aspect of its mission has been embraced by the management team that has been attempting to reconstitute the company.

title: Review: John Adamss Gospel Displays an Orchestral Wizards Tuneful Ear
description: The passage I cant get out of my head from John Adamss The Gospel According to the Other Mary is a mere snap of the fingers, all of 20 seconds long in a two-hour score. It comes at the start of the tenor aria that closes the first act of this grand biblical oratorio from 2012, modeled on the Bach Passions. The text is a poem about Passover by Primo Levi, which begins with a simple, almost offhand question: Tell me, how is this night different from all other nights?

title: Cambodia Appeals to Trump to Forgive War-Era Debt
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  During the Vietnam War, the United States lent hundreds of millions of dollars to Cambodias flailing government to feed and clothe refugees  even as American B-52s drove many of those same people from their villages by carpet-bombing the countryside.

title: N.E.A. to Honor Jazz Masters Under a Cloud of Uncertainty
description: The National Endowment for the Arts will hand out prizes to five jazz luminaries on Monday in the 35th annual N.E.A. Jazz Masters award ceremony. But a thread of anxiety is likely to run through the proceedings at the Kennedy Center in Washington.

title: Yankees Stumble Out of the Gate Again and Fall to the Rays
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Along with the pomp, the circumstance and the red-white-and-blue bunting that accompany the start of the baseball season, the Yankees have established their own opening-day tradition: laying an egg.

title: No License Plates Here: Using Art to Transcend Prison Walls
description: SOLEDAD, Calif.  More than most artists, the men who gather twice a week for mural class in the B Facility are accustomed to darkness.

title: Alexei Abrikosov, Nobel Laureate in Physics, Dies at 88
description: Alexei Abrikosov, who shared the Nobel Prize in Physics in 2003 for important insights into how certain materials conduct electricity without resistance, died on Wednesday at his home in Sunnyvale, Calif. He was 88.

title: Negotiations Intensify Over New Deal for U.S. Womens Soccer Team
description: More than a dozen members of the United States womens national soccer team took part in hours of negotiating sessions with U.S. Soccer representatives over the weekend. It was a renewed  and potentially promising  push to complete a new collective bargaining agreement before many players scatter for the start of their league season in two weeks.

title: Mexico Ready to Play the Corn Card in Trade Talks
description: MEXICO CITY  From the hundreds of millions of tortillas consumed every year to the countless tons of corn-enriched feed that fattens livestock and poultry, corn is perhaps Mexicos most important agricultural commodity, one at the center of its life and culture.

title: Rough Estimates
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  What a lovely way to celebrate the opening day of the baseball season. Its a prophetic follow up to 10 Baseball Terms That Will Make You a Better Crossword Solver, the first in a new Wordplay series designed to help solvers with topical weak spots.

title: Serbias Prime Minister Projected to Win Presidency, Consolidating Control
description: BELGRADE, Serbia  Prime Minister Aleksandar Vucic appeared headed toward a first-round victory in Serbias presidential election on Sunday, winning more than 50 percent of the vote among a field of 11 candidates, according to exit polls and early results.

title: No Corrections: April 3, 2017
description: No Corrections appeared in print on Monday, April 3, 2017.

title: One Team, 406 Goals, a Million Stories: Mr. Ranger Is Still Making Fans
description: Rod Gilbert, wearing a blue tie decorated with tiny hockey players, sauntered through the hallways of Madison Square Garden during a recent Rangers game, and the reaction defined happiness.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of April 3
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Latino Players Welcome a Baseball Reporter Who Speaks the Same Language
description: The first time Fernando Salas, a relief pitcher from Mexico, spoke with reporters after the Mets acquired him from the Los Angeles Angels at the end of August, he gamely tried English, which he is still learning, and was roundly applauded for his efforts.

title: A Hushed Departure at the Met Museum Reveals Entrenched Management Culture
description: In 2010, the Metropolitan Museum of Art hired Erin Coburn away from the J. Paul Getty Museum, lauding her as its first chief officer of digital media  a role created and promoted by the Met director and chief executive, Thomas P. Campbell, as part of his efforts to move the museum into the 21st century.

title: Pakistan Approves Military Hero to Head Tricky Saudi-Led Alliance
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The appointment of a popular Pakistani general to head a Saudi-led alliance of Muslim countries has set off a furor in Pakistan, amid fears that the move could exacerbate sectarian tensions at home.

title: First New Ferry Arrives in New York, After Detour in Alligator Country
description: The first boat in New York Citys new fleet of commuter ferries arrived in the city on Sunday morning, completing a voyage from Alabama that was slowed by a side trip through some Florida mud.

title: Engineering, the Dyson Way
description: Dyson was built on the re-engineering of the vacuum cleaner, but it has come a long way since then, and its ambitions are far larger.

title: Dyson Is the Apple of Appliances (and Just as Secretive)
description: MALMESBURY, England  When Michael Aldred joined the British home electronics maker Dyson two decades ago, he had a simple goal: to quickly build a robotic vacuum cleaner.

title: Pitcher Rafael Montero Claims Last Spot on Mets Roster
description: The Mets settled their roster on Sunday, ahead of Mondays opener against the Atlanta Braves. The last undecided spot on the team went to pitcher Rafael Montero, edging out pitcher Seth Lugo, who will begin the season on the 10-day disabled list. Montero will occupy the final spot in the bullpen.

title: How Uber Uses Psychological Tricks to Push Its Drivers Buttons
description: The start-up has undertaken an extraordinary experiment in behavioral science to subtly entice an independent work force to maximize company revenue.

title: How Much Harder Can a Starter Throw? Noah Syndergaard Could Find Out
description: Human beings are stubborn. There is a strong belief that throwing a baseball repeatedly at high rates of speed can help lead to arm injuries, yet the average velocity of pitches in baseball keeps rising every year.

title: Trump Plans Have Deal Makers Dreaming Big ($100-Billion-Cash-Takeover Big)
description: NEW ORLEANS  It wasnt just cocktails on Bourbon Street or lucky breaks at the blackjack tables that contributed to the buoyant mood of the deal makers who gathered here last week. President Trump  and his support for lower taxes and lighter regulations  also had something to do with it.

title: Cooling Off on a Hot Day at Yankee Stadium
description: Dear Diary:

title: After Another Knee Injury, Derrick Rose Faces Grim Future With Knicks
description: Derrick Rose entered this season with unbridled optimism. The Knicks, he believed, were one of the super teams dotting the N.B.A. landscape, even if just about everyone not associated with the club scoffed at that notion.

title: Tesla Reports Jump in Vehicle Production but Aims for Much More
description: Tesla, the electric-car maker, on Sunday reported strong year-on-year jumps in vehicle deliveries and production in the first quarter, although it still must navigate a key challenge later this year to hit the ambitious targets that its chief executive, Elon Musk, has set for 2018.

title: South Carolina Defeats Mississippi State to Win Womens Title
description: DALLAS  In the final seconds on Sunday, Dawn Staley gave a group hug to her assistant coaches. As confetti showered South Carolinas first womens basketball title winners, she put on a championship cap she had waited a career to wear.

title: Roger Federer Has Found His Form. Now Hell Give the Clay a Rest.
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  The way Roger Federer is playing tennis, it might seem as if its 2006.

title: North Carolinas Obsession With the Rebound Pays Dividends
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  From the sideline, Isaiah Hicks could sense a big play coming from his North Carolina teammate Kennedy Meeks just by the look on his face. Hicks whispered to a teammate, Hes getting this.

title: Gorsuch Supreme Court Nomination Gains More Democratic Support
description: WASHINGTON  A third Democratic senator announced his support on Sunday for President Trumps Supreme Court pick, Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, though Republicans still face the difficult task of gaining enough Democratic votes to confirm Judge Gorsuch without potentially having to change longstanding Senate practice.

title: March Figures for New Car Sales and Hiring Are on the Way
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Trump Aides Disclosures Reveal Surge in Lucrative Political Work
description: Donald F. McGahn II, now President Trumps White House counsel, made $2.4 million as a lawyer with a client list loaded with deep-pocketed conservative groups, from Americans for Prosperity, backed by the conservative billionaires Charles G. and David H. Koch, to the Citizens United Foundation.

title: With Everyone in Tune, Boston Celtics Are a Virtuoso Rebuilding Act
description: Kelly Olynyk, formerly of those aptly nicknamed Gonzaga Bulldogs, watched his favorite college team advance to within 40 basketball minutes of a first national championship on Saturday night in a crowded and boisterous Manhattan establishment.

title: Rikers Island Commission Unveils Plan to Shut Down Jail Complex
description: The independent commission studying Rikers Island officially released its recommendations for closing the troubled jail complex on Sunday, more than a year after the panel was convened and two days after Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York reversed course to back the plan.

title: Quotation of the Day: A New Approach On Camdens Mean Streets
description: They looked at me and said, Well, he looks like he wont get indicted in the next six months  hell do.

title: With No Deal, Cuomo Will Ask for Emergency Budget Measures
description: ALBANY  Faced with a recalcitrant Legislature and a failed negotiating strategy, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said late Sunday that he would introduce emergency legislation to keep the state government in operation after efforts to pass a state budget for the 2017-18 fiscal year faltered during weekend-long talks.

title: Homeland, Season 6, Episode 11: Is Quinn Just a Natural Killer?
description: It may well be the most inadequate utterance in all of human history.

title: Big Little Lies and the Art of Empathy
description: The juicy final episode of HBOs Big Little Lies revealed, as promised, who died and who done it. The murder mystery (if that death can be ruled a murder) was the least of the reasons to watch this mini-series  more on that later  but it did deliver on the minimal promise of the genre. At the end, we got a verdict.

title: Review: The Play That Goes Wrong Upends a Whodunit
description: When your world  or, as it often seems these days, the world  is falling apart, theres perverse comfort in watching things go smash in a safe, contained environment. (And no, the White House doesnt qualify.) Such is the brutal allure of monster truck jams, videos of toddlers falling off trikes and steel-cage wrestling matches.

title: Jared Kushner Visits Iraq on Invitation From Joint Chiefs Chairman
description: Jared Kushner, President Trumps son-in-law, landed in Iraq on Monday, military officials said, visiting the country as the American military is aiding Iraqi forces in their brutal fight to retake Mosul from the Islamic State.

title: In Ecuador, Lenn Moreno Headed for Victory in Presidential Election
description: Lenn Moreno, a 64-year-old former vice president of Ecuador, appeared headed to a second-round win in the countrys presidential election on Sunday. It would be a rare victory for the Latin American left, which has recently suffered stinging election defeats.

title: Billions Season 2, Episode 7: Greed Is Good. Except When Its Not.
description: Theres a great scene in the 2000 financial drama Boiler Room in which a group of young alpha-male brokers, all employed by a legally dubious Long Island brokerage house, gather at a McMansion to watch Oliver Stones Wall Street. The mansion betrays the get-rich-quick ethos that drives the firm. Its owner has made enough money to buy it, but not to appoint it. Theres an entire room devoted to a tanning bed, a pile of unopened moving boxes in the kitchen, and only a big-screen TV and a couch in the living room, where these off-off-Wall Street bros are quoting every line of the film. Theyve studied Wall Street like a sacred text, but for them its not a cautionary tale, its a source of inspiration, with Gordon Gekko as the hero.

title: Feud: Bette and Joan Episode 5: Taking the Stage
description: Its such a famous moment, if youre a fan of Old Hollywood: the Oscars broadcast, 1963. The best actress nominees are read by a debonair Maximilian Schell: Bette Davis for Whatever Happened to Baby Jane?, Geraldine Page for Sweet Bird of Youth, Lee Remick for Days of Wine and Roses, Anne Bancroft for The Miracle Worker, and Katharine Hepburn for Long Days Journey Into Night.

title: Lexi Thompson Loses L.P.G.A. Major After Surprise Four-Stroke Penalty
description: As Lexi Thompson walked up the 18th fairway on Sunday at the L.P.G.A.s first major of the year, she was serenaded by loud chants of Lex-i, leading her eyes to well with tears. It was an incongruous moment that reflected an intensely emotional day in which the popular Thompson won new fans because of the way she lost the tournament.

title: Valuable Sacred Texts Stolen From Brooklyn Synagogue
description: Three people broke into a Brooklyn synagogue on Sunday and stole nine sacred texts valued at over $200,000.

title: The Walking Dead: The Ones Who Live and the One Who Didnt
description: Were the ones who live.

title: The Vin Diesel Formula: Brains, Brawn and Heart
description: Improbable as it may seem, now that he is the anchor of three action franchises, Vin Diesel, 49, started out as an artsy downtown New York kid. He first hit the stage when he was 7, at the Theater for the New City in Greenwich Village.

title: Rene Elise Goldsberry Wears Her Face
description: The Tony Award-winning actress Rene Elise Goldsberry, 46, is known for her Broadway performances  she played Angelica Schuyler Church in Hamilton and had leading roles in Rent and The Lion King  but she has also been making quite an impression on the small screen. She stars opposite Oprah Winfrey in The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks (it will have its premiere on HBO on April 22), and in Netflixs Altered Carbon, as a rebel leader. Raised in Houston and Bloomfield Hills, Mich., Ms. Goldsberry now lives in New York. Her beauty know-how has been influenced both by her stage roles and by TV makeup artists.

title: Word + Quiz: leaven
Google Training Ad Placement Computers to Be Offended
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif.  Over the years, Google trained computer systems to keep copyrighted content and pornography off its YouTube service. But after seeing ads from Coca-Cola, Procter & Gamble and Wal-Mart appear next to racist, anti-Semitic or terrorist videos, its engineers realized their computer models had a blind spot: They did not understand context.

title: Jared Kushner, Syria, Gibraltar: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Meow Madness and Abortion: Stories Women Tell
description: Is your team out of the running? Tune in to Meow Madness for some extremely cute players almost anyone can cheer for. Elsewhere, Abortion: Stories Women Tell visits a state with some of the countrys most restrictive regulations.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | April 3, 2017
description: Updated: April 6, 2017

title: Questions for: Video Games Arent Addictive
description: Article: Video Games Arent Addictive

title: Have You Ever Felt Pressured by Family or Others in Making an Important Decision About Your Future?
description: Who comes to mind when you think about your biggest influences? Do you ever worry youll let people down? Have you ever felt pressured by them when it comes to making big decisions, such as where to go to college, what to study, what jobs you should pursue, and so on?

title: Walden Pond: Where You Find More Selfies than Self Reflection
description: Walden Pond may conjure images of a New England idyll. But the modern world has invaded Thoreaus touchstone.

title: Who Is the Victim in the Anna Stubblefield Case?
description: In October 2015, a New Jersey jury convicted Anna Stubblefield, a former professor of ethics at Rutgers University, on two counts of aggravated sexual assault on a 29-year-old man with severe cerebral palsy, known in the court records as D.J. The prosecution claimed that D.J. is sufficiently intellectually disabled to be incapable of consenting to sex and then alleged that Stubblefield had exploited and raped him.
