description: To the Editor:

title: Fleeing From America
description: To the Editor:

title: Of Profit and Justice
description: To the Editor:

title: A Cornerstone of Peace at Risk
description: One of the big security decisions facing the Trump administration in the next few months is what to do about Russias violation of a 30-year-old treaty that bans intermediate-range missiles based on land. How the administration reacts will say a lot about how it views the threat from Russia and will have a profound effect on European security.

title: Closing Rikers Without a Road Map
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio is suddenly on the side of closing Rikers Island, the New York City jail complex synonymous with brutality, incompetence, corruption and neglect. If there is one place that exemplifies the national disgrace of mass incarceration, of inmates languishing without trial, of the warehousing of those with mental illnesses, its Rikers.

title: Michigan Is Forced to Do Right by Flint, Finally
description: After shirking its responsibility for years, Michigan has agreed to resolve an environmental crisis it created in Flint, by replacing thousands of lead pipes that have poisoned the citys water. Thats good news, but its shameful that it took a lawsuit to make it happen.

title: What Was Lenin Thinking?
description: LONDON  What was Vladimir Lenin thinking on the long journey to Petrograds Finland Station in 1917?

title: Dont Use the Ballot to Get Trumps Tax Returns
description: MALIBU, Calif.  Opponents of Donald Trump were outraged when, flouting recent tradition, he refused to disclose his tax returns during the 2016 presidential campaign. They remain outraged that he continues to decline to do so as president.

title: Trump Is Wimping Out on Trade
description: During the campaign, Donald Trump talked loudly and often about how he was going to renegotiate Americas horrible trade deals, bringing back millions of good jobs. So far, however, nothing has happened. Not only is Trumpist trade policy  Trumptrade?  nowhere to be seen in practice; there isnt even any indication of what it will involve.

title: Dwindling Odds of Coincidence
description: We are still not conclusively able to connect the dots on the question of whether there was any coordination or collusion between members of Donald Trumps campaign and the Russians who interfered in our election to benefit him, but those dots do continue to multiply at an alarming rate.

title: Walden Pond: Where You Find More Selfies Than Self-Reflection
description: Walden Pond has never quite been the pristine, secluded wilderness Henry David Thoreau made it out to be in his book Walden; or Life in the Woods. The Fitchburg Railroad opened next to the pond the same month Thoreau moved in 1845 to the cabin in the woods owned by his friend Ralph Waldo Emerson, and Frederic Tudor harvested ice on the pond for export throughout Thoreaus two years there. After Thoreau left, Walden Pond briefly was the site of an amusement park, and in the 1930s, it sometimes drew tens of thousands of visitors in a single day.

title: Mitch McConnells Nuclear Trigger Finger
description: In the 1944 noir film Gaslight, a villain hides his crimes by convincing his innocent wife shes insane, feeding her barely perceptible lies and altering small aspects of her environment until she doubts her own instincts and observations.

title: A Memoir of Motherhood Lost
description: THE RULES DO NOT APPLY A Memoir By Ariel Levy 207 pp. Random House. $27.

title: Senate Judiciary Committee Approves Gorsuch in Party-Line Vote
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee, in a party-line, 11-to-9 vote, sent the nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch for the Supreme Court to the full Senate for consideration.

title: Trump Budget Leaves New York-Area Transit Projects Up in the Air
description: When the new president is a lifelong New Yorker promising a trillion-dollar infrastructure plan, many believed New York would be first in line to benefit from the spending spree.

title: Its Not Their Pop Idol, but a Bot. Fans Cheer Anyway.
description: In January, Christina Ausset, a 24-year-old Maroon 5 fan in France, spotted an enticing Twitter post from another of the bands followers: I just had a conversation with Maroon 5! Awesome!

title: An Idaho Town Bucks the Perception of Rural Struggle
description: TWIN FALLS, Idaho  Lost jobs, empty storefronts and shrinking populations. Its an image of rural America ingrained in many peoples minds, and one that was often reinforced in the election.

title: A Border Towns Fragile Revival
description: When the nearby border entry closed in 2002, Boquillas del Carmen in Mexico was virtually abandoned. Since reopening in 2012, the town has once again become a tourist attraction, but the proposed border wall could pose a threat.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Strength, Encapsulated in an Online Ad for Lithium
description: WASHINGTON  The online ad reads like something only a metallurgist could love: an offer to sell 22 pounds of highly pure lithium 6 every month, set for delivery from the port of Dandong, China.

title: Good News for Older Mothers
description: The first time I got pregnant, I was a comparatively young mother, for my demographic: I was 25, in medical school, surrounded by classmates who, for the most part, were not reproducing yet. By the third pregnancy, 11 years later, I was over 35, which classified me, in the obstetric terminology I had learned in medical school, as an elderly multigravida, that is, someone who was having a child but not her first child, after 35. (If it was your first child, you were an elderly primigravida, or elderly primip for short  even as a medical student, I had a strong sense that no woman had invented this terminology.)

title: Birth Control Causes Depression? Not So Fast
description: One of the biggest American public health victories of the last decade has been the record low reached in the teenage birthrate. Along with that have been lows in rates for teenage pregnancy and abortion. Most researchers believe that improved access to contraception is a large part of this success.

title: St. Petersburg, Neil Gorsuch, N.C.A.A. Tournament: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: How to Find Your Missing Keys and Stop Losing Other Things
description: You were sure you left the keys right there on the counter, and now they are nowhere to be found.

title: The Daily: Investigating Bill OReilly
description: Listen to The Daily: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Hiroshi Sugimotos Most Ambitious Project
description: A closer look at his Enoura Observatory, a complex in the Enoura district of Odawara, a city on the eastern coast of Japan.

title: The Veteran Photographer Making Stunning New Buildings
description: WITHOUT WARNING, the Japanese artist Hiroshi Sugimoto begins to sing. Moments before, he had been guiding me through his minimalist penthouse loft in a verdant neighborhood of Tokyo, explaining in a voice barely louder than a whisper why white Japanese shikkui plaster is the most beautiful surface on which to view shadows. Then, in a soaring tenor, he starts belting out Handels Lascia chio pianga, his strong voice echoing off the bare walls.

title: Reckitt Benckiser Review Could Put Frenchs Mustard Up for Sale
description: LONDON  Frenchs mustard and Franks Red Hot sauce may become the latest mainstays of American kitchens to go up for sale.

title: Turning Negative Thinkers Into Positive Ones
description: Most mornings as I leave the Y after my swim and shower, I cross paths with a coterie of toddlers entering with their caregivers for a kid-oriented activity. I cant resist saying hello, requesting a high-five, and wishing them a fun time. I leave the Y grinning from ear to ear, uplifted not just by my own workout but even more so by my interaction with these darling representatives of the next generation.

title: New York Today: A Belated Budget
description: Updated, 11:58 a.m.

title: Japan Envoy, Recalled Over Comfort Woman Statue, Is Returning to Seoul
description: TOKYO  Japan said on Monday that its envoy to South Korea would return to Seoul, three months after he was recalled in a dispute arising from the sensitive issue of Korean women forced into sexual servitude for Japanese soldiers during World War II.

title: This Is Not Fake News (but Dont Go by the Headline)
description: Fake news  a neologism to describe stories that are just not true, like Pizzagate, and a term now co-opted to characterize unfavorable news  has given new urgency to the teaching of media literacy. Are Americans less able to assess credibility? Can they discern real news from disinformation?

title: Middlebury, My Divided Campus
description: Edward J. Snowden was beamed into Wilson Hall at Middlebury College on March 16, the same hall in which Charles Murray was to speak on March 2.

title: Young People and the Fear of Following
description: To the Editor:

title: 1892: Futile Attempt to Force U.K. Governments Hand
description: Mr. Labouchere is sometimes a very awkward customer for the Government to tackle, for he is pertinacious, obstinate, and not easily thrown off the track when once he gets on it. He has the advantage of finding the House of Commons willing to listen to him, for he usually manages to provide it with a little amusement; and a weary Legislature, suffering too often under the infliction of a whole tribe of bores, is always grateful to anybody who can provide food for laughter, or even for a smile. Therefore Mr. Labouchere is in some respects a favorite, and can often take a license which might not be permitted to a less dexterous hand.

title: Explosion in St. Petersburg, Russia, Kills 11 as Vladimir Putin Visits
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  It was 2:40 p.m. on Monday, a lull before the evening rush hour in Russias second-largest city, St. Petersburg, where the subway normally carries two million people a day. The train had just entered a tunnel between stations, on its way out of a sprawling downtown hub, when the bomb exploded.

title: Inviting the Easter Bunny to the Seder
description: I went on my first Easter egg hunt a couple of years ago, hand in hand with my then 2-year-old son, Max. Ive got 44 years on him, but it was a first for both of us.

title: California Today: Your Responses on a State Single-Payer System
description: Good morning.

title: A Museum About Soccer, and About Germany
description: DORTMUND, Germany  In Germany, museums are usually hallowed, hushed halls of high culture. The brash concrete-and-glass structure right outside the main railway station of this changing Ruhr city breaks the mold.

title: New York Times Elevates Sam Dolnick to Masthead
description: The New York Times continues to add to the ranks of its top newsroom editors.

title: Beating of Asylum Seeker in London Is Said to Be Hate Crime
description: LONDON  The Kurdish-Iranian teenager was waiting with friends at a bus stop in south London when a gang of men and women in their 20s cornered him and asked him in aggressive tones where he was from.

title: Cowen Group to Buy Brokerage Firm Convergex for $116 Million
description: The Cowen Group said on Monday that it had agreed to acquire the brokerage firm Convergex Group as it looks to bolster its sales and trading business.

title: A Gatsby Reboot Traces a Black Familys Fortunes
description: NO ONE IS COMING TO SAVE US By Stephanie Powell Watts 371 pp. Ecco/HarperCollins Publishers. $26.99.

title: A Trump Talk Show, Courtesy of Comedy Central
description: President Trump has been the target of the late-night comics for long enough, so its only fair that he should get a late-night program of his own.

title: Germanys War Over a Word
description: Europe is being torn apart; divided by the aftershocks of the financial crisis, Europeans seem able to find common ground only in a common enemy. To hear Geert Wilders of the Netherlands or the U.K. Independence Party in Britain tell it, the crisis is not just about refugees: The influx of primarily Muslims is a threat to Western civilization itself, on par with the Arab invasions of the seventh century and the Ottoman invasions of the 16th.

title: The American Tale of the Citgo Sign
description: Baseball fans love to hate what we see as the commercialization of the sport. The San Francisco Giants, for instance, came in for mockery when Candlestick Park was renamed 3Com Park, and when the team moved to Pacific Bell Park, which was renamed SBC Park, which was renamed AT&T Park.

title: At Kushners Flagship Building, Mounting Debt and a Foundered Deal
description: The Fifth Avenue skyscraper was supposed to be the Kushner Companies flagship in the heart of Manhattan  a record-setting $1.8 billion souvenir proclaiming that the New Jersey developers Charles Kushner and his son Jared were playing in the big leagues.

title: Trade After the Trans-Pacific Partnership
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  In mid-March, ministers and high-level representatives from nations that have signed on to the Trans-Pacific Partnership, as well as China, Colombia and South Korea, met for the first time since the Trump administration withdrew from the trade accord. The signal from Via del Mar, Chile, where the meeting took place, was clear: Multilateral trade and Pacific integration are alive and kicking.

title: New Jersey Transit Train Derails at Penn Station
description: The second minor train derailment at Penn Station in two weeks caused New Jersey Transit service to be suspended in and out of the Manhattan hub on Monday.

title: Within Hours, Plans for a Quiet Corner of China Send Home Prices Soaring
description: SHANGHAI  A residential and industrial area roughly 80 miles south of Beijing once barely registered on Chinas economic map. Consisting mostly of apartment buildings, villages, wetlands and empty fields, it has primarily been known for its donkey burgers.

title: Where the St. Petersburg Metro Explosion Occurred
description: A blast near a subway station in St. Petersburg killed several people on Monday afternoon.

title: Recipes for a Better Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The Digital Nomad Life: Combining Work and Travel
description: On a recent afternoon in Medelln, Colombia, a group of 22 out-of-towners gathered to brainstorm and then met up with locals.

title: Maoists for Trump? In China, Fans Admire His Nationalist Views
description: BEIJING  They protest, picket and sing to defend Maos memory, yearning for the East to be red again. But lately some of Chinas Maoists are finding inspiration in an unlikely insurgent in the West: Donald J. Trump.

title: 9 Ways to Get the Most Out of Your Times Subscription
description: The New York Times publishes as many as 200 stories a day. Our correspondents were on the ground in more than 160 countries last year, and in every state. Their work includes authoritative coverage of current affairs, the arts and business, as well as guidance on how to live a smarter, more cultured life.

title: M.T.A. Shortens L Train Shutdown to 15 Months
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authority had good news on Monday for subway riders worried about the shutdown of the L train: The closing will be shorter than expected.

title: Trump Tries to Deflect Russia Scrutiny, Citing Crooked Scheme by Obama
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump sought to turn attention away from the Russia investigation on Monday, saying that the real story was what he called a crooked scheme against us by President Barack Obamas team to mine American intelligence reports for information about him during last years presidential campaign.

title: What Makes a City Ant? Maybe Just 100 Years of Evolution
description: It can often take millenniums for organisms to evolve. But for crumb-size acorn ants in Cleveland, a single human life span may have been enough for them to become adapted to city living.

title: Supreme Court to Weigh if Firms Can Be Sued in Human Rights Cases
description: The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to decide whether corporations may be sued in American courts for complicity in human rights abuses abroad.

title: Back to the Professionals: The Best N.B.A. Games This Week
description: With the N.C.A.A. tournament wrapping up, basketball fans can shift their focus back to the N.B.A. this week  just in time for a sprint to the end of the regular season.

title: What Happens to Spores in Space?
description: Q. Are any microbes hardy enough to survive in outer space?

title: Replacing a Photo in Your Facebook Post
description: Q. After I crop and touch up a picture from my phone camera, I sometimes post the wrong one to my Facebook account because its hard to tell which version is which from the little preview images. Normally, I just delete the post with the wrong photo and upload the right one, but sometimes I dont notice right away and people have already commented. Is there a way to replace the old picture with the new one without losing the comments?

title: Volkswagen Share Sale Keeps the Automaker a Family Affair
description: Ferdinand Pich, a former chief executive of Volkswagen who was a dominant presence at the carmaker for more than two decades, has agreed to sell most of his 15 percent stake in the family holding company to his relatives rather than to an outside investor. The stake was valued at more than $1 billion.

title: More Trouble at Fox News: Ailes Faces New Sexual Claims and OReilly Loses Two Advertisers
description: The sexual harassment scandal that engulfed Fox News last year and led to the ouster of its chairman, Roger Ailes, continued to batter the network on Monday, as a new lawsuit described unwanted sexual advances by Mr. Ailes and two major advertisers pulled their spots from the show of its top-rated host, Bill OReilly.

title: Computer Hackers Again Gain Access to Athletes Private Medical Records
description: Track and fields global governing body  the sports organization that has most forcefully disciplined Russia for state-sponsored doping  said on Monday that its computer network had been compromised by the same Russian cyberespionage group that American intelligence officials have tied to a broad effort to influence the United States presidential election. The hackers were able to gain access to athletes private medical records, the track and field body said.

title: Mexican Newspaper Shuts Down, Saying It Is Too Dangerous to Continue
description: With the headline Adios! in large type emblazoned across its front page, a newspaper in Ciudad Jurez, Mexico, announced on Sunday that it was shutting down after nearly 30 years after three journalists from other news organizations were killed last month.

title: Jam to Bring Back a Taste of Summer Vacation
description: The season for wild blueberries in Maine is brief, but that taste of summer can now be enjoyed year-round. Bleuberet Artisanal Foods in Ellsworth, Me., gathers enough fruit in July and August to produce these dark, rich jams. You cant go wrong with the plain one, called In the Buff, but I preferred Lavenders Bleu, kissed with the fragrant flower. Blimey has an edge, thanks to some lime, and the spiced variety pushes the envelope toward chutney: Bleuberet jams, $13 for 7.75 ounces, bleuberets.com.

title: In Gorsuch Confirmation Battle, Both Sides Spin and Mislead
description: WASHINGTON  In the rhetorical battle over Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, President Trumps Supreme Court nominee, senators in both parties have been selectively arguing the facts on the jurist and overstating the Senates procedural history.

title: Drakes More Life Spends a Second Week at No. 1, Boosted by 253 Million Streams
description: Last week Drake set a new streaming record on the music charts, and even with a big drop in Week 2, he is still surpassing the old record  his own.

title: With Arrival of Avocado Bar, Brooklyn Has It All
description: This innovative bar is the place for avocado everything: smoothies, salads and, yes, toast. Francesco Brachetti, a native of Florence, Italy, fell for avocados while living in Mexico. Theyre tasty and healthy, and I ate them every day, he said. We didnt have them in Italy. He persuaded a cousin, the chef Alberto Gramini, also from Florence, and a friend, Alessandro Biggi, from Modena, to go into the avocado business with him. Their avocado bar, decorated with Moroccan tiles, serves other specialties like tuna and avocado ceviche, all to go. The organically grown fruits come from a cooperative in the Mexican state of Michoacn: Avocaderia, Industry City, 254 36th Street (Third Avenue), Sunset Park, Brooklyn, 415-702-8806, avocaderia.com.

title: What You Should Read About the Big Little Lies Finale
description: Big Little Lies Where to watch: HBOAdd it to your Watchlist

title: Matzo With a Helping of Motherly Love
description: The Matzo Project sells crisp and tasty matzos (salted or with everything seasonings) in fun boxes bearing motherly admonitions (Eat something!). What began as a Brooklyn experiment last year is now available nationwide and online. There are also matzo chips (salted, everything and cinnamon-sugar). The products are kosher, but not kosher for Passover: Matzo Project, three boxes of matzos, $25; 12 large or 24 small bags of chips, $42, matzoproject.com.

title: Tech Roundup: Googles Ad Issues Expose a Vulnerability
description: There was a time when IBM was a monopolistic giant that looked indestructible. And there was a time when Microsoft looked like the tech company that could never be beaten.

title: Harassment Suit vs. Fox News and Ailes
description: A Fox News contributors sexual harassment lawsuit asserts that she faced retaliation for rebuffing Roger Ailess sexual advances and for refusing to disparage an ex-Fox News host who sued Mr. Ailes.

title: Kosher Ross for the Passover Wine Glass
description: Sales of well-made ros wines continue to climb, and kosher ross are no exception. Jay Buchsbaum, the education director for Royal Wine, a producer, importer and distributor, said their kosher ross sold out nationwide. Many ross have a moderate alcohol level, around 12.5 percent, making them a good choice for Passover, which requires that Seder participants drink four cups of wine. Here are a handful, all kosher for Passover, that I would recommend: Capanes Peraj Petita Rosat 2015 (Spain, $17.71), deep pink, soft and balanced; Psagot Jerusalem Ros 2016 (Israel, $17.99), floral with crisp acidity; Chteau Roubine Cru Class Ctes de Provence 2016 (France, $22.99), pale with subdued fruit; Pacifica Columbia Gorge Ros 2015 (Washington, $17.99), full-bodied with a hint of sweetness; and Goose Bay Pinot Noir Ros 2015 (New Zealand, $20.99), deep pink, floral and nutty: Kosher ross, kosherwine.com.

title: Democrats Vow to Filibuster Ensures Bitter Fight Over Gorsuch
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats on Monday secured the votes necessary to filibuster the Supreme Court nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch, presaging a bitter confrontation this week that threatens to further unravel a chamber where bipartisanship and decorum have eroded for years.

title: Somali Pirates Strike Again, Seizing Indian Vessel and Crew
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  Somali pirates seized a small boat and kidnapped its 11-member Indian crew off the coast of Somalia, local officials said on Monday, the second vessel to be snared recently by the regions resurgent hijackers.

title: Cocktails With Picasso and Calder at MoMA
description: The Modern, the restaurant at the Museum of Modern Art, is expanding food and drink service in the sculpture garden. For the past few years, there have been seats and low tables on the marble terrace, where those waiting to be seated for dinner could order a drink and a snack. Now, theres a sleek cocktail cart featuring gin-and-tonics and a heftier menu with dishes like smoked salmon sliders, king crab fritters and tartes flambes. Counter seating for four in the spacious redesigned kitchen for special tasting menus is also new this spring: The Modern, kitchen counter, $175 per person at lunch, $298 per person at dinner; outdoor dining starting mid-April, 9 West 53rd Street, 212-333-1220, themodernnyc.com.

title: How Do You Improve Upon Mortadella? Add Truffles
description: While visiting northern Italy last fall, I devoured thin, plate-size slices of mortadella studded with bits of black truffle. Often I find that the addition of truffles can be overdone, but this specialty was exquisite, with a complex aroma and deep flavor. Now its available in New York, imported by Rogers Collection from a fourth-generation Bolognese sausage producer: Golfera truffled mortadella, $16 a pound at Bklyn Larder, 228 Flatbush Avenue (Bergen Street), 718-783-1250, bklynlarder.com; and $17.95 a pound at Mekelburgs, 293 Grand Avenue (Greene Avenue), Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, 718-399-2337, mekelburgs.com.

title: Do Seas Make Us Sick? Surfers May Have the Answer
description: LA JOLLA, Calif.  On a recent trip, Cliff Kapono hit some of the more popular surf breaks in Ireland, England and Morocco. Hes proudly Native Hawaiian and no stranger to the hunt for the perfect wave. But this time he was chasing something even more unusual: microbial swabs from fellow surfers.

title: When Conspiracy and Forfeiture Law Intersect
description: Justice Robert H. Jackson once wrote that the modern crime of conspiracy is so vague that it almost defies definition.

title: Leonard Litwin, New York Real Estate Mogul, Dies at 102
description: Leonard Litwin, a rental-property developer who began with his fathers Depression-era plant nursery on Long Island, built a New York City residential real estate empire and paid millions to Republican and Democratic leaders to ensure tax breaks, government financing and favorable rent laws, died on Sunday at his home on Long Island, in Melville. He was 102.

title: Louis C.K.s New Special Mines Comedy From the Middle Ground
description: I once saw George Carlin begin a set with an abortion bit so inflammatory that several people walked out. He framed the issue as one between those who believe a fetus is a baby and those who dont, then staked out his position. I believe its a baby, and we should kill it, Carlin said, give or take a profanity.

title: A Plea on Medicaid
description: To the Editor:

title: Visa Applications Pour In by Truckload Before Door Slams Shut
description: LAGUNA NIGUEL, Calif.  The delivery trucks began arriving with their precious parcels before daybreak, lining up outside a massive government edifice that rises above Orange Countys suburban sprawl.

title: Of Lawyers and Robots
description: To the Editor:

title: Iranian-American Held in Iran Since July Is Said to Be Freed on Bail
description: An American of Iranian descent arrested in Iran in July and sentenced to 18 years imprisonment on dubious charges has been released on bail after he went on a hunger strike, rights activists reported Monday.

title: The Bodies Are Decomposing After Mudslide in Colombia
description: Jos Estrella pulled a handkerchief to cover his face as he began to speak. The air around the morgue in Mocoa was filled with the smell of the dead, he said, who included his sister and two nephews.

title: Trumps Precedent for Claiming Immunity? Clinton v. Jones
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps lawyers made a bold argument in a court filing last week. They said he was too busy and important to respond to lawsuits in state courts over his private conduct so long as he remained in office.

title: Brutal Force at Rikers Island Continues at an Alarming Rate, Report Says
description: Guards at Rikers Island continue to use brutal force against inmates at an alarming rate, punching them in the head, slamming them into walls and then lying about it, according to a report submitted on Monday by a federal monitor overseeing reforms at the jail complex.

title: What 10 Gallery Crawlers Wore to a Downtown Los Angeles Opening
description: The art scene around Downtown Los Angeles has experienced phenomenal growth, with galleries opening in big warehouses along the Los Angeles River (and not without some local controversy). Occupying one gritty corner is Venus Over Los Angeles (a West Coast offshoot of Venus Over Manhattan), which held an opening for its current group show, Concrete Island, on March 11. Heres what the artists,  their friends and assorted hangers-on wore to the Saturday night gathering.

title: Credit Suisse Tax Inquiry Puts Spotlight on Private Bank Model
description: Credit Suisse knows the importance of keeping its nose clean.

title: A Referee Marches On (Much to Kentucky Fans Chagrin)
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  The most unlikely participant in Saturday nights national mens basketball semifinal between South Carolina and Gonzaga was neither the seventh-seeded Gamecocks, who had lost the opening round of their conference tournament, nor the Bulldogs, who were playing in their first Final Four in program history. The real surprise inclusion was the sandy-haired man who climbed onto the raised court before tipoff: the longtime referee John Higgins.

title: U2 Producers Other Job: Selling CDs in Indonesias KFCs
description: Steve Lillywhite knows a thing or two about making music that sells. That six-time Grammy winning producer has worked on multiplatinum recordings with artists including U2, the Killers and the Rolling Stones.

title: Chicago to Take the Spotlight With Ambitious 2018 Art Event
description: Think of it as Lake Michigan Standard Time.

title: Not So Tall Guys Finally Get Their Own Store
description: Short men need fashion love, too. The big and tall have their own specialty clothing stores, as do the plus-size, while guys the size of Daniel Radcliffe (5-foot-5), Tom Cruise (5-7) or Bruno Mars (also 5-7) may find themselves pawing through the offerings in the boys department.

title: Should Democrats Work With Trump?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Revered Milwaukee Restaurant, Karl Ratzsch, Says Goodbye
description: Thank you for an incredible 113 years of serving Milwaukee & the World! read the message, written in Old World script and posted on Facebook. Karl Ratzsch has served its last Schnitzel & raised its last Beer.

title: New on Netflix: Movies and TV Shows to Watch This Month
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Release Judith Clark
description: To the Editor:

title: St. Petersburg, Jared Kushner, North Korea: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Trump Shifts Course on Egypt, Praising Its Authoritarian Leader
description: WASHINGTON  Ever since he seized power in a military takeover nearly four years ago, President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi of Egypt has been barred from the White House. But President Trump made clear on Monday that the period of ostracism was over as he hosted Mr. Sisi and pledged unstinting support for the autocratic ruler.

title: Review: Prison Break Returns, With Yemen the Focus
description: If its time for another Fox reboot, it must be time for another soul-searching question. Sure enough, we are forced to ask: Was Prison Break always this silly?

title: After Badger Buries Entire Cow Carcass, Scientists Go to the Tape
description: Scientists reviewing video from camera traps watched dumbfounded as a 16-pound badger worked four days to bury a 50-pound calf carcass.

title: Washington Man Arrested After Fatally Shooting Stranger He Found in His Shower
description: A man was arrested on suspicion of second-degree murder in Washington State on Saturday after shooting an intruder he found in his shower, according to the Mason County Sheriffs Office.

title: Man Is Sentenced to Life Without Parole in Killing of New York Police Officer
description: In a Manhattan courtroom packed with police officers, the man who fatally shot Officer Randolph Holder in 2015 was sentenced on Monday to life in prison with no possibility of parole.

title: 4 New Books From Restaurant Chefs  for Home Cooks
description: Bringing simpler versions of Michelin- and James Beard-level recipes into your everyday rotation.

title: N.C.A.A. Championship: How North Carolina Won Its Sixth Title
description: North Carolina, whose heartbreaking loss in the N.C.A.A. tournament championship game a year ago provided one of the games indelible moments  the buzzer-beating shot by Villanovas Kris Jenkins  avenged that defeat with a win over Gonzaga, 71-65, on Monday to claim its sixth national title.

title: N.H.L. Says Its Players Will Not Participate in 2018 Winter Olympics
description: T. J. Oshie dominating in a thrilling United States shootout victory over Russia. Sidney Crosby scoring an overtime goal on home ice to lift Canada to the gold medal over the United States. Henrik Lundqvist stretching across the goal line with seconds remaining to secure gold for Sweden.

title: Yankees and Mets May Be Required to Have More Netting to Protect Fans
description: Alarmed by the number of fans injured by foul balls at Yankee Stadium and Citi Field, a member of the New York City Council is preparing to propose legislation that would require those stadiums to construct protective netting to reach the ends of both dugouts.

title: From Lost Soul in London to Glory Off Broadway
description: The British actor Obi Abili remembers what he was wearing (a Michigan Wolverines jacket, because anything American was cool) and who he was with (the hot girl from his high school, because he had wangled a date with her) the first time he saw the Quentin Tarantino film Pulp Fiction.

title: WrestleMania Stories Collide in the Ring
description: John Cena popped the question to Nikki Bella on one knee. The Undertaker put one foot in the grave.

title: Trump Is Ready for Tax Cuts, but His Treasury Department Isnt
description: WASHINGTON  After failing to pass health care legislation, the Trump administration said it would take control of the next legislative initiative, a tax overhaul. Obviously, were driving the train on this, said Sean Spicer, the presidents spokesman.

title: Review: A Hectic Vanity Fair, Starring That Nasty Woman
description: I love Becky Sharp. She is cunning, devious and almost entirely unprincipled. She manipulates her friends and mistreats her child. She has an ambition so naked it deserves an NC-17 rating.

title: Georgetown Hires Patrick Ewing as Mens Basketball Coach
description: Only weeks after parting ways with Coach John Thompson III, the son of its legendary coach John Thompson, Georgetown kept one of college basketballs most prestigious jobs in the family by hiring the elder Thompsons greatest star, Patrick Ewing, as the Hoyas new head coach, the university announced Monday.

title: At the Museum of Sex, a Bar Where You Can Boogie Oogie Oogie
description: The never-ending fascination with 1970s New York night life takes a more tangible form at Night Fever, a temporary bar and gallery that opened last November at the Museum of Sex. Built around a photo exhibit of Bill Bernsteins explicit black-and-white photos from infamous clubs like Xenon and Studio 54, the bar allows patrons to view the art while sipping cocktails and dancing to the disco beat.

title: Jared Kushner, the Assistant With the Big Portfolio
description: President Trump has made his son-in-law, Jared Kushner, a White House assistant with an exceptionally broad portfolio. Mr. Kushner has been charged with at least three major tasks, any one of which would be a full-time job: working on Middle East peace, preparing for a state visit by President Xi Jinping of China and overseeing a broad effort to reorganize the federal government utilizing business techniques. And on Monday, he accompanied Gen. Joseph F. Dunford Jr., chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, on a visit to Iraq.

title: Kansas House Narrowly Upholds Governors Veto of Medicaid Expansion
description: TOPEKA, Kan.  The Republican-controlled Kansas House of Representatives voted narrowly on Monday to uphold Gov. Sam Brownbacks veto of a bill to expand Medicaid, ending a quest that came improbably close to succeeding in this deep red state despite Mr. Brownbacks unyielding opposition.

title: Trump Donates First-Quarter Salary to National Park Service
description: President Trump, who promised to work for free, donated his salary for the first quarter of the year on Monday to the National Park Service, which, like other government agencies, faces major cuts in the presidents first budget proposal.

title: 24 Ways to Teach and Learn About Poetry With The New York Times
description: We go hard for National Poetry Month here on The Learning Network, and as The Times kept publishing news and features about poetry and poets, we keep adding more and more ways to teach about it  during April or any other month.

title: The Campaign to Lead the World Health Organization
description: In May, the World Health Organization will select a new director general, a choice that will affect the health of hundreds of millions in the developing world  perhaps even more if a global pandemic were to emerge.

title: Mets Catch a Break, Then Catch Fire, to Defeat the Braves on Opening Day
description: It was the bottom of the seventh inning on Monday, in a scoreless opening-day pitchers duel at Citi Field, when the Mets Wilmer Flores raced home from second base on a single to center field by Asdrubal Cabrera. Flores can hit for power against left-handed pitching and play multiple positions, but fleet of foot he is not.

title: Bringing Owls Into the Light
description: Despite their elusiveness, owls have always been objects of fascination. The ancient Romans believed the hoots of an owl warned of impending death. The Greeks viewed owls as symbols of wisdom and good fortune. Many African cultures continue to see them as portents of witchcraft, even as the West associates them with the magic of Harry Potter.

title: Stories of Wonder, Fear and Kindness From the Moth
description: THE MOTH PRESENTS: ALL THESE WONDERSTrue Stories About Facing the UnknownEdited by Catherine BurnsCrown Archetype. 330 pages. $25.

title: Gorsuch, Russia, N.C.A.A. Final: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Gary Austin, Who Founded the Groundlings Improv Troupe, Dies at 75
description: Gary Austin, who helped changed the shape of American comedy as the founder and artistic director of the influential improvisational theater company the Groundlings, died on Saturday in Los Angeles. He was 75.

title: A Fast Start To A New Season
description: The Mets defeated the Atlanta Braves 6-0.

title: The Legend of King Solomon and the Passover Feast
description: The walls of the Paradesi Synagogue in Kochi, India, are adorned with the history of the countrys Jews. On a recent trip there, I read an inscription suggesting that Jewish traders might have reached India from Judea, crossing the ocean during the reign of King Solomon  a journey of thousands of miles.

title: 20 Years Ago, Tiger Woods Made His Grand Entrance at the Masters
description: Gabriel Hjertstedt made history as a rookie on the PGA Tour, becoming the first Swede to win a tournament. In any other season, he would have stood out among his fellow first-year players. But it was 1997, when everyone  first-year players and veterans alike  became a footnote to Tiger Woods, whose four victories in his first full season as a professional included his record 12-stroke rout at the Masters.

title: New York State Passes an Emergency Budget but Skips Thorny Issues
description: ALBANY  With a full budget still out of reach, the Legislature passed a pair of emergency spending bills on Monday to permit the state government to continue to function, and to buy lawmakers more time to resolve several contested policy issues tied to the proposal.

title: The Good Fight Recap: The Head and the Heart
description: Sundays episode of The Good Fight could have been the one that really developed the shows black characters. It had all the makings of a truly moving piece of television. But unfortunately, after starting with a sucker punch, it ended with all the commitment of a shrug.

title: The Senate Filibuster, Explained
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch is now going to the Senate floor. The Senate minority leader, Chuck Schumer of New York, has pledged to lead Democrats in a filibuster of the nomination. If he does, the majority leader, Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, has vowed to change Senate rules to clear the way for Judge Gorsuch. The potential showdown has raised interest in the peculiar Senate filibuster rule.

title: Verizon Announces New Name Brand for AOL and Yahoo: Oath
description: Oath? Oof.

title: On Future as a Knick, Carmelo Anthony Says, I See the Writing on the Wall
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  With just five regular-season games remaining for the Knicks until they are put out of their current misery, there seems to be an increasing possibility that Carmelo Anthonys tenure with the organization may end soon, too.

title: Going Back to Move Forward
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Peek Into the White House Swamp
description: The White House boasted that the release of financial disclosures for dozens of administration officials exemplified President Trumps commitment to ensure an ethical and transparent government. The Friday night document dump did nothing of the sort.

title: Ikutaro Kakehashi, Engineer Behind Revolutionary Drum Machine, Dies at 87
description: Ikutaro Kakehashi, an engineer and entrepreneur who used a defective transistor to generate the distinctive sounds of the Roland TR-808, a drum machine that transformed contemporary music, died on Saturday in Japan. He was 87.

title: Plan to Cut Funding for Biomedical Research Hits Opposition in Congress
description: WASHINGTON  A proposal by President Trump to cut federal spending for biomedical research by 18 percent  just months after Congress approved bipartisan legislation to increase such spending  has run into a buzz saw on Capitol Hill, with Republicans and Democrats calling it misguided.

title: Cricket Draft Opens With an Unusual Question: Wholl Start the Bidding?
description: Christies, like any of the worlds great auction houses, is renowned for the pace, the tension and the sense of excitement that occur when a bidding war acquires a life of its own. Yet for Richard Madley, the former president of Christies East in New York, the high drama of arts trading has been replaced by a pioneering life: instead of paintings and sculptures, he now auctions cricketers.

title: Tesla Passes Ford in Market Value as Investors Bet on the Future
description: DETROIT  The record pace of auto sales in the United States is slowing down, leaving investors increasingly bearish on auto stocks.

title: Brooklyn Prosecutor Pleads Guilty to Rogue Surveillance in Love Triangle
description: Almost from the moment she became a prosecutor in the Brooklyn district attorneys office in 2005, Tara Lenich worked on complicated, long-term cases. First under District Attorney Charles J. Hynes, then under Ken Thompson, Mr. Hyness successor, Ms. Lenich was a rising star who specialized in using secret surveillance to take down violent street gangs and drug organizations.

title: Wells Fargo Whistle-Blower Wins $5.4 Million and His Job Back
description: A federal regulator on Monday ordered Wells Fargo to pay $5.4 million to a former manager who said he was fired in 2010 after reporting to his supervisors and to a bank ethics hotline what he suspected was fraudulent behavior.

title: For Mets Noah Syndergaard, Goose Bumps Tower Over a Blister on Opening Day
description: Noah Syndergaard did not want to talk about his blister. He had just overwhelmed the Atlanta Braves on opening day with turbo sinkers and jackknife sliders and power changeups. The Mets won, 6-0, and the Citi Field stands were full of worshipers.

title: Changes to Tech Worker Visas Are Cosmetic. For Now.
description: The United States Citizenship and Immigration Services announced on Friday that it was reversing its previous guidance that entry-level computer programming jobs automatically qualify as a specialty occupation  a basic requirement for receiving an H-1B work visa. And on Monday, the Justice Department warned that it would look closely at any employer who discriminates against American workers by showing a preference for hiring H-1B workers.

title: Trump Cuts Off Funding for U.N. Agency That Supports Contraception
description: UNITED NATIONS  The Trump administration informed Congress on Monday that it had terminated United States funding for the United Nations Population Fund, the worlds leading provider of family planning services, including contraception, to women in at least 155 countries.

title: Iowas Largest Insurer Says It Will Withdraw From Obamacare Exchanges
description: In the latest move by insurers worried about the viability of the markets created under the federal health care law, Iowas major carrier said Monday that it would stop selling individual policies in the state next year.

title: Quotation of the Day: What Decline? A Rural Hub Thrives in Idaho
description: Economic development is a blood sport, and I mean that in every single way you can think of it.

title: Brazilian Schoolgirl Killed by Crossfire Adds to Rios Toll
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  In cellphone pictures and selfies with friends, Maria Eduarda da Conceio was a joker, a happy teenager, making faces in the schoolyard and throwing poses in her school uniform of white T-shirt and blue shorts.

title: Roman Polanskis Request to Have Sexual Abuse Case Resolved Is Denied
description: A Los Angeles County judge on Monday denied a request from the film director Roman Polanski that his decades-old sexual abuse case be resolved in his absence.

title: Trump Declines First Pitch on Opening Day, Throwing Ritual a Curveball
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump is not usually one to turn down a big crowd.

title: Jared Kushner Meets With Iraqi Leader on Future of ISIS Battle
description: ERBIL, Iraq  After arriving in Baghdad on Monday afternoon, Jared Kushner, President Trumps son-in-law, met with Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi to discuss the fight against the Islamic State and whether the United States would leave troops in Iraq afterward, according to a spokesman for the prime minister.

title: Disney Character
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Actions have consequences, but if I wanted to be more dramatic, I could say simply that there is a penalty for mendacity.

title: Review: Amlie Is Easy to Listen To, but Never Really Sings
description: For a cunning little bauble of an entertainment, the 2001 French film Amlie inspired uncommonly extreme responses. People were usually head over heels about it (Its so cute!) or violently allergic to it (But its so cute!).

title: Justice Department on Local Policing
description: The Justice Department said in a memo released to all U.S. attorneys last week: "It is not the responsibility of the federal government to manage non-federal law enforcement agencies."

title: Sweeping Federal Review Could Affect Consent Decrees Nationwide
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions has ordered a sweeping review of federal agreements with dozens of law enforcement agencies, an examination that reflects President Trumps emphasis on law and order and could lead to a retreat on consent decrees with troubled police departments nationwide.

title: Trump Completes Repeal of Online Privacy Protections From Obama Era
description: President Trump on Monday signed a congressional resolution to complete the overturning of internet privacy protections created by the Federal Communications Commission during the Obama administration.

title: Editors Note: April 4, 2017
description: BUSINESS DAY

title: Overalls and the Everyday Elegance of Chance the Rapper
description: Obsolescence is the engine of style, and the sad fate of any fashionable garment is to die after each season, as the fashion historian Olivier Saillard once said. Yet there is at least one article of clothing that is seemingly inoculated against this inevitable death sentence. And that is overalls.

title: Russia, Donald Trump, Tesla: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Along the Mekong River, a Timeless Place Where Time Marches On
description: Deep in the folds of the hill, up steep stone stairs flanked with frangipani trees, stood the inner sanctum of the ancient Khmer temple of Vat Phou.

title: No Extra Screening of Jurors in Bill Cosby Case, Judge Rules
description: NORRISTOWN, Pa.  A Pennsylvania judge on Monday denied a request by Bill Cosbys lawyers for extra scrutiny of potential jurors ahead of the entertainers upcoming trial on sexual-assault charges.

title: North Carolina Stops Gonzaga, Turning Heartbreak Into Joy
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  The Scripture led North Carolinas Justin Jackson to the story of David and Goliath, of all things. He did not plan it that way. The words spoke to him still.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Prison Break and Louis C.K.: 2017
description: Eight years after its last season, Prison Break is back  and as preposterous as ever. Elsewhere, its Louis C.K. at his best as he tackles 2017 in his new Netflix special.

title: Along the Mekong River in Laos
description: The restoration of an ancient Khmer temple is drawing adventurous tourists to a little-known corner of Southeast Asia.

title: Republican Health Proposal Would Undermine Coverage for Pre-existing Conditions
description: A new effort to pass the Republican health care bill has been propelled by an amendment that would allow states to waive certain insurance regulations in Obamacare. We examined the probable effects when the idea surfaced in April. Now that those ideas have become part of the legislative package, weve updated our analysis.

title: Word + Quiz: enrapture
Losing Things
description: Do you lose things often? How do you find them again?

title: Right and Left: Partisan Writing You Shouldnt Miss
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Photos That Celebrate Ghanas L.G.B.T. Community
description: Eric Gyamfis project Just Like Us is an antidote to prescribed narratives for the L.G.B.T. community in his native Ghana.

title: St. Petersburg Bomber Said to Be Man From Kyrgyzstan; Death Toll Rises
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia  A man from Kyrgyzstan who had a Russian passport was responsible for the deadly subway blast in St. Petersburg, the Russian and Kyrgyz authorities said Tuesday, as the toll from the attack rose to 14 dead and more than 60 wounded.

title: Enabling Egypts President Sisi, an Enemy of Human Rights
description: American presidents must sometimes deal with unsavory foreign leaders in pursuit of Americas national interest. But that doesnt require inviting them to the White House and lavishing them with praise and promises of unconditional support.

title: Its O.K., California. Breaking Up Isnt Hard to Do.
description: SACRAMENTO  Two leaders of the successful referendum to remove Britain from the European Union were recently in California, where they said favorable things about the newest version of a plan to split the state in pieces. As Arron Banks told a British newspaper, Its the worlds sixth largest economy, and its very badly run. He isnt the only person to believe that a breakup may be the best way to solve Californias intractable problems.

title: Lets Go for a Win on Opioids
description: The health care bill failed. The odds of successful tax reform are remote, and in any case an actual proposal is months away. If we lived in a normal country our president would use the current moment to try to get a win  to try to pass something that would help people, demonstrate that Washington can function and rebuild his brand.

title: How to End the Politicization of the Courts
description: Mainstream news coverage has a hard time making subtle distinctions between the behavior of the two political parties. When Democratic and Republican tactics are blatantly different  on voter suppression, for instance  journalists are often comfortable saying so. And when the parties act similarly  both soliciting large donors, say  journalists are good at producing both sides do it stories.

title: Floridas Vengeful Governor
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Gov. Rick Scott of Florida overreached last month when he issued an executive order stripping a state attorney of her authority to prosecute a man charged with killing his pregnant ex-girlfriend and an Orlando police officer. On Monday, he also removed her from 21 other murder cases.

title: When Martin Luther King Came Out Against Vietnam
description: Fifty years ago today  and one year to the day before his assassination  the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered the most politically charged speech of his life at Riverside Church in Upper Manhattan. It was a blistering attack on the governments conduct of the Vietnam War that, among other things, compared American tactics to those of the Nazis during World War II.

title: Tar Heels, After Letting One Slip, Hold On Tight This Time
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  In Monday nights sluggish slog of a national title game  it was trench warfare, with whistles instead of land mines  North Carolina faced the frustrating situation of clearly outplaying its opponent, Gonzaga, without the scoreboard reflecting that fact.

title: Photos That Celebrate Ghanas L.G.B.T. Community
description: Eric Gyamfis project Just Like Us, which showcases queer people in his native Ghana, began as an endeavor to fill a void.

title: Why Britains Trains Dont Run on Time: Capitalism
description: LONDON  If how the railways run is a guide to the state of a nation, then it tells you something that Britain is in the middle of its biggest railway strike since 1994. Not coincidentally, that was the year the national rail network was privatized by the Conservative government of Prime Minister John Major.

title: Questions for: No License Plates Here: Using Art to Transcend Prison Walls
description: Article: No License Plates Here: Using Art to Transcend Prison Walls

title: New Sentences: From Forest Fire, by Mount Eerie
description: One piece of advice commonly given to writers is to avoid adverbs. This is practical and well meaning but also sort of a shame. Even in plain everyday speech, we tend to use adverbs liberally, fervently and colorfully. Often the simplest ones accomplish the most.

title: Why Cant Silicon Valley Fix Online Harassment?
description: In 1996, during the earliest days of the internet, a self-proclaimed cyberlibertarian named John Perry Barlow published a 16-paragraph essay called A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace. It began with a bold plea: On behalf of the future, I ask you of the past to leave us alone. Barlow envisioned the internet almost as a new nation-state, a digital utopia free from the imperialistic hierarchies and rules of the physical world. He proudly proclaimed that we are creating a world that all may enter without privilege or prejudice accorded by race, economic power, military force or station of birth  a place where, he continued, your legal concepts of property, expression, identity, movement and context do not apply to us. They are all based on matter, and there is no matter here.

title: CNN Had a Problem. Donald Trump Solved It.
description: At 3:58 on a recent Wednesday afternoon in Washington, CNNs largest control room was mostly empty but for a handful of producers hunched over control panels and, hovering behind them, a short, barrel-shaped, restless-looking man in a dark pinstriped suit and open white dress shirt: the president of CNN Worldwide, Jeff Zucker.

title: Its Easy to Be Called Thirsty on Social Media. What About on Capitol Hill?
description: In his 1936 personal-development opus How to Win Friends and Influence People, Dale Carnegie quoted the Vienna-born scientist Hans Selye: As much as we thirst for approval, we dread condemnation. Not much has changed in this regard, except that now, as much as we thirst for approval, we dread being condemned precisely for being so thirsty.

title: Where Non-Techies Can Get With the Programming
description: When the Georgetown University Law Center offered computer programming last year, it was an experiment, a single class for about 20 students. It was filled almost instantly, and the waitlist swelled to 130. This semester, the law school has five programming classes, and the waitlist still overflowed.

title: Are There Subjects That Should Be Off-Limits to Artists, or to Certain Artists in Particular?
description: Compare the painting pictured above, Open Casket by Dana Schutz, with the one below, The Times Thay Aint a Changing Fast Enough! by Henry Taylor.

title: Playing Cupid for a Gay Friend on a (Mostly) Straight Cruise
description: Leather jacket at 5 oclock, my friend John whispered. I scanned the room and located the young man in a sleekly fitted jacket. Amid the 2,000-odd crowd of passengers waiting to board the Queen Mary 2 at Southampton, England, heading to New York, its not hard to spot those of eligible age for our kind of cruising, which happens more often in clubs or on Grindr than aboard luxury ocean vessels. One has only to scan for heads without white hair, as John wasnt in the market for a tryst with someone twice his age.

title: The New A.P.: Coding Lite
description: Not a computer whiz? Not a problem. Try these practice exam questions from Computer Science Principles.

description: THE SPIDER NETWORK The Wild Story of a Math Genius, a Gang of Backstabbing Bankers, and One of the Greatest Scams in Financial History By David Enrich Illustrated. 509 pp. Custom House/William Morrow. $29.99.

title: Strategic Debate in Gorsuch Battle: Use Filibuster Now or Later?
description: WASHINGTON  The conventional political narrative as Judge Neil M. Gorsuchs Supreme Court nomination nears its endgame is that liberals want at least 40 Senate Democrats to follow through on their threat to stall him with a filibuster, daring Republicans to carry out their vow to change the chambers rules and confirm him anyway. Conservatives, meanwhile, are outraged  outraged!  that Democrats might precipitate such a crisis.

title: A Child Soldier Sees His Mother After 6 Years. But Why Doesnt He Speak?
description: BENTIU, South Sudan  The teenage boy walked off the plane with two small rocks jammed into his ears. His head still hurt from the beatings, and loud noises bothered him, but he didnt want any earplugs, just those two little rocks.

title: Fist or Glove: California Democrats Debate Response to Trump
description: LOS ANGELES  After greeting the election of Donald J. Trump with a defiant stream of attacks, California Democrats are now divided over how best to deal with an administration whose policies on immigration, health care and the environment loom as a threat to years of established law here.

title: Preparing for the Future Using Lessons From Hurricane Sandy
description: Ground floor is not quite the term for it.

description: In The Beauty and Joy of Computing, the course he helped conceive for nonmajors at the University of California, Berkeley, Daniel Garcia explains an all-important concept in computer science  abstraction  in terms of milkshakes.

title: Owner and Army Fight for a Soccer Clubs Name
description: BUCHAREST, Romania  For once, the crowds that had gathered to shout and to denounce were not angry at Gigi Becali.

description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: How Gorsuch Could Pull the Eight Other Justices Rightward
description: If Judge Neil Gorsuch is confirmed to the Supreme Court, he will become not only the ninth vote in a divided court but also a colleague with the potential to move his eight peers in a conservative direction. A compelling new analysis suggests that this kind of peer effect may even be more consequential than a justices vote.

title: How (and Where) to Take a Tax-Refund Vacation
description: Dont save your tax refund check  spend it on travel. That is the message some tour operators, cruise lines and hotels want to get across this year, and with Tax Day approaching on April 18, theyre offering tax-themed trips and stays. Most are priced below $3,000, the amount of the average tax refund in 2017, as of early March, according to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Trumps Gifts to China
description: SINGAPORE  The United States meets China this week in a position of weakness. Since taking office, Donald Trump has handed China a strategic gift by abandoning a trade pact designed to offset Chinese power in the region, been obliged to grovel after offending China over Taiwan, and turned President Xi Jinping of China into an unlikely poster boy for climate change concern and an open global trading system.

description: Listen to The Daily: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: How Bangladesh Makes Second-Class Citizens
description: LONDON  For most of my life, I had one, troublesome passport. It was green, for one thing, even though the leather cover was titled Peoples Republic of Bangladesh. My green passport made me nervous at airports; every time I handed it over to an immigration officer, I braced myself for the frown, the close inspection, the questions about how long I was staying and how much money I had with me.

title: Congos Kabila and the Dictators Dilemma
description: LONDON  President Joseph Kabila of Congo shows no sign of stepping down. He reached the end of his constitutional two-term limit last year, but after months of delays for which Mr. Kabila blamed incomplete voter lists, one of his ministerial colleagues argued that presidential elections  estimated to cost $1.8 billion  are an expense Congo cannot afford.

description: President Donald Trump has vowed to bring back the industrys heyday.

title: Worst Chemical Attack in Years in Syria; U.S. Blames Assad
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  One of the worst chemical bombings in Syria turned a northern rebel-held area into a toxic kill zone on Tuesday, inciting international outrage over the ever-increasing government impunity shown in the countrys six-year war.

title: Properties Controlled by Assads Uncle Seized in European Laundering Inquiry
description: LONDON  Rifaat al-Assad, an uncle of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, was named on Tuesday in a European money laundering investigation.

description: Has the great fashion experiment at J. Crew come to an end?

title: Jason Blum, Producer Behind Get Out, Is Starting a TV Company
description: LOS ANGELES  Jason Blum, the producing whiz behind blockbuster horror films like Get Out and Split, has secured funding from ITV Studios in Britain to start a stand-alone television company. The first of several projects, a mini-series called Secure and Hold: The Last Days of Roger Ailes, is already in the works at Showtime.

title: What Financial Markets Can Teach Us About Managing Climate Risks
description: Say an investor had only two options of what to put money in: gold or stocks. Gold has an average annual rate of return of 3 percent, while the stock market delivers a healthier 5 percent. Which should the investor choose? Seems simple, right? Take the higher payout.

title: Tony Romo Retires From N.F.L. and Heads to CBS, Replacing Simms
description: No one has passed for more yardage or more touchdowns in a Dallas Cowboys uniform than Tony Romo. Not Troy Aikman, Roger Staubach, Danny White or Don Meredith.

title: N.C.A.A. Ends Boycott of North Carolina After So-Called Bathroom Bill Is Repealed
description: GLENDALE, Ariz.  The N.C.A.A. on Tuesday reluctantly lifted its ban on holding championship events in North Carolina, removing its six-month-old prohibition less than a week after the states Legislature and governor repealed a so-called bathroom bill that had led to boycotts of the state.

title: Russia Moves to Ban Jehovahs Witnesses as Extremist
description: VOROKHOBINO, Russia  A dedicated pacifist who has never even held a gun, Andrei Sivak discovered that his government considered him a dangerous extremist when he tried to change some money and the teller suddenly looked up at me with a face full of fear.

title: Hungarys Parliament Passes Law Targeting George Soross University
description: LONDON  Hungarys Parliament approved legislation on Tuesday that appeared to be written to force the closing of  a university founded by the financier George Soros, the latest step in what observers see as a crackdown on free expression and liberal values.

title: To Curb Global Warming, Science Fiction May Become Fact
description: Remember Snowpiercer?

title: Live Chat: Whats in Store for Baseball Fans in 2017?
description: Two New York Times sports journalists, Jay Schreiber and Benjamin Hoffman, are on hand for a live chat about the 2017 baseball season.

title: Here Lies a Graveyard Where East and West Came Together
description: SINGAPORE  In the middle of this island nation of highways and high-rises lies a wrinkle in time: Bukit Brown, one of the worlds largest Chinese cemeteries.

title: Returning West to Find Big Changes (and Plenty of Yogurt) in Idaho
description: Southern Idaho has a distinctive stamp on its identity, laid down by the harsh climatic reality of the arid interior American West, and then by the Mormon settlers who dug ditches on arrival there in the 1800s. Rich but moisture-starved soil, made wet by irrigation, blossomed into a place so sweetly suitable for crops like potatoes and corn that people called it the Magic Valley.

title: Jordan Klepper of The Daily Show Is Getting His Own Show
description: Fans of The Daily Show will soon see a familiar face in the 11:30 p.m. time slot following that show on Comedy Central. On Tuesday, the network said that it would give a topical comedy show to Jordan Klepper, a correspondent for The Daily Show. It will begin in the fall and run Monday through Thursday.

title: When Britain Split From Europe, in a Big Way
description: The separation of Britain from Europe, set in motion by Prime Minister Theresa May last week, began a historic process but one not as abrupt as the first Brexit. That was the catastrophic destruction of the land bridge that for 10 million years had joined Britain physically to the Continent.

title: 1917: America Is at War With Germany
description: America is at war with Germany. At 8.45 on the evening of Monday, April 2, 1917  henceforth a historic epoch-making date in the affairs of the nation  President Wilson presented himself before a full Congress to ask for a declaration that a state of war with Germany exists. The co-operation of the United States with the Allies will comprise: Financial aid, universal military service, and the raising immediately of an army of 500,000 men.

title: A Stitch in Time
description: Pop culture according to the cross-stitch whiz Elsa Hansen Oldham.

title: Pop Culture Figures  Rendered in Embroidery
description: Elsa Hansen Oldham says she used to live with ghosts  a nasty boy and girl who once resided with her in upstate New York. Encountering a pair of creatures from the netherworld sounds like a disturbing event, but in Hansen Oldhams unassuming delivery, it seems like a perfectly natural occurrence. Its in this same modest but convincing tone that she talks about her cross-stitching, which is gaining attention in the art world.

title: When Your Mail Moves Itself

title: Norman, From Two Major Scandinavian Chefs, Opens in Greenpoint
description: NORMAN The Danish culinary entrepreneur Claus Meyer and the innovative Swedish chef Fredrik Berselius are collaborating on this dining option at A/D/O (officially, Amalgamated Drawing Office), a work space and design studio run by the Mini division of the car company BMW. It occupies a good chunk of the sweeping, mostly unfinished 23,000-square-foot space whose windows overlook Norman Avenue in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, and its finally opening after a two-month delay. Seating for 140 surrounds a long L-shaped white counter and open kitchen where the chef Andrew Whitcomb, who is from Maine, produces food for self-service breakfasts and lunches  and, by the end of the month, for more formal dinners. The idea is to feed people who come here to work  theres no membership required  and become a destination, we hope, in the evening, Mr. Meyer said. A slow-roasted pork sandwich, a wild rice grain bowl and a maitake mushroom tart are some lunch items. Dinner will feature brined vegetables, scallop crudo, roasted red cabbage, and pork collar with sprouted spelt and endives. Bowls of steel-cut oats are served for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Scandinavian touches frequently show up. I love using grains and vegetables, and understand the Scandinavian approach, Mr. Whitcomb said. Its not a fad, its about the products and flavors: 29 Norman Avenue (Banker Street), Greenpoint, Brooklyn, 347-966-2092, restaurantnorman.com.

title: Milans Most Beautiful Entryways
description: Those who dismiss Milan as a Brutalist concrete jungle may have simply never looked beyond the citys closed doors. Now, its most beautiful private entries are brought to life in a beautiful architectural book called Ingressi di Milano (Entryways of Milan), which will be feted during Milans annual Salone Del Mobile furniture fair this week. The book, painstakingly researched by the German editor Karl Kolbitz, celebrates 144 spectacular entryways to Milanese residential buildings that run the gamut from quiet midcentury Modernism to all-out graphic abstraction. The ornate residences dispel the reputation of Milan as Italys ugly city, a label bestowed upon it in 1921 by the Novecento architect Giovanni Muzio and rarely shaken nearly a hundred years later.

title: N.H.L.s Olympics Stance Leaves Players Cold

title: With a New Breed of Fans, Even the Yankees Must Adapt

title: A New Level of Depravity, Even for Bashar al-Assad

People gasping for breath, turning blue, lying dead in the street  all victims of airstrikes apparently by President Bashar al-Assads forces.

title: The Supreme Court as Partisan Tool

With rare exceptions, nominees to the court have been largely insulated from the escalating political warfare over the judiciary, and have been approved.

title: U.S. Appetite for Mexicos Drugs Fuels Illegal Immigration

Since Lexi Thompson lost in a playoff Sunday in the first womens major of the year after receiving four penalty strokes for a day-old infraction brought to the L.P.G.A.s attention by a television viewer, a debate has raged about whether armchair rules officials should be able to offer input.

Ailes.
