description: CHICAGO  Roger Claar, the mayor of Bolingbrook, Ill., a suburban Chicago village, appeared to have fought back a re-election challenge on Tuesday, receiving 102 more votes than Jackie Traynere, a labor organizer who had blasted the mayor for his association with President Trump.

title: Suddenly Competitive Knicks Take Down the Bulls
description: The Knicks have used the last month of this disappointing season to fiddle with their lineup, sometimes finding surprising results. They have seen Ron Baker play competently in place of Derrick Rose, and they have beaten the Heat in Miami with Carmelo Anthony on the bench. At times, that hardscrabble-but-egalitarian approach produced better results than the top-heavy bunch that struggled for most of the season.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Brockmire and Archer
description: Hank Azaria and Amanda Peet pair up as a baseball announcer and team owner in Brockmire, a deliriously raunchy comedy. And Archer blasts back to the past in a fever dream.

title: Word + Quiz: dutiful
The Badger and the Cow
description: Watch the video above, then choose one of these prompts  one scientific and the other creative  to write about it:

title: Frances Far Right, Once Known for Anti-Semitism, Courts Jews
description: PARIS  For years, Frances far-right National Front was synonymous with anti-Semitism. Its founder, Jean Marie Le Pen, was notorious for anti-Semitic outbursts  including a comment that the Holocaust was just a detail of history.

title: The Controversy and Contexts of Using Emmett Tills Image
description: The uproar over a white artists painting of Emmett Tills corpse raises issues of appropriation without historical context.

title: Jared Kushner, Man of Steel
description: Why dont we just stitch him a red cape, put him in spandex, affix a stylized S to his chest and be done with it?

title: A How-to Book for Wielding Civic Power
description: Last year, the RAND Survey Research Group asked 3,037 Americans about their political preferences and found that the factor that best predicted support for Donald Trump wasnt age, race, gender, income, educational attainment or attitudes toward Muslims or undocumented immigrants. It was whether respondents agreed with the statement People like me dont have any say about what the government does.

title: How Trump Can Solve His Chinese Puzzle
description: Getting tough with China is a central part of Donald Trumps plan to make America great again. During the election campaign, he claimed that China was raping American industry. Since the election, he and senior aides have denounced Chinese policies over trade, North Korea and the South China Sea.

title: In Search of a Good Emperor
description: One of the hard truths of human affairs is that diversity and democracy do not go easily together. In the Middle East today as in Europes not-so-distant past, the transition from authoritarianism to popular sovereignty seems to run through ethnic or religious purges. Worldwide, many of the models of successful democratic government are effectively ethno-states, built on past cleansings or partitions or splendid isolation. And in the West in recent years, both mass immigration and cultural fragmentation have brought authoritarian temptations back to life.

title: President Trumps Real-World Syria Lesson
description: With each passing day our new president is discovering that every big problem he faces is like Obamacare  if there were a good, easy solution it would have been found already, and even the less good solutions are more than his own party is ready to pay for or the country is ready to tolerate.

title: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, Who Saw Life and Poetry as a Bowl of Borscht
description: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, who died on Saturday at age 83, lived for the big stage. He personified the cultural thaw of the Soviet Sixties, shouting the short, rhythmic lines of his poems in packed, ecstatic stadiums. He projected himself as a man of the people, a Siberian who spoke the truth and battled taboos. He wore outrageous suits and outrageous ties and had unbounded energy. Nobody, as he quipped at a gala for his 60th birthday, ever accused him of excessive modesty.

title: Stanley McChrystal: Save PBS. It Makes Us Safer.
description: I like to say that leadership is a choice. As our leaders in Washington confront tough decisions about our budget priorities, I urge them to continue federal funding for public broadcasting. Public broadcasting makes our nation smarter, stronger and, yes, safer. Its a small public investment that pays huge dividends for Americans. And it shouldnt be pitted against spending more on improving our military. Thats a false choice.

title: Trump and Xi: Two Imposing Leaders With Clashing Agendas
description: BEIJING  When President Xi Jinping of China arrives at President Trumps Florida estate on Thursday, his goal will be to get through the quick visit looking like a resolute leader who can hold his own against the American president, something that even some of Washingtons closest allies have failed to pull off.

title: The Lasting Power of Emmett Tills Image
description: There are few photographs more consequential in African-American history  and our nations  than those of Emmett Tills mutilated corpse. The images from 1955 are gruesome and emotionally devastating, coming as they did after the 14-year-old was beaten and shot by two white men. And while authorities in Mississippi tried to bury the teenager as quickly as possible, his mother, Mamie Till Mobley, insisted otherwise, allowing photographers to commemorate the ghastly scene.

title: Le Pen, Macron and Fillon Share Crowded Stage With French Also-Rans
description: PARIS  On Tuesday night, France got a good, long look at its choices in the coming presidential election. All 11 of them.

title: Questions for: SpaceX Launches a Satellite With a Partly Used Rocket
description: Article: SpaceX Launches a Satellite With a Partly Used Rocket

title: What Is Your Earliest Memory?
description: Ask a few friends, parents, siblings or teachers about their earliest memories.

title: Ben Sasse Thinks Biden Would Have Won
description: Were 11 weeks into the Trump administration. Whats the Senate like these days? I think that the institution  and I do mean all 535 people, but particularly the hundred in the Senate  is filled with really nice and well-meaning people. Ive been there 27 months.

title: The Online Ad Industry Is Undergoing Self-Reflection. Thats Good News.
description: Digital ads are easy to hate.

title: The Professor and the Jihadi
description: Gilles Kepel, a French political scientist, was at home in Paris brushing his teeth one morning last June when his cellphone rattled on the sink. It was a text from a journalist he knew: Im sorry to tell you this, but youre on the death list. Kepel turned toward his TV, which was already on, and the top story eliminated any confusion. A French-born jihadi named Larossi Abballa had murdered a police officer and his wife in a town west of Paris and then delivered a macabre speech on Facebook Live  with the couples 3-year-old child cowering nearby  in which he called for the killing of seven public figures. The French media omitted the details, but an Interior Ministry official soon called with confirmation: Kepels name was near the top of the list. His initial feeling, he later told me, was as if the subject Ive been studying for 35 years had turned around to strike at me. Within hours, he had a government security team assigned to guard him 24 hours a day. A similar death warrant was issued against him later that summer, elevating the sense of danger.

title: Get Happy: Four Well-Being Workouts
description: Relieving stress and anxiety might help you feel better  for a bit. Martin E.P. Seligman, a professor of psychology at the University of Pennsylvania and a pioneer in the field of positive psychology, does not see alleviating negative emotions as a path to happiness.

title: Life on Mars: Get to Know the Crew
description: Six people are living in isolation for eight months on a volcano in Hawaii as part of a study to simulate human exploration of Mars. In the second episode of this 360-video series, we find out how they are settling in  and how they clean the toilet.

title: Is It O.K. That Our Friends Are Constantly Suing People?
description: Close friends of our family have been plaintiffs in a number of lawsuits in the past few years. This litigious trend seems to have begun after financial strain caused by health issues and a string of bad luck with their small business. They sued a local arts charity and our synagogue after being employed briefly at these organizations. The details of these two suits are murky, but we do know that a sizable  but not life-changing  sum was garnered from each suit. They have also tried five or six other lawsuits against various parties, which they either lost or eventually dropped. Most recently, they tried to sue the manufacturer of their car when they wound up in a ditch after a run-in with a patch of black ice.

title: The Diva Departs: Rene Flemings Farewell to Opera
description: Richard Strausss opera Der Rosenkavalier is about the passage of time. Its the story of a wealthy married woman, the Marschallin, who is having an affair with a much younger man, and who realizes that she is getting older and that he will sooner or later move on. Her most famous aria, at the end of the first act, is about wanting to stop the clocks. At the end of the opera, to music so full of feeling Strauss wanted it played at his own funeral, she accepts the inevitable and graciously surrenders her lover to a younger woman.

title: Emma Donoghues New Novel Makes Diversity an Understatement
description: THE LOTTERYS PLUS ONE By Emma Donoghue Illustrated by Caroline Hadilaksono 303 pp. Scholastic/ Arthur A. Levine Books. $17.99. (Middle grade; ages 8 to 12 )

title: What if the Senate Goes Beyond the Filibuster Nuclear Option?
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans are preparing to abolish the final vestige of power that the minority has to block Supreme Court nominations through a filibuster. Many senators in both parties now worry that the final and biggest domino  the power to filibuster legislation  will be next.

title: A Public Restroom Fit for Brooke Astor Gets an Upgrade
description: Bryant Park, a six-acre oasis set among Manhattan skyscrapers, packs in the crowds with its winter ice rink and holiday shops, summer movie nights, smorgasbord of artisanal fare and rustic lunch tables and chairs under stately London plane trees.

title: A Body Blow the Winter Olympics Didnt Need
description: HELSINKI, Finland  The Winter Olympics are already on thin ice even if the National Hockey Leagues announcement about skipping next years Games in Pyeongchang, South Korea, turns out to be a negotiating ploy.

title: Tuxedo Park, N.Y.: A Time Warp Beyond the Stone Gates
description: In 1999, when Lili Neuhauser first set eyes on a converted carriage house with stone walls and old peony bushes in Tuxedo Park, N.Y., she said to her real estate broker, If its as good inside as it is outside, were done.

title: High (School) Anxiety

title: Off Belize, a Hunt for Saltwater Fly-Fishings Top Prizes
description: Look: big school, my guide, Emir, said. He was pointing to a spot 50 yards in the distance. The surface of the water was churning, black tails poking up like so many miniature sails. Hop out, he said.

title: We Witnessed South Sudans Anguish
description: Our reporters went to South Sudan and found that the worlds newest nation has not turned out the way it was supposed to.

title: It Takes a Suburb: A Town Struggles to Ease Student Stress
description: Small rocks from the beaches of eastern Massachusetts began appearing at Lexington High School last fall. They were painted in pastels and inscribed with pithy advice: Be happy. Mistakes are O.K. Dont worry, it will be over soon. They had appeared almost by magic, boosting spirits and spreading calm at a public high school known for its sleep-deprived student body.

title: Stephen Colbert Was Like an Alien Before He Was Famous, Louis C.K. Says
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Democrats Are Bad at Midterm Turnout. That Seems Ready to Change.
description: Donald J. Trumps low approval ratings and the palpable enthusiasm of progressives nationwide have Democrats dreaming of a big win in next years midterm elections. But to pull that off, theyll need to overcome one of their biggest challenges of the last decade: low turnout in off-year contests.

title: Deepak Chopras Tips for a Healthier Hotel Room
description: Did you know that your hotel room has the potential to make you sick? Hotel rooms can be a hotbed for germs, and the lighting and poor circulation in some make for an unhealthy environment, said Deepak Chopra, a doctor who specializes in alternative medicine and an author who is also on the advisory board of Delos, a wellness real estate firm that is focused on creating healthier indoor environments.

title: How to Be Mindful When You Are Angry
description: Anger is a natural, life-affirming emotion. It lets us know when a boundary has been crossed, when our needs are not being met, or when someone we care about is in danger. But when misdirected, anger can harm our physical health and our relationships. Being mindful of anger means not suppressing, denying or avoiding it and also not acting out in harmful ways. Instead, connect with the direct experience of the anger, and then decide what action you want to take.  Jessica Morey, executive director of Inward Bound Mindfulness Education

title: Why Deep Breathing May Keep Us Calm
description: For generations, mothers have encouraged children to take long, slow breaths to fight anxiety. A long tradition of meditation likewise uses controlled breathing to induce tranquillity.

title: Is Chewing Gum Good for Toddlers? Or Anyone?
description: After Henry Trombley died in December, a few weeks shy of his 80th birthday, his daughter, Mary Trombley, found a surprising product pitch among the newspaper clippings and Valentine cards from his youth.

title: Trump Gives Military New Freedom. But With That Comes Danger.
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has let the military know that the buck stops with them, not him. The Pentagon, after eight years of chafing at what many generals viewed as micromanaging from the Obama White House, is so far embracing its new freedom.

description: LONDON  The Chinese government wants to make sure its food supply is reliable and safe as it works to feed a rapidly growing middle class. So it was a coup on Wednesday when a Chinese company won approval to take over one of the worlds largest suppliers of seeds and pesticides.

title: Lincoln Center Has an Eclectic Week of Music in Store
description: Late Sunday afternoons are a great time for a concert: You can do something during the day and then take in a performance, leaving ample time for a leisurely dinner to end the weekend. The Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center regularly claims that slot for concerts at Alice Tully Hall, but on Sunday, April 9, Lincoln Centers Great Performers series has booked it for a recital by the German pianist Lars Vogt, who will play Bachs colossal Goldberg Variations. (5 p.m., lincolncenter.org.)

title: Maggie Rogers and Xenia Rubinos: Rural, Virtual, Twisted
description: Two touring songwriters pass through their current home, New York, this week. Maggie Rogers, who grew up in rural Maryland, started out folksy but untraditional, wielding a banjo and singing with supple purity; her album Blood Ballet was made when she was in high school. But she was drawn to dance music and electronics, and her recent EP, Now That the Light Is Fading (which includes the viral hit Alaska), merges rural-sounding melodies and programmed beats, thoughtful verses and poppy choruses  the natural (including sounds recorded outdoors) and the virtual. (Tuesday, April 11, Bowery Ballroom; Wednesday, Music Hall of Williamsburg.)

title: Saving an Afghan Symbol, With Afghans Only
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Nothing symbolizes the wrack and ruin of Afghanistan and its four decades of war better than Darulaman Palace, a once-magnificent edifice visible on its hillock perch for miles around.

description: A 13th-century house in the center of Bruges, renovated for today.

title: $2 Million Homes in California, Massachusetts and Texas

title: Season 2 of Fortitude Has More Icy Dread in Store
description: The supermarket shelves are nearly bare. The government in Oslo has turned its back. And the caverns holding the prehistoric treasure that transformed an Arctic outpost devoid of crime and death into a violence-filled petri dish have been buried under 300,000 tons of snow and ice. Season 2 of Fortitude, the British thriller previously shown on Pivot in the United States, opens with a rare heavenly spectacle called a blood aurora, a decapitation and a move to Amazon Prime starting Friday, April 14. Picking up nine weeks after the first installments wasp-filled cataclysm, the series finds Sheriff Dan Anderssen (Richard Dormer) vanished into the glacial wilderness after shooting the woman (Vernica Echegui) he loved. It also introduces Dennis Quaid into the cast as Michael Lennox, a genial fisherman intent on doing whatever it takes to find a cure for his terminally ill wife (Michelle Fairley)  and more unnameable dread than ever as this town on the Svalbard archipelago in Norway hurtles toward environmental catastrophe.

title: A.N.C. Backs Jacob Zuma, Papering Over Divisions in South Africa
description: JOHANNESBURG  The African National Congress in South Africa closed ranks on Wednesday behind President Jacob Zuma, who has faced growing criticism and calls for his resignation after firing a widely respected finance minister last week.

title: Elizabeth Strebs Choreography, With Action Heroes
description: Theres always a cloud of danger hovering over a work by Elizabeth Streb: It can be nerve-racking to watch but impossible to look away. She doesnt so much make dances as choreograph obstacles for the body to navigate, often with the help of elaborate contraptions she dreams up. But her shows are great fun, too, and funny at times.

title: At MoMA PS1, Tomas Rafa Explores Walls Real and Metaphorical
description: The prospect of a wall  a big, beautiful wall or a long, costly monument to fear  has entered American political discourse over the past year. But in the world traveled by the Slovakian artist and filmmaker Tomas Rafa, walls have been realities for a long time: some physical, made of reinforced concrete, and others metaphorical, maintained by increasingly virulent nationalist policies.

title: In & of Itself, Magic Is Not Just Hat Tricks
description: People often refer to the magic of live theater, but we dont generally mean the term to be as literal as it applies to In & of Itself, in previews now and opening Wednesday, April 12, at the Daryl Roth Theater.

title: Senator Jeff Merkley Spoke All Night Against Gorsuch Nomination (but It Wasnt a Filibuster)
description: WASHINGTON  It was the filibuster before the filibuster. Sort of.

title: Long Days, Google Docs and Anonymous Surveys: How the U.S. Soccer Team Forged a Deal
description: The United States womens soccer team pressed its fight for equal pay not in one dramatic moment at the negotiating table, but in a thousand small ones away from it. In text messages and phone calls, in hotel rooms and on bus rides, and at their homes in far-flung cities, the players fine-tuned their needs and their arguments and their solidarity.

title: Is There Really a Security Rationale for Banning Laptops on Planes?
description: Since late last month, airlines and travelers flying to the United States and Britain from several airports in Muslim-majority nations have been adjusting to bans on certain electronic devices in airplane cabins. Intelligence and counterterrorism officials have said the bans are reactions to new capabilities for attacks, including bombs hidden within consumer electronics.

title: Muslim Babies Likely to Outnumber Others by 2035, Report Says
description: For years, more babies were born to Christian women than to women of any other religion, but not for much longer: Islam is expected to take the global lead by 2035, according to a  report released on  Wednesday documenting the coming ebbs and flows of world religions.

description: S-Town, the latest narrative podcast from the producers of Serial, has already outdone its predecessor.

description: Once the home of tycoons and Titanic survivors, the village is now home to about 300 families.

title: Seeking the Truths Locked Inside a Child Soldier
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this article, Jeffrey Gettleman, The Timess East Africa bureau chief of more than a decade, explains the delicate dance involved in reporting a story about a severely traumatized boy in a land of scars.

description: A jury on Wednesday found a Spanish man guilty of murdering an American tourist who was on the Camino de Santiago, an ancient pilgrimage route, in 2015.

description: What are 10 words to describe the way you experience your sadness? What makes you feel tenderness? Describe a lonely day in one sentence.

description: In six years of war, President Bashar al-Assad of Syria has overseen a campaign of carnage, turning an enormous cache of deadly weapons against the very people they were presumably stockpiled to protect.

title: Deadly Blast Near Lahore Targets Pakistan Census Workers
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  At least six people were killed on Wednesday in an explosion in eastern Pakistan that targeted a team conducting the countrys first national census in nearly two decades, officials said.

title: Pepsi Pulls Ad Accused of Trivializing Black Lives Matter
description: Pepsi has apologized for a controversial advertisement that borrowed imagery from the Black Lives Matter movement, after a day of intense criticism from people who said it trivialized the widespread protests against the killings of black people by the police.

title: Films Like The Boss Baby Can Be Painful for Adoptees and Foster Kids
description: During family movie night some years ago, in an effort to spare my daughters delicate sensibilities, I lunged for the remote control to stifle Jerry Maguire during a sex scene Id forgotten all about. What I managed to hit was the fast-forward button. What ensued onscreen might be described as high-speed porn.

title: When Father John Misty Met Patton Oswalt
description: T brings together two people for the very first time  to see what happens.

title: For Internet Privacy, VPNs Are an Imperfect Shield
description: When Congress voted to overturn online privacy rules last week, Steve Wilmot, a Los Angeles songwriter, reacted like many worried consumers: He looked into signing up for a technology service known as a virtual private network, or VPN.

title: Eleven Madison Park Tops List of Worlds 50 Best Restaurants
description: Eleven Madison Park, one of New York Citys top-rated restaurants, won another accolade on Wednesday: the No. 1 spot on the annual list compiled by the Worlds 50 Best Restaurants organization.

description: For its 50th anniversary this year, the Beatles Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band, one of the most influential and acclaimed albums of all time, is getting a spruced-up reissue.

title: Reasons Not to Dismiss GPS Devices for Your Car
description: The smartphone has replaced so many other devices and tools  cameras, notebooks, tape recorders  that I thought the answer was  obvious when I asked Rik Paul, the autos editor at The Wirecutter, a product reviews website owned by The New York Times, if buying a GPS unit for the car made sense anymore. Boy, was I wrong.

title: 16 Noteworthy Watches From Baselworld 2017
description: TheBaselworld watch fair, which turned 100 this year, was a planet unto itself, an extraterrestrial realm where a $3,000 watch qualifies as entry-level and awatch containing a tourbillon(dont ask) for under $20,000 is a downright steal.

title: Trump Removes Stephen Bannon From National Security Council Post
description: WASHINGTON  For the first 10 weeks of President Trumps administration, no adviser loomed larger in the public imagination than Stephen K. Bannon, the raw and rumpled former chairman of Breitbart News who considers himself a virulently anti-establishment revolutionary out to destroy the administrative state.

title: Backing Up Vacation Photos on the Go
description: Q. I plan to take a lot of pictures on my next trip and load them to my laptop for storage and editing. I dont want to do online backup on the road for fear of unfamiliar wireless networks in foreign countries, and I dont want to haul a bulky USB drive around. What are my other options for backing up a lot of high-resolution photos?

title: Stephen Bannon Is Removed From Top National Security Council Post
description: President Trump removed Stephen Bannon from a top National Security Council post in a move directed by his national security adviser, Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster.

title: Court Clears Takeover of Polands New World War II Museum
description: WARSAW  Nearly a decade after it was first proposed, Polands Museum of the Second World War, billed as the most comprehensive public exhibition in Europe about the greatest cataclysm of the 20th century, opened on March 23.

title: A Dolphins Recipe for Octopus
description: Try having no arms and eating a live octopus thats crawling around on your head with its tentacles. Failure could mean its your last supper. But a population of bottlenose dolphins off the coast of Australia has found a way to do it.

title: Philippines and Communist Rebels Agree to a Temporary Cease-Fire
description: MANILA  Negotiators representing the government of the Philippines and Communist rebels agreed to a temporary cease-fire on Wednesday, moving one step closer to ending one of Asias longest running insurgencies.

title: Trump, Citing No Evidence, Suggests Susan Rice Committed Crime
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump said on Wednesday that Susan E. Rice, the former national security adviser, may have committed a crime by seeking to learn the identities of Trump associates swept up in surveillance of foreign officials by United States spy agencies, repeating an assertion his allies in the news media have been making since last week.

title: The Hawk Can Soar
description: I push the walker in front of me, its front wheels larger than the wheels in back. My right leg drags a little. My right foot drops. When I dont have the rollator in front of me  when I try to walk unaided  I have to bring my right hand up to my waist to create my own version of balance. Elbow clamped to my side. Stiffness where most other people have swing.

title: The Little-Known Officials on Whom Trumps Agenda May Rely
description: WASHINGTON  By most accounts, the Trump administration is running behind many of its predecessors in filling out its ranks. Under secretaries still need confirmation, staff members need to be hired and advisers named.

description: DIET CIG

title: Coal Is on the Way Out at Electric Utilities, No Matter What Trump Says
description: WASHINGTON  In Page, Ariz., the operators of the Navajo Generating Station, the largest coal-fired power plant in the West, have announced plans to close it by 2019. The electric utility Dayton Power & Light will shut two coal plants in southern Ohio by next year. Across the country, at least six other coal-fired power plants have shut since November, and nearly 40 more are to close in the next four years.

title: Tech Roundup: Facebook Loses Fight on New York Warrant Order

description: For years, corporate chieftains have spoken wistfully of wanting to bring home the more than $2 trillion in cash American companies have socked away overseas  if it werent for tax rates of close to 40 percent.

description: Ethics experts say Donald J. Trumps visits to properties owned, managed or branded by the Trump Organization amount to free publicity for the company and blur the line between his family business and presidential duties.

title: Antarctic Ice Reveals Earths Accelerating Plant Growth
description: For decades, scientists have been trying to figure out what all the carbon dioxide we have been putting into the atmosphere has been doing to plants. It turns out that the best place to find an answer is where no plants can survive: the icy wastes of Antarctica.

title: As U.S. Targets Berlin on Trade, German Manufacturers Lobby Trump
description: FRANKFURT  When Angela Merkel, Germanys chancellor, met with President Trump in Washington, she brought three executives with her, all heads of German manufacturing or engineering giants. Their message? Germany is not a threat to the United States.

title: At F.C.C., Obama-Era Rules on Chopping Block
description: WASHINGTON  When Congress voted to overturn internet privacy rules last month, the swift action by Republican lawmakers sent a clear message: They were just getting started.

title: Can Charities Survive Trump? For Some, Its Life and Death
description: Tom Sheridan opened his lobbying firm in 1991 with the motto Helping the good do better, and these days he could use all the help he can get.

title: Trumps View of Syria and Assad Altered After Unacceptable Chemical Attack
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump warned on Wednesday that he would not tolerate the heinous chemical weapons attack in Syria, opening the door to a greater American role in protecting the population in a vicious civil war that he has always said the United States should avoid.

title: Bull Markets Dont Mean Extra Jobs for Wall Street
description: Bull markets arent what they used to be, at least when it comes to New Yorks economy.

title: Dr. King on the Vietnam War
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Cuts Leave Bridge and Rail Projects Hanging
description: When President Trump pledged during the campaign to spend $1 trillion to restore Americas crumbling bridges and roads, supporters across the country cheered.

title: Fighting Deadly Diseases
description: To the Editor:

title: Bank Reform Architect Puzzled by Effort to Undo It
description: Barney Frank is puzzled.

title: Do Tax Cuts Really Spur Growth? It Depends on the Details.
description: If your tax rate were lowered tomorrow, how would it affect your work habits?

title: Trump, Asked About Accusations Against Bill OReilly, Calls Him a Good Person
description: Bill OReilly, the embattled Fox News host, received a powerful show of support on Wednesday from a longtime friend, interview subject, ideological sympathizer and fellow scandal-survivor: the president of the United States.

title: Bipartisan Votes on Supreme Court Nominees
description: To the Editor:

title: Pence and the President
description: To the Editor:

title: From Camp David to Oslo, Forging Drama from Diplomacy
description: In J. T. Rogerss Oslo, which opens on Broadway on Thursday, April 13, married diplomats foster peace in the Middle East with the help of cardamom-scented waffles. In Stephen Sondheim and John Weidmans Pacific Overtures, which opens at Classic Stage Company on May 4, gunboats are the pertinent goad. And in Rogelio Martinezs Blind Date, set for the Goodman Theater in January, Ronald Reagan and Mikhail Gorbachev achieve rapport after misquoting 80s films.

title: Who Is Mike Cernovich? A Guide
description: President Trump has frequently derided the news media as fake news, and on Tuesday his son, Donald Trump Jr., told the world there was one person he wants to see win the Pulitzer Prize, the highest honor in American journalism: Mike Cernovich.

title: Fed Is Expected to Pare Investment Holdings, Officials Signal
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve expects to start reducing its huge investment holdings later this year, unwinding a giant program undertaken in the wake of the financial crisis to revive the economy.

title: When Xi Jinping Visits Trump at Mar-a-Lago, Nothing Involving Golf Clubs
description: HONG KONG  President Xi Jinping of China is not expected to be strolling the manicured fairways of the Trump International Golf Club on Thursday, sizing up his approach shot.

title: Add Festival Season to the Fashion Calendar
description: Barbie Ferreira is 20  not too young, it would seem, to feel nostalgia for a time when Coachella, the California music festival that for many marks the advent of spring, seemed rife with possibilities, not least the chance for sartorial self-invention.

title: A Newspaper Writer Done In by CQ
description: To the Editor:

title: High School Journalists Land a Scoop, and the Principal Resigns
description: Four days after students at a high school newspaper in Kansas published an article that questioned the credentials of a recently hired principal, she resigned.

title: After an M.S. Diagnosis, an Emotional Return to the N.H.L. Ice
description: ST. PAUL  Fourth-line forwards like Bryan Bickell rarely draw much attention unless they mess up, especially on a night with so much pomp.

title: Jeffrey Fashion Cares
description: Male models strut their stuff at the 14th annual Jeffrey Fashion Cares fund-raiser.

title: Trump: My Attitude Toward Syria and Assad Has Changed
description: President Trump spoke about the recent chemical attack in Syria during a news conference with King Abdullah of Jordan on Wednesday. That attack on children yesterday had a big impact on me, he said.

title: An Expensive Price for Panera, but JAB Has Deep Pockets
description: Consolidation is fueling inflation in the fast-food market in the United States.

title: What Is Rikers Island?
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio has declared that within the next decade, the jail complex at Rikers Island would be shut down. The mayors announcement was an acknowledgment that despite the hundreds of millions of dollars devoted to fixing the problems in recent years, the jail cannot be saved.

title: Review: French Dancers Show Three Faces of Merce Cunningham
description: Death has not diminished the American modern-dance choreographer Merce Cunningham (1919-2009), at least in terms of his dances. Unknown films have been discovered; lost dances have been revived.

title: Review: Openly Inviting Ridicule in i hate myself :)
description: Ugly to look at and even uglier to listen to, Joanna Arnows whiny documentary i hate myself :) plays like an especially brutal exercise in self-analysis. The therapist, in this case, is Ms. Arnows camera, which she wields remorselessly throughout her yearlong relationship with James, a would-be performance artist and a fully credentialed lush.

title: Springtime Pick-Me-Ups Under $300
description: With winter officially behind us, and good weather supposedly before us, the mere glimpse of a once-beloved coat or cozy wool sweater is enough to send some of us into a tailspin of depression. Which is why, right about now, a fashion pick-me-up is usually in order. A prescription of sunny colors and quirky tropical-inspired accessories is recommended to induce the optimistic springtime mentality the vernal equinox failed to do. Best of all, the cure need not break the bank. All of these goodies ring up at under $300. Another reason to smile.

title: The Percussive Spectacle of Stepping
Review: Seeking Revenge for The Assignment She Didnt Want
description: Walter Hill is a smart veteran genre filmmaker (48 Hrs., Southern Comfort, Last Man Standing) whos never been above a little lurid sensationalism. But using forced gender-reassignment surgery as a major plot hinge for his latest movie, The Assignment, is arguably a miscalculated provocation.

title: Advocacy Groups Ask for Ban on Common Pesticide
description: Advocacy organizations seeking to ban a pesticide linked to developmental disorders in children asked the courts Wednesday to intervene and order the Environmental Protection Agency to ban the pesticide from food within 30 days and from all uses within 60 days if it cannot prove it is safe.

title: Refugee Designer Shines a Light on Global Issues
description: In summer 2014, a German astronaut on the International Space Station posted an image to his Twitter account with the caption, My saddest photo yet. It showed the lights of the Gaza Strip from above; what the astronaut saw but the static shot did not capture were rockets flying over the strip amid the regions 50-day war between Israel and Palestine.

title: Dont Let Jeff Sessions Undermine Police Reform
description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions recently ordered a review of federal agreements with a number of local law enforcement agencies aimed at reforming troubled departments. As a first step, the Justice Department on Monday asked a judge to delay a consent decree that would overhaul Baltimores police force.

title: The Goddess Yi Wan Ka: Ivanka Trump Is a Hit in China
description: BEIJING  When Wang Ge, a business school student, wakes up, she often asks herself, What would Ivanka do?

title: A Full Border Wall With Mexico? Unlikely, Homeland Security Chief Says
description: WASHINGTON  John F. Kelly, the homeland security secretary, said Wednesday that it was doubtful that a wall along the full border with Mexico would ever be built, despite an oft-repeated campaign promise by President Trump.

title: Study Finds Car Insurers Raise Rates in Minority Neighborhoods
description: A new analysis of car insurance in four states found that drivers living in some minority neighborhoods were charged higher rates than similar drivers in mostly white areas, even when the average risk of a claim was similar.

title: Syria, Stephen Bannon, Pink Star: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: 9 Podcast Episodes Worth Discussing
description: A short playlist to kickstart your podcast listening and an invitation to join The New York Times Podcast Club.

title: How to Join Our Podcast Club
description: Its easy to become a radio listener. You switch it on and turn the dial until you find something interesting. Done.

title: Perfectly Simple Shoes
description: Sometimes all you want is a classic shoe to get you through the workday and into the evening. But finding something simple in a fashion climate where mens designers keep trying to top one another is harder than it should be. These black derbies are so sturdy and trend-averse that almost no one will notice them.

title: Wall Street and Washington: A New Love Affair
description: Repealing Obamacare. Reforming the tax system. Spending big on infrastructure.

title: Rex Tillersons Reticence on North Korea Leaves Allies Confused
description: WASHINGTON  When North Korea launched a medium-range missile on Tuesday evening, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson issued a statement so cryptic that it left much of Washington confused.

title: Ts Design Issue Debuts at Design Week
description: We threw a party at the Salone del Mobile fair in Milan  designed by a dashing young architect.

title: Gifts for the Wedding Party
description: Most brides and grooms are consumed with planning the details of their wedding, from the venue to the menu. Butthe event isnt only about them. Bridal etiquette also requires the soon-to-be-wed couple to give thoughtful gifts to their parents and the bridal party. Manywho have been in other wedding parties alreadyhave the usual monogrammed stud boxes and gold or silver charms on a chain.

title: Modern Love Podcast: Laura Dern Reads I Will Be Your Mother Figure
description: On this weeks podcast, the actress Laura Dern reads an essay about an Episcopal priest who provides a lifeline for a gay parishioner when the church fails to support him.

title: Evidence Contradicts Russias Account of the Syria Chemical Attack
description: The Russian government has sharply contested accounts by international leaders and witnesses that a deadly chemical attack  in northern Syria last week was carried out by Syrian government forces. Heres what the available evidence, including a declassified four-page American intelligence report, tells us about the reliability of the Russian account.

title: Going (Nearly) Bare for a Good Cause
description: Youre always waiting for the day when what we do isnt necessary anymore, Jeffrey Kalinsky said aboard the Intrepid on Monday night, during the cocktail hour at the 14th Jeffrey Fashion Cares, his annual fund-raiser and runway show.

title: Learning to Love the Nuclear Option
description: This article has been updated to reflect news developments.

title: How Melbourne Landed the Worlds 50 Best Restaurants Awards
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  London. New York. Melbourne.

title: Father John Misty: The End Is Near, Sing All About It
description: Think things are dire? So does Joshua Tillman, the songwriter who is releasing Pure Comedy, his third album as Father John Misty. The title of Pure Comedy is one of the albums very few jokes, a bit of blunt irony for an all-too-persuasive set of songs envisioning global catastrophe as the inevitable result of human nature. Singing with earnest clarity, Father John Misty indicts selfishness, ignorance, distraction, vanity, politics, self-delusion, dogmatism, technocracy, God and, by no means least, himself.

title: Uniting Against Bill OReilly, Women Share Stories of Workplace Harassment
description: An inappropriate touch. An insulting dismissal. A sexual ultimatum. A suggestion that a job is not fit for a woman.

title: What Is the Nuclear Option?
description: Republicans are threatening to go nuclear if Democrats filibuster Neil M. Gorsuchs confirmation to the Supreme Court. Its a term meant to evoke horror, because it would turn the Senate from a debate-friendly body into a more partisan chamber like the House.

title: A Week of Sales, Celebrations and Other Shopping Events
description: From Thursday to Sunday, Matchesfashion.com will celebrate its 30th anniversary with an IRL residency in an Upper East Side townhouse. Stop by for fun programming, including a discussion of sustainable luxury with Gabriela Hearst and Julie Gilhart and a Wake Up to Wellness morning with the Sky Ting Yoga founders, Krissy Jones and Chloe Kernaghan. At 2 East 63rd Street. R.S.V.P. here.

title: Unwanted Advances Tackles Sexual Politics in Academia
description: UNWANTED ADVANCESSexual Paranoia Comes to CampusBy Laura Kipnis245 pages. Harper. $26.99.

title: Trumps Web of Business Ties
description: A look at the business backgrounds of Trump administration appointees and advisers.

title: Review: SHOT!, About the Man Who Captured Rocks Famous Faces
description: Mick Rock is a great name for a young Englishman with a camera, especially one who photographed Syd Barrett and David Bowie in the late 1960s and early 70s. The subject of this documentary notes more than once that his name, which is his real one, practically determined the course of his life and career.

title: How Should the U.S. Respond to Syria?
description: To the Editor:

title: Tictail Makes an Argument for the Worlds Small Creators
description: Of all the lies told on  and about  the internet, the most egregious is that anyone can, with a few keystrokes and a little search engine optimization, become a mogul. Barriers to entry are low, yes, and access to information is at a high, but it is still perilously easy for a small business to remain small.

title: China Yields on Professor as Australia Debates Diversity
description: Damien Cave, our new Australia bureau chief, shares insights on global news, local recommendations and feedback from readers in this twice-monthly newsletter. To receive it in your inbox, sign up here.

title: Review: Truman Focuses on a Man Whose Days Are Numbered
description: The title character in Truman is a dog, but this films director, Cesc Gay, does not excessively exploit him for cheap sentiment. Given the films story  about Julin (Ricardo Darn), an actor dying of cancer in Madrid, and Toms, an old friend (Javier Cmara) who visits him for four days  it must have been tempting.

title: Richard Simmons Signs With Licensing Firm. Is a Re-emergence Next?
description: Richard Simmons, the reclusive fitness mogul whose sudden disappearance from public life spawned a hit podcast, might soon return to public life, thanks to a business deal. And in the latest odd twist in Mr. Simmonss story, it may be a result of that podcast.

title: Manchester Citys Coach Says Hes Happy; Chelseas Has Reason to Be
description: LONDON  Quite often, the more Pep Guardiola pronounces his happiness, the less convincing he sounds. His tone of voice is just a little too flat, as though he is trying to convince himself as much as anyone else; his face appears just a little too straight.

title: A Toy for Toddlers Doubles as Code Bootcamp
description: It took a tentative step forward, turned to the left, took another step and then came to rest under a tree  at least, a drawing of one.

title: Trump, Syria, Pepsi: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: F.D.A. Nominee Deflects Criticism About Ties to Drugmakers at Hearing
description: WASHINGTON  Dr. Scott Gottlieb, President Trumps nominee to lead the Food and Drug Administration, told Congress on Wednesday that he could speed the approval of new drugs without compromising safety or increasing risks, deflecting questions about his past writings, drug-company investments and Mr. Trumps controversial positions.

title: South African Court Ends Ban on Sale of Rhinoceros Horns
description: A court in South Africa effectively overturned a national ban on the trade of rhinoceros horns, a move that was celebrated by the countrys commercial rhino breeders but condemned by animal preservation groups.

title: Jason Day Enters Masters a Little Bit Unprepared but With a Clearer Head
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  The beast that is the modern news cycle  the one that demands, What have you done for us in the last hour?  had taken its focus off Jason Day and shifted it to the resplendent rookie Jon Rahm and Dustin Johnson, the world No. 1 and winner of his last three tournaments.

title: Robert Gangi Announces Candidacy for Mayor of New York
description: He pulled campaign materials from a paper shopping bag, sought advice on which of two hats to wear in front of waiting reporters  before going with the fedora  and had to interrupt a news conference introducing his bid to be New York Citys next mayor.

title: Lolis Elie, Lawyer Who Helped Desegregate New Orleans, Dies at 87
description: Lolis Edward Elie, an undaunted civil rights pioneer whose advocacy as a lawyer, protest organizer and negotiator helped propel the racial desegregation of New Orleans, died on Tuesday at his home in the citys Treme neighborhood. He was 87.

title: Los Angeles Raids Target Investor Green Card Fraud
description: LOS ANGELES  Federal agents on Wednesday executed search warrants at several sites in greater Los Angeles that the authorities say were connected to a $50 million visa fraud operation that enabled Chinese citizens, including fugitives from the law, to secure green cards for permanent residency in the United States.

title: German Art Exhibition Documenta Expands Into Athens
description: ATHENS  In 2013, the curator Adam Szymczyk proposed a radical reinvention of Documenta, the prestigious contemporary art exhibition held every five years in Kassel, Germany: to split the show for the first time between its cozy German hometown and Athens, the epicenter of Europes economic, migration and democratic crises. The two-act exhibition would use culture to call attention to those crises and re-examine, maybe even shift, the power dynamics of Europe.

title: Arthur Bisguier, Brash, Self-Taught Bronx Chess Champion, Dies at 87
description: Arthur Bisguier, a largely self-taught chess grandmaster who brought a native Bronx brashness to his style of play in defeating some of the games greatest players while finding mostly frustration when he faced Bobby Fischer, died on Wednesday in Framingham, Mass. He was 87.

title: Dustin Johnson Hurts His Back in a Fall, but Still Hopes to Play
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Top-ranked Dustin Johnson, who has won his last three tournaments, slipped Wednesday afternoon on a set of stairs in the rental house where he is staying and hurt his back, his agent, David Winkle, confirmed.

title: Melania Trump Meets Queen Rania, as White House Grapples With Crises
description: A billionaire, a queen and an American first lady walked into a public charter school on Wednesday, collecting bouquets, examining owl pellets and hugging students amid the rapid-fire clicking of cameras.

title: Facebook Announces New Ways to Prevent Revenge Porn
description: The relationship may have faded long ago, but the intimate images you shared have not. If youre lucky, your ex deleted them. If youre not, the photos have sprouted up online.

title: Woman Who Got Settlement From OReilly Criticizes Trump for Defending Him
description: One of the women who received a settlement from Bill OReilly after making sexual harassment allegations against the top-rated Fox News host sharply criticized President Trump on Wednesday for defending Mr. OReilly.

title: Passing Moe
description: Dear Diary:

title: Canada Has Much to Prove Against Finland in World Championship Semifinal
description: PLYMOUTH, Mich.  When the womens ice hockey world championships opened here a week ago, the focus was on the American players and their fight for increased financial assistance and support from their governing body, U.S.A. Hockey.

title: On Supreme Court Split, Senators Agree: Its Bad for the Country
description: WASHINGTON  One by one, the senators shuffled to the lectern on Wednesday, explaining themselves grimly, reflecting on the specter of mutually assured destruction and wondering aloud how the Supreme Court nomination of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch had delivered the institution to this moment.

title: Christie Lies Low, but Cant Avoid Wrath of Commuters
description: As train delays, cancellations and gridlock set off by a small derailment at Pennsylvania Station stretched into a third day on Wednesday, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey remained largely silent while his constituents screamed. In fact, the governor was far from where the chaos was unfolding, choosing to go to Atlantic City to celebrate the opening of a casino while travelers vented their frustration on social media, on radio call-in shows and on packed platforms.

title: Ruben Amaro Sr., Infielder for Star-Crossed 64 Phillies, Dies at 81
description: Ruben Amaro Sr., an infielder who won a Gold Glove with the 1964 Philadelphia Phillies, a team infamous for its spectacular collapse during the pennant race, died on Friday in Miami. He was 81.

title: Corrections: April 6, 2017
description: SPORTS

title: President Trumps Most Important Meeting
description: Donald Trumps meeting with his Chinese counterpart this week will be the most important diplomatic encounter of his presidency so far. His two days of talks at Mar-a-Lago with President Xi Jinping will test whether the two men  Mr. Trump an unpredictable novice, Mr. Xi a tightly scripted, experienced leader  can begin to effectively manage the worlds most significant bilateral relationship.

title: Ferguson Re-Elects White Mayor 2 Years After Mike Brown Incident
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  When a national movement for racial justice flared here two and a half years ago, activists nationwide hoped to upend the political order. Ferguson was one of many predominantly black communities across the country that were under white control, and they strategized about ways to change that.

title: He, She, They and Us
description: Anemona Hartocollis, a higher education reporter for The Times, admits that, at first, the term transgender girl threw her. Before following Katherine Boone, an 18-year-old Syracuse high school student, through her sex reassignment surgery in 2015, Ms. Hartocollis did not know whether the term applied to people who identify as female or as male (the answer is the former). Its a system of nomenclature you have to be educated in, she said. There are a few basics, but perhaps the most fundamental: Use a persons preferred pronoun, whether its he, she, both or none of the above.

title: Track Flaws Are Focus of Penn Station Derailment Inquiry, Official Says
description: It is the question on the minds of many in the New York City area: Why is a relatively minor train derailment still wreaking havoc on my commute?

title: Bartolo Colon Is Back in Town, and the Mets Sure Could Use Him
description: The Atlanta Braves wanted desperately to be competitive this season. They are opening a new ballpark after finishing in last place in 2016. Too many nights last summer, their young pitchers were gone before the skies grew dark.

title: As Latest Health Plan Dies, Republicans Cant Agree on a Culprit
description: WASHINGTON  The new bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act is dead, killed off by House Republicans who never actually read the legislation  because in fact, it never actually existed.

title: New York City to Pay N.B.A.s Thabo Sefolosha $4 Million to End False-Arrest Suit
description: New York City has agreed to pay $4 million to Thabo Sefolosha, a forward with the N.B.A.s Atlanta Hawks, to settle a federal lawsuit in which he accused five police officers of false arrest and using excessive force during an encounter outside a Manhattan nightclub, the citys Law Department said on Wednesday.

title: Advertiser Exodus
description: These companies pulled advertising from The OReilly Factor after multiple settlements surfaced, revealing allegations of sexual harassment or other inappropriate behavior by its host, Bill OReilly.

title: Bannons Out. But Did H.R. McMaster Win?
description: The Trump administrations decision to remove its chief strategist, Stephen Bannon, from the National Security Councils principals committee, along with the deputy national security adviser K.T. McFarlands likely exile to Singapore, as the United States ambassador, seems to indicate that Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster, the national security adviser, is finally getting a little hard-earned bureaucratic traction.

title: In Canada, Where Muslims Are Few, Group Stirs Fear of Islamists
description: STONEHAM-ET-TEWKESBURY, Quebec  Patrick Beaudry, bejeweled, tattooed and bearded, lives on a remote wooded hillside in rural Quebec, worrying about living under Shariah law.

title: Telling Trumps Story to Children: For Book Publishers, Its Tricky
description: On Nov. 10, Beth Sutinis sat at her desk in Brooklyn with a big task looming. As the executive editor for the childrens division of Time Inc. Books, she and her colleagues had worked through the fall to update their book Presidents of the United States. They added a spread about Barack Obama, another about the 2016 election and a third about Hillary Clinton, who polls had indicated would be elected the 45th president.

title: A Taste of Trump Family Biographies for Young Readers
description: Biographies of a newly elected president  and in some cases, his relatives  are a fixture of childrens book publishing. Below are excerpts from books featuring President Trump; the first lady, Melania; and the presidents daughter, Ivanka.

title: Different Portraits of a Gambler as a Trader Emerge at Trial
description: The insider trading trial of William T. Walters drew nearer to a close on Wednesday as defense lawyers presented testimony from the last of their witnesses and federal prosecutors gave closing arguments.

title: Quotation of the Day: Tale of Unorthodox President Stumps Childrens Publishers
description: It was one of the harder things I have had to do in a long career of writing and editing nonfiction for kids.

title: Trump Weighs Infrastructure Bill but Keeps New York Up in the Air
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump said he was considering accelerating the introduction of his $1 trillion infrastructure bill  but he pointedly refused to say whether he planned to include two major New York City transportation projects that his budget for next year would defund.

title: Partial Transcript: Trumps Interview With The Times
description: WASHINGTON  The following is a partial transcript of President Trumps interview with The New York Timess Maggie Haberman and Glenn Thrush. It has been lightly edited for content and clarity, and omits several off-the-record comments and asides.

title: Arkansas Parole Board Recommends Clemency for Death-Row Inmate
description: The Arkansas Parole Board has recommended that one of the eight men set to be executed during a 10-day span this month receive clemency and be spared capital punishment.

title: Review: Gently Down the Stream, a Romance and a Gay History Tour
description: If the past is a foreign country, as L. P. Hartley once wrote, Rufus desperately wants to visit it  preferably with an experienced resident as a guide. He may be just 28, but this English lawyer is the kind of gay man whos more interested in the stylings of the  cabaret singer Mabel Mercer than in hi-NRG house music. So hes excited to meet Beau, a pianist who accompanied Mercer in the 1960s, via an online dating site.

title: Playbook Symbols
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  Hugs and kisses, everyone. Or playbook symbols. Whatever floats your boat, because Damon Gulczynski is back with Xs and Os and a very clever Thursday theme that will mean different things depending on how you interpret those symbols.

title: Review: Kevin Kline Serves Ham in Soigne Silk in Present Laughter
description: Its high time we were reminded again of what a great physical comedian Kevin Kline is. Playing an aging matinee idol in the bouncy new revival of Nol Cowards Present Laughter, Mr. Kline blissfully plies the witty athleticism and derring-do that won him two Tony Awards (On the 20th Century, The Pirates of Penzance) and an Oscar (A Fish Called Wanda) in his youth.
17Facebook

title: Jeff Bezos Says He Is Selling $1 Billion a Year in Amazon Stock to Finance Race to Space
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  Standing against the backdrop of his New Shepard rocket booster and a full-scale mock capsule for carrying humans into space, Jeff Bezos revealed on Wednesday that he was selling about $1 billion in Amazon stock a year to finance his Blue Origin rocket company.

title: Christian Bale in Talks to Play Dick Cheney in Biopic
description: LOS ANGELES  The Dark Knight himself, Christian Bale, is in talks to play the lead in a Dick Cheney biopic that Paramount Pictures and Plan B Entertainment hope to begin shooting in September.

title: Cuomo Hails Progress on Budget, but a Long Easter Break Beckons
description: ALBANY  With the state budget late and getting later, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo said Wednesday evening that negotiations on the states $150 billion spending plan were being held up by three issues involving affordable housing, charter schools and a deal to raise the age of criminal responsibility.

title: Syria Chemical Attack: Heres What Happened
description: One of the worst chemical attacks in the Syrian civil war occurred on Tuesday in opposition-held Idlib Province. Dozens of people died, including children. Then the blaming began.

title: Dolan Acknowledges Confronting Knicks Fan Outside the Garden
description: A somewhat bizarre Knicks season that has included a lot of bad basketball and an ugly incident in which a former Knicks star was forcibly removed from Madison Square Garden now has one more head-shaking moment: an acknowledgment by the teams owner, James L. Dolan, that he got into a verbal altercation with a fan outside the Garden on Tuesday night.

title: Jacob deGrom Displays His Old Form, but the Mets Sputter
description: The fifth pitch from Jacob deGrom in the Mets 3-1 extra-innings loss on Wednesday was a 98-mile-per-hour fastball at the knees of Atlanta Braves center fielder Ender Inciarte, who fouled it off. That was faster than any of the 2,353 pitches deGrom threw during his 2016 season, which was hampered by injuries.

title: Modesty on the Runway
description: Full-length skirts and high necklines are becoming a common sight in fashion collections.

title: Promise You a Rose Garden: Ex-White House Florist Tells All
description: President Trump and the first lady, Melania Trump, held their first official black-tie event at the White House in late February. They used gold-rimmed china commissioned by the former first lady Laura Bush, and centerpieces of white flowers and grapes. I thought it was refined and elegant, said Laura Dowling, who until her tenure ended abruptly in 2015 was the White House chief floral designer. I was surprised to see such a pared-back aesthetic from them.

title: Women, Fashion Has You Covered
description: It is a truism of the history of dress that decade-defining looks generally dont congeal until quite late in the period they eventually come to represent. The miniskirts and Crayola colors of the 1960s, the power shoulders of the 80s, the minimalism of the 90s  all reached critical mass well into the midpoint of those eras, when whatever had been bubbling up in wardrobes and on sidewalks found its reflection in the wider world.

title: Well-Made Coffee Migrates to Midtown Manhattan
description: Finding coffee in Midtown Manhattan, home to nearly two-thirds of New York City hotel rooms and a good number of caffeine-starved office workers to boot, is as easy as walking down the street. After all, there are about 50 Starbucks locations from 33rd to 52nd streets alone, according to the company, with aggressive expansion planned from the savvy chain Gregorys Coffee. But seeking out well-made coffee  with delicately roasted beans and swan-neck kettles pouring precisely into a row of Kalita Waves (the Ferrari of Japanese pour-over filters)  has more often been reserved for a trip downtown, or to Brooklyn. Not anymore.

title: Word + Quiz: biennial
Mistakes Come Early for Michael Pineda as Yankees Fall to Rays
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Wednesday was one of those inevitable days for the Yankees when they make news without really trying.

title: Syria, Pepsi, Stephen Bannon: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: It Takes a Small Army to Equal Arnie
description: The first major event after a patriarchs passing can be rough on his family. As the golf community gathers at Augusta National Golf Club for the Masters this week, Arnold Palmers absence from the tournament he dearly loved and won four times will be acutely felt.

title: Letter to New Jerseys Attorney General
description: In response to the second Amtrak derailment at Pennsylvania Station in as many weeks, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey has instructed his state's attorney general to seek legal action to recover payments made to Amtrak by New Jersey Transit.

title: Gov. Chris Christies Letter to Amtrak
description: The governor of New Jersey wrote a letter to express his displeasure at the rail company's response to this week's train derailment at Pennsylvania Station, the second such incident in as many weeks.

title: In Letter to Amtrak, Christie Says N.J. Transit Will Halt Payments
description: Gov. Chris Christie directed New Jersey Transit late Wednesday to halt all payments to Amtrak because of a train derailment on Monday and subsequent delays that have ensnarled Garden State commuters this week, according to two letters obtained by The New York Times.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: Jordskott and The BFG
description: Jordskott, the latest moody Scandinavian thriller, with yet another stoic female police officer, skulks onto Shudder. The BFG lumbers its way onto Netflix. And BritBox becomes the place to go for classic Doctor Who episodes.

title: The Role of Public Broadcasting
description: President Trump has proposed a budget that eliminates the National Endowment for the Arts, the National Endowment for the Humanities and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. Much more money would go, instead,  to the military.

title: Foes on the Run as Erdogan Makes Power Personal
description: Members of the Gulen religious movement insist they are innocent of plotting against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey, but he has chased them into the shadows, and they fear for their lives and livelihoods. At the same time, Mr. Erdogan has increasingly made himself the face of Turkeys state, and now he is seeking more authority to rule. This is the fifth and final part of the State of Emergency series, in which our correspondent takes us behind the scenes of a nation in crisis.

title: What Have You Learned From a Younger Person  and What Have You Taught An Older Person?
description: Do you have a younger relative or friend? Do you babysit, tutor or coach younger kids?

title: In Haiti, Taking Time to Take Pictures
description: Instead of parachuting in for quick assignments covering chaos, Thomas Kern works away from the pack, taking his time to find moments of universal appeal.

title: Why Authoritarians Attack the Arts
description: In 1937, ascending leaders of the Third Reich hosted two art exhibitions in Munich. One, the Great German Art Exhibition, featured art Adolf Hitler deemed acceptable and reflective of an ideal Aryan society: representational, featuring blond people in heroic poses and pastoral landscapes of the German countryside. The other featured what Hitler and his followers referred to as degenerate art: work that was modern or abstract, and art produced by people disavowed by Nazis  Jewish people, Communists, or those suspected of being one or the other. The degenerate art was presented in chaos and disarray, accompanied by derogatory labels, graffiti and catalog entries describing the sick brains of those who wielded the brush or pencil. Hitler and those close to him strictly controlled how artists lived and worked in Nazi Germany, because they understood that art could play a key role in the rise or fall of their dictatorship and the realization of their vision for Germanys future.

title: My Most Unpopular Idea: Be Nice to Trump Voters
description: When I write about people struggling with addictions or homelessness, liberals exude sympathy while conservatives respond with snarling hostility to losers who make bad choices.

title: The Wrong Move on Student Loans
description: The Obama administration made the right call in 2015 when it barred debt collectors from gouging borrowers who default on student loans and then agree to payment plans that let them make good on the debt and rebuild their ruined credit.

title: Creeping Toward Crisis
description: I am racked with anxiety that our buffoonish president  who sounds so internationally unsophisticated and who is still operating under a cloud of illegitimacy  is beginning to face his first real foreign crises.

title: Rising Risks for Retirement Savers
description: As Americas population ages, opportunities for a secure retirement should increase. But the opposite is happening. And things are likely to get worse in the Trump years.

title: Should America Have Entered World War I?
description: One hundred years ago today, Congress voted to enter what was then the largest and bloodiest war in history. Four days earlier, President Woodrow Wilson had sought to unite a sharply divided populace with a stirring claim that the nation is privileged to spend her blood and her might for the principles that gave her birth and happiness and the peace which she has treasured. The war lasted only another year and a half, but in that time, an astounding 117,000 American soldiers were killed and 202,000 wounded.

title: Trump Bets the House
description: Each in its own way, the Trump administration, the Republican Senate and the Republican House face ideological conflicts between fiscal conservatism, white identity politics and right-wing populism.

title: How Trump Can Improve the Messy U.S.-Chinese Economic Relationship
description: The United States and China are locked in a mutually dependent, frequently dysfunctional economic partnership. The worlds biggest and second-biggest economies are like a married couple that complain about each other constantly yet cant even contemplate a divorce.

title: In Boston, Cavaliers Make a Point: Theyre Still the Cavaliers
description: BOSTON  The Cleveland Cavaliers had not been playing terrific basketball since the N.B.A. All-Star break. Teammates were squabbling on the bench. Their rebounding was atrocious. Their defense? Pass the Pepto. The entire package was enough to create some concern among the basketball-watching intelligentsia that the Cavaliers might be in some trouble.

title: Letting Photos Reveal Themselves in Haiti
description: Distance and finances would keep Thomas Kern from dropping everything and dashing to Haiti to cover the latest political or environmental crisis. While scores of journalists would descend on the island for brief trips, Mr. Kern  a freelance photographer who at times has lived in San Francisco or Switzerland over the last 20 years  had to take a different approach, slower and solo.

title: The Very Tiny Dancers
description: In 360, watch the littlest dancers at a community audition in Queens for the School of American Ballet. The school has diversified its student body.

title: Questions for: Haley Says U.S. May Take Our Own Action on Syrian Chemical Attack
description: Article: Haley Says U.S. May Take Our Own Action on Syrian Chemical Attack

title: Letter of Recommendation: Berliner Fernsehturm
description: A friend recently told me about an apartment in Berlin where you can get a geography lesson while using the toilet. The bathroom has a window covered in a frosted sticker with a small square cut out at the eye level of a person perched just so. Through the square one such person can see a side-view mirror attached to the building, and reflected in the mirror are blinking red lights and a bright, kooky structure that looks like a silver golf ball on a skewer. Above the peephole a handwritten inscription reads, in German: Berlin, Capital of the G.D.R.

title: Just the Right Amount of Space in Williamsburg
description: Kenneth Buchanan grew up in Virginia Beach, Va., and lived for three years in the Washington area, before landing in a small one-bedroom in a new midrise building in Arlington, Va.

title: Mitch Albom: By the Book
description: The author of Tuesdays With Morrie and, most recently, The Magic Strings of Frankie Presto avoids grim, angst-ridden, navel-gazing books and horror. Enough of that in the real world.

title: Senate Republicans Deploy Nuclear Option to Clear Path for Gorsuch
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans on Thursday engineered a dramatic change in how the chamber confirms Supreme Court nominations, bypassing a Democratic blockade of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch in a move that will most likely reshape both the Senate and the court.

title: In the Shadow of a Fairy Tale
description: When she was 6, my stepdaughter, Lily, told me that her favorite character in Cinderella was the evil stepmother. This wasnt entirely surprising. During play dates, Lily often liked to play orphan, writing down long lists of chores: dichs (dishes); moping (mopping); feeding (the fish). She and a friend liked to drink something they called pepper water, which was ordinary tap water they pretended their cruel orphan-handlers had made undrinkable. Maybe it was thrilling to stage her own mistreatment, to take power over the situation of powerlessness she had imagined. Maybe she just liked a virtuous reason to dump water on the floor. When I asked Lily why Cinderellas stepmother was her favorite character, she leaned close to me and whispered, like a secret, I think she looks good.

title: The Very Tiny Dancers
description: Ballet dancers come in all shapes and sizes  proportion is what really matters. But mental strength and resolve? They come from within. The giveaway that children have a sliver of the commitment required for the arduous path of a dance career reveals itself, funnily enough, not in their movement but in their stillness. Of the aspirants waiting their turn sitting against a mirror or standing rigidly as a ballet teacher checks legs for turnout and extension, its the quiet ones who stop you in your tracks.

title: A College Application Guide for Gap Year Students
description: Applying to college is onerous enough. Asking to defer enrollment for a year can be even more intimidating. Heres how to navigate the gap-year process.

title: 36 Hours in Cyprus
description: Recovered from its economic woes, the mythological birthplace of Aphrodite is solvent again and undergoing a rebirth of its own.

title: Tuscany Travel Tips From Massimo Ferragamo
description: As the chairman of Ferragamo USA, Massimo Ferragamo, 59, the youngest son of the founder of the fashion house Salvatore Ferragamo, has strong roots in fashion, but recently, hes unexpectedly found a second career in the world of hospitality. In 2003, Mr. Ferragamo, prompted by his penchant for Tuscan wine, purchased Castiglion del Bosco  an 800-year-old, 5,000-acre estate in Montalcino, Tuscany  and spent five years transforming the property into an upscale resort.

title: Trump Administration to Take Harder Tack on Trade With China
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  The Trump administration is planning to roll out its first concrete measures against China on trade, administration officials said on Thursday, hardening its position toward Americas largest trading partner just as President Trump welcomed President Xi Jinping of China to his seaside club here for their first face-to-face meeting.

title: Readers Tell Us: Is a Gap Year Worth It?
description: Exploring new paths, figuring out a field of study to pursue in college or simply taking a break are just a few reasons high school graduates are taking gap years. We asked readers who have taken a year off from their education what they learned and what tips they have for those who are considering the same. Responses were edited for length and clarity.

title: Egg, Cheese and Toast, Mumbai Style
description: Mumbai is a city of great egg dishes  hard-boiled curries and frankies, wrestlers omelets and masala scrambles. Eggs Kejriwal is just one dish in its vast canon. This egg-and-cheese toast isnt new, but its newly internationally famous, like a stage actor cast in a superhero film. I found my way to it last year at Paowalla in Manhattan  an egg with a warm, tender yolk under a fat blanket of melted cheese, smudged with bright green chutney. Jet-lagged, on deadline, I was restored by it again at Dishoom in London, a chain inspired by Mumbais old Irani cafes, where they grill the cheese until its golden and put two runny eggs on top.

title: First Familys Needs Strain Secret Service
description: WASHINGTON  Eleven weeks into the Trump presidency, the Secret Service is grappling with how to constrain the rising costs and unexpected strain that have come with protecting a new first family as large, mobile and high-profile as any in modern American history.

title: Independence Days: My Perfect Imperfect Gap Year
description: Midway through a lackluster freshman year at the University of San Diego, I called my parents and told them I planned to leave school after the spring semester. They took the news pretty well considering they had just shelled out more than $50,000 in tuition and living expenses at one of the ritziest private universities in the country, a university where the gym bears the name of the dietitian Jenny Craig and some dorms feature an ocean view. Here, you could easily graduate unaware that 1 in 10 students at surrounding California State universities is estimated to be homeless.

title: The Essays That Did the Trick
description: Quadruplets from Ohio coordinated their college admission essays. Here is what they sent in.

title: Quadruplets Offer Colleges Package Deal. Harvard and Yale Buy It.
description: It was Nick Wades idea to write about being a quadruplet. He went on a college advice website called College Confidential, and in a chat room about college admissions essays, asked whether other people thought this would be a good idea.

title: In the South Bronx, Lives Marred and Erased by Firearms
description: Daniel Rice and Kevin Thomas were living emblems of the ravages of gun violence in the South Bronx.

title: The Daily Show Names the Greatest Trump Tweet of All Time
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Syria, Stephen Bannon, Pepsi: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Daily: With Trump in the Oval Office
description: Listen and subscribe from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Is Snooping on Teenagers Ever O.K.?
description: Adolescence comes with a thorny problem: Teenagers suddenly yearn for privacy just when their lives are expanding to include a range of risky new opportunities.

title: New York Today: The City and the Great War
description: Good morning on this stormy Thursday.

title: Morning Agenda: Fed Is Expected to Pare Investment Holdings
description: The Federal Reserve is loosening its grip on the American economy.

title: To Train a Donkey, Find a Zebra
description: Timianne Sebright, four months pregnant, held a gate with one hand and a 500-pound zebra with the other and asked if I was ready to take over.

title: A Great Indian Novel Reaches American Shores
description: Troubles  like ants  seldom walk alone. In GHACHAR GHOCHAR (Penguin, $15, paper), a new novella by the Indian writer Vivek Shanbhag, translated from Kannada by Srinath Perur, a family is besieged by both and develops a taste for responding with imaginative cruelty. Sudden wealth only makes them more ruthless. Its true what they say  its not we who control money, its the money that controls us, the nameless narrator realizes, a little late in the day. When theres only a little, it behaves meekly; when it grows, it becomes brash and has its way with us. Money had swept us up and flung us in the midst of a whirlwind.

title: Turning 107, and Sipping (Brandy) From His Bronx Fountain of Youth
description: The problem with turning 107, Joe Binder said, is that you cant work no more.

title: Club Team Thrives in the Shadow of the Frozen Four
description: BENSENVILLE, Ill.  At the Edge Ice Arena in this quiet suburb about 20 miles west of Chicago, the banners hang above the ice rink in orderly fashion, 12 on one side, six on the other. Each flag celebrates seasons gone by, showcasing achievement like any other successful college hockey program.

title: 7-Elevens Parent Will Buy Sunocos Convenience Stores
description: TOKYO  Seven & I Holdings, the Japanese retail giant that owns the 7-Eleven convenience store chain, said Thursday it had agreed to buy the Sunoco chain of gas stations for $3.3 billion, accelerating its expansion in the United States.

title: 6 Reasons You May Not Graduate on Time (and What to Do About It)
