description: NASA is getting new looks at Jupiter, from close up and far away.

title: Trumps View of Syria: How It Evolved, in 19 Tweets
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump had a blunt warning for his predecessor.

title: California, Drenched by Winter Rain, Is Told Droughts Over
description: After six years of a prolonged drought in California, it is all but over. On Friday, Gov. Jerry Brown ended the drought emergency for the vast majority of the state. The drought had reduced Folsom Lake, a major reservoir in Northern California, to less than a third of its capacity in 2015, and all but wiped out the Sierra Nevada snowpack.

title: Retail Payrolls Sustain a New Blow as Shopping Habits Shift
description: Doors at many Macys, Sears and J. C. Penney stores may still be open, but some of the jobs they once supported are starting to vanish.

title: Syrian Refugees Laud U.S. Strike and, in New Emotion, Trump
description: Less than two months after arriving in the United States as a refugee from Syria, Rashid Mahmoud rejoiced at the news of American missiles pummeling a Syrian air base Thursday night, and struggled with an unexpected sentiment: praise for President Trump, who has more often seemed like an antagonist than an ally.

title: Trump Must Get Congresss O.K. on Syria
description: NEW HAVEN  President Trumps airstrike on Syria represents a foreign policy U-turn. The destruction of the Islamic State, not President Bashar al-Assad, had been Mr. Trumps overriding objective. But this turnaround also has profound constitutional consequences.

title: What to Cook, Watch, Listen To and More This Weekend
description: Its spriiiiing! (O.K., its still spring, but now it feels like spring.)

title: A Woman With a Mallet, Mounted on a Horse
description: Growing up, I lived near a polo field, and on weekends I would bike out to the fields edge and look on from a distance, too shy, too young and too unsure of how much of my allowance it would sap to join the spectators with their fancy hats. I wanted to get closer to the action, but even more I was dying to know what it felt like to be out there on the field. From what I could tell from my faraway spot on the tree line, you had to be male, South American and totally fearless to play polo. I did ride horses, but decent hunter-jumper though I was, I didnt fulfill any of these other requirements.

title: Want to Join the Supreme Court? Master the Artful Dodge
description: For Judge Neil M. Gorsuch to win Senate confirmation as an associate justice, he had to learn how to say nothing much at all.

title: Werent Syrias Chemical Weapons Destroyed? Its Complicated
description: WASHINGTON  When the Syrian government carried out a gruesome chemical attack on civilians this week, many people had a question: Didnt the Obama administration, working with Russia and international experts, destroy Syrias chemical weapons stocks in 2014?

title: Ex-CUNY Official Is Charged With Fraud
description: Carmine Marino, who held several positions at the City University of New York, has been charged with embezzlement and fraud, federal and state investigators said.

title: When N.B.A. Coaches Rest Their Stars, the Owners Get Restless
description: It is neither glamorous nor new, but Commissioner Adam Silver considers it the most important issue for the N.B.A. right now: star players missing games for the sole purpose of rest.

title: Carmine Marino, a Former CUNY Official, Is Accused of Stealing $81,000 From Tuition Accounts
description: A former senior finance official with the City University of New York was arrested on Friday and charged with embezzlement and fraud, accused of siphoning about $81,000 from student tuition accounts, federal and state investigators said.

title: Significant Other to End Its Run on Broadway
description: Significant Other, a poignant comedy exploring the contours of contemporary loneliness, is closing April 23.

title: South Africas Protesters Have It Right
description: Its hard to know what more it will take for the African National Congress, South Africas governing party, to curb the outrageous rule of President Jacob Zuma. His corrupt, scandal-riddled leadership over the last eight years has done inestimable damage to his country and to the moral authority of the A.N.C., Nelson Mandelas party. He was at it again a week ago, in a late-night purge of his government that included the firing of a respected finance minister, Pravin Gordhan, who had sought to rein in the presidents irresponsible spending.

title: Bill OReillys Family Values Book Tops Charts, as He Faces Abuse Claims
description: The timing of Bill OReillys latest best-selling book could hardly be more awkward.

title: G.O.P. Lawmakers, Once Skeptical of Obama Plan to Hit Syria, Back Trump
description: WASHINGTON  In 2013, as President Obama sought congressional support for strikes against Syria in retaliation for a chemical weapons attack, he did not find takers in Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky or Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, both Republicans.

title: Airstrike in Syria Overshadows Meeting Between Trump and Xi
description: PALM BEACH, Fla.  President Trump welcomed President Xi Jinping of China here for a first meeting on Friday that ended up being less about great-power collaboration than a chance for the Chinese leader to witness a raw display of American military might.

title: After Chemical Attack, Asking if U.S. Remarks Emboldened Assad
description: WASHINGTON  On March 30, Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson and United Nations Ambassador Nikki R. Haley, in separate appearances, reversed American foreign policy and said the Trump administration was not focused on getting rid of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria.

title: Do You Agree With Trumps Decision to Order a Missile Strike on Syria?
description: Weigh in with Times Insiders weekly question.

title: The First Televised War
description: I arrived in Saigon in mid-April 1966 as the new NBC bureau chief. My job, simply defined, was to supply NBC News with an endless story of the war. I understood there would be no letup, no relief day to day as our stories poured from the bureau.

title: OReillys Troubles Give Viewers Pause, but They Still Watch
description: AURORA, Colo.  With repercussions from the sexual harassment allegations against Bill OReilly rippling through the country this week, Kimberly JaJack, a longtime Fox News enthusiast, descended into her basement on Wednesday, curled onto the sofa and clicked on the television.

title: Trumps Syria Strike Has Some Critics Cheering and Some Fans Booing
description: WASHINGTON  His longstanding critics cheered. Some of his supporters were horrified.

title: Chasing Golf History, Rory McIlroy Struggles With an Elusive Quarry
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  For Rory McIlroy, the Masters title is like a feather. Every time he has tried to grasp it, the energy from his effort has pushed it out of his reach.

title: Anger Over Principal Prompts Parents to Occupy East Harlem School Overnight
description: In the annals of clashes between parents and school administrators, it may be a high water mark: A group of parents occupied an elementary school auditorium in East Harlem overnight and vowed not to leave until the principal resigned.

title: Chelsea Brown, of Laugh-In, Dies at 74
description: Chelsea Brown, an actress and dancer remembered as a cast member on Rowan & Martins Laugh-In in the late 1960s and as Rosey Griers love interest in the memorably strange 1972 low-budget horror film The Thing With Two Heads, died on March 27 in Chicago. She was 74.

title: No Death Spiral: Insurers May Soon Profit From Obamacare Plans, Analysis Finds
description: In contrast to the dire pronouncements from President Trump and other Republicans, the demise of the individual insurance market seems greatly exaggerated, according to a new financial analysis released Friday.

title: Opponent of Venezuelas Ruler Is Barred From Holding Office
description: A Venezuelan politician seen as a main contender to challenge President Nicols Maduro in next years election has been barred by the government from holding public office for 15 years.

title: Glenn OBrien, Writer and Editor Who Gained Fame With Warhol, Dies at 70
description: Glenn OBrien, an influential writer and editor who was a social fixture in the downtown Manhattan art, music and fashion world for a half-century, died of pneumonia on Friday in Manhattan. He was 70.

title: Is It Last Call for Craft Beer?
description: BOSTON  When craft brewers get together, we agree that this is the greatest time in history to be a beer drinker in America. In 1981, there were only 82 breweries in the United States, and our beer, fizzy and flavorless, was the laughingstock of the beer world. Today, America is home to over 5,300 small, innovative craft breweries making unique, flavorful, creative brews.

title: After the Airstrikes on Syria, Whats Next?
description: It was hard not to feel some sense of emotional satisfaction, and justice done, when American cruise missiles struck an airfield in Syria on Thursday. The countrys president, Bashar al-Assad, needed to understand that there would finally be a cost for his brutality, in this case the use of chemical weapons with sarin, a banned nerve agent, that killed scores of civilians earlier this week in one of the worst atrocities of the Syrian civil war.

title: Budget Deal Comes Together in Albany, After Delay and Frustration
description: ALBANY  After a week of impasse and the worst budget crisis of his administration, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo emerged from his Capitol office late Friday night to announce a deal on a $153 billion state budget that includes a plan for tuition-free education at state colleges.

title: The History of Racism I Didnt Want to Share
description: One day I returned from lunch to find four or five police detectives in the office I share with others at a college library. It turned out that a valuable book was missing, and the police had received my name as someone who might have come in contact with it. In fact, I had never touched the book.

title: The Nets Brook Lopez on Starting a Brooklyn Legacy
description: Archie Goodwin is teammate No. 109, the most recent arrival at Barclays Center. Brook Lopez embraces all the new players, the same way generous veterans once welcomed him as a first-round draft pick back in 2008.

title: Backsliding on Abusive Police
description: There is no need to reopen the Obama Justice Departments painstaking investigations of nearly two dozen police departments accused of widespread abuse, or the court-enforced agreements the department reached requiring cities like Cleveland, Seattle and Ferguson, Mo., to enact reforms. When Attorney General Jeff Sessions suggested that he might back away from those agreements, he was playing to police officers who have bristled at calls to root out racist and unconstitutional practices that have been well documented by the Justice Department.

title: With Strike Aimed at Halting More Gas Attacks, U.S. Tries to Send Syrians Message
description: WASHINGTON  The American cruise-missile strike that destroyed at least 20 warplanes in Syria on Friday was devised by American war planners as a one-time operation to deter President Bashar al-Assad from using his secret stockpile of chemicals ever again.

title: Romance, Sarcasm, Math and Language
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Have you ever just lit up at the sight of a new entry? I did today, and darn that Jeff Chen, he held that surprise until the last Down entry.

title: Tomi Lahren Sues Glenn Beck, Saying She Was Fired for Her Stance on Abortion
description: Tomi Lahren, a fiery, fast-talking rising star in conservative media, on Friday sued her employer and its founder, the right-wing media personality Glenn Beck, claiming they fired her to retaliate after she revealed her support for abortion rights.

title: Trump Fires Warning Shot in Battle Between Bannon and Kushner
description: WASHINGTON  As he grappled on Thursday with his first major decision involving military action, a fed-up and frustrated President Trump turned to his two top aides and told them he had had enough of their incessant knife-fights in the media.

title: Three Brooklyn Clinics, 6.3 Million Oxycodone Pills and 13 Indictments
description: Officials in New York arrested 12 people on Friday in what was described as a conspiracy involving three Brooklyn medical clinics that helped flood the streets with prescription painkillers while defrauding Medicare and Medicaid out of millions of dollars.

title: L.G.B.T. Advocates Criticize Nominee for Army Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  A Tennessee state senator who has criticized federal attempts to bar discrimination against gay, lesbian, bisexual and transgender people in workplaces and businesses was nominated on Friday to be President Trumps next secretary of the Army.

title: Corrections: April 8, 2017
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Quotation of the Day: A Significant Blow to U.S. Ties, Putin Says
description: The United States took a very measured step last night. We are prepared to do more, but we hope that will not be necessary.

title: Who Was in the Room? These Advisers Joined Trump for the Syria Strike
description: WASHINGTON  In any major crisis involving speed, judgment and getting reliable information, the first question any president needs to decide is this: Who is invited to the meeting to discuss the strategic options?

title: Phil Mickelson to Join Jordan Spieth in a Marquee Pairing
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  At 46, Phil Mickelson is twice as old as Jordan Spieth is. But they were equals on the Masters leaderboard Friday, tied at even par after Mickelson carded a 73 and Spieth a 69 on another windy day at Augusta National.

title: A Victory for Zack Wheeler, Though the Scoreboard Doesnt Show It
description: When spring training began in February, Zack Wheeler had no idea where he would end up to start the season. In the Mets bullpen? In the rotation? Perhaps in extended spring training in Florida to work off the rust from two years away with injury? For Wheeler and the Mets alike, the near future was clouded with uncertainty.

title: U.S. Wins Fourth Straight Womens Hockey World Championship
description: PLYMOUTH, Mich.  In the nearly 30-year history of the United States womens ice hockey team, one moment stands out as the high point: winning the gold medal in the 1998 Olympics.

title: Luis Severino Stumbles Off the Mound, Then Falls Apart on It
description: BALTIMORE  Luis Severinos fall from grace between his excellent rookie season of 2015 and his dispiriting sophomore year of 2016 was shocking. His fall from the mound in the fourth inning at Camden Yards Friday night was merely frightening, and only for a moment.

title: When Solar Panels Became Job Killers
description: WUHAN, China  Russell Abney raised two children on solar power. The 49-year-old Georgia Tech graduate worked for the last decade in Perrysburg, Ohio, a suburb of Toledo, pulling a good salary as an equipment engineer for the largest American solar-panel maker.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Louis C.K. on S.N.L., and Kubo and the Two Strings
description: Louis C.K. takes his act to the Saturday Night Live stage. Pierce Brosnan trades his Irish accent for a Texas one to play a vicious rancher with a nose for oil in The Son. And Kubo and the Two Strings, a splendidly animated Oscar-nominated family diversion, arrives on Netflix.

title: Arrest in Stockholm Truck Attack: We Think He Is the Driver
description: STOCKHOLM  The Swedish police said on Saturday that they had arrested a 39-year-old Uzbekistan-born man they believed had hijacked a beer truck and carried out a terrorist attack by driving the truck into a crowd of people in Stockholm the day before, killing four and injuring at least 15 others.

title: Milan Furniture Fair Comes Alive
description: Every year, Milan becomes the center of the design universe, when furniture makers, interior decorators, buyers, journalists and other design aficionados converge for the Salone del Mobile Milano or the Milan Furniture Fair. In addition to the official event, held in a sprawling fairgrounds outside the city center, Milan comes alive with countless design pavilions held in 18th-century courtyards and brutalist landmarks. Here is a detailed look at some of the exhibits we came across.

title: Where Smoke Falls and Blue Jeans Hover
description: Salone del Mobile, an annual furniture and design fair, transforms Milan with installations from innovative designers from around the world. Experience the wonder of five exhibitions in this 360 video.

title: Men Bet She Would Fail; Now She Runs a $26 Billion Fund
description: From the moment Dawn Fitzpatrick stepped onto the American Stock Exchange trading floor as a clerk in 1992, she sensed that the odds were against her. Surrounded by men in jackets barking trade orders, she stood out in her pleated skirt and twin sweater set. Traders around her began wagering over how long Ms. Fitzpatrick, then 22, would last.

title: Assad Has Shown He Will Not Respond to Reason
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: He Saves Fashion Models From Financial Chaos
description: Marquita Pring has appeared in fashion shoots for Italian Vogue and in ad campaigns for Levis, LOral and Lane Bryant. As a top plus-size model signed to IMG Models, she makes a very good living. But whenever Ms. Pring goes shopping, she hears a little voice in her head saying, Do you really need those Gucci flats?

title: A Business With Legs (and Abs): Boom Times for Male Striptease Revues
description: LOS ANGELES  It all started with Uncle Tony.

title: How to Get a Good Nights Sleep
description: Start by turning off the lights (yes, that includes you, Mr. Phone) and saying your prayers. Then you can move on to more newfangled techniques.

title: At Cafe Milano, Politicians Are Served Dinner and Peace of Mind
description: WASHINGTON  As the sun was setting one recent evening, two black Chevrolet Suburbans pulled up next to Cafe Milano, the Georgetown restaurant where some of the worlds most powerful people go to be noticed but not approached. Steven T. Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, slipped out of one of the vehicles and lingered with his Secret Service detail in front of the restaurants wall of windows. His fiance, the actress Louise Linton, emerged wearing a sleeveless blush-pink jumpsuit, as if this were Studio 54 by the Potomac.

title: Sleep Is the New Status Symbol
description: At M.I.T.s Media Lab, the digital futurist playground, David Rose is investigating swaddling, bedtime stories and hammocks, as well as lavender oil and cocoons. Mr. Rose, a researcher, an inventor-entrepreneur and the author of Enchanted Objects: Design, Human Desire and the Internet of Things, and his colleagues have been road-testing weighted blankets to induce a swaddling sensation and listening to recordings of Icelandic fairy tales  all research into an ideal sleep environment that may culminate in a nap pod, or, as he said, some new furniture form.

title: A Note to Tiger Woods: Victory Isnt the Only Path to Joy
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Dear Tiger,

title: Tim Pigott-Smith, Actor Who Put Prince Charles on the Throne, Dies at 70
description: Tim Pigott-Smith, an acclaimed British character actor who in the 1980s vaulted to fame on television in The Jewel in the Crown and who more recently won accolades playing the title role in the West End and Broadway productions of King Charles III, died on Friday in Northampton, England. He was 70.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: Why Well Miss Walt Mossberg
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: 17 Great Stories That Have Nothing to Do With Politics
description: Welcome to Our Picks, a guide to the best stuff to read, watch and listen to from around the internet. Check this space for the must-read long-form article, the next great podcast for your commute, the news-making tweetstorm. And yes, were also tooting our own horn here. Well share cant-miss Times articles from the week and reveal some gems you might have overlooked.

title: A Plague of Ice Cream Trucks
description: Q. I live in a co-op across from a park in Woodside, Queens, where ice cream trucks stop daily from 11:30 a.m. until 9 p.m. during warmer months. My neighbors and I are tormented by the jingle that plays on a loop and by the noise and fumes produced by idling truck engines and refrigeration equipment. I cannot sit on my terrace when the trucks are parked nearby because of the fumes, and if I open my windows, they fill my home. Calls to 311, local politicians and community boards have proved useless. What recourse, if any, do I have?

title: Alexandra Utsey and Christopher Jones: He Got the Job. They Got Each Other.
description: Alexandra Elizabeth Utsey and Christopher Edward Jones were married April 8 at the French Huguenot Church in Charleston, S.C. The Rev. Wendell Thomas Guerry, an associate pastor at the church, performed the ceremony.

title: U.S. Attack on Syria Cements Kremlins Embrace of Assad
description: MOSCOW  If Russia once maintained at least a semblance of distance from President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, it rushed to his defense after the American missile strike ordered by President Trump on Thursday. The attack cemented Moscow more closely than ever to the notorious Syrian autocrat.

title: After Xi Leaves U.S., Chinese Media Assail Strike on Syria
description: BEIJING  With President Xi Jinping safely out of the United States and no longer President Trumps guest, Chinas state-run media on Saturday was free to denounce the missile strike on Syria, which the American president told Mr. Xi about while they were finishing dinner.

title: South Carolina Inmates Charged in Killings of 4 Other Prisoners
description: Two South Carolina prison inmates serving life sentences for murder were charged with killing four other inmates inside a maximum-security prison, the authorities said Saturday.

title: PTA Gift for Someone Elses Child? A Touchy Subject in California
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  Of all the inequalities between rich and poor public schools, one of the more glaring divides is PTA fund-raising, which in schools with well-heeled parents can generate hundreds of thousands of dollars a year or more.

title: To Charm Trump, Paul Manafort Sold Himself as an Affordable Outsider
description: WASHINGTON  Paul Manafort is the rarest of professional pitchmen: one who knows how to sell to a salesman.

title: Once a Trump Critic, Nikki Haley Casts Herself as His Leading Diplomat
description: UNITED NATIONS  Before and after he became president, Donald J. Trump made it pretty clear that he didnt see much value in the United Nations. So when he named Nikki R. Haley as his choice for United Nations ambassador, many wondered whether he was simply shunting a tough critic into a trivial post.

title: A Strike in Syria Restores Our Credibility in the World
description: After President Bashar al-Assad of Syria once again attacked his own citizens with poison gas, the civilized world recoiled in horror at images of children writhing in pain and suffocating to death. President Trump voiced this justified outrage at a news conference on Wednesday, and the next day he took swift, decisive action against the outlaw Assad regime. But these strikes did more than simply punish Mr. Assad and deter future attacks; they have gone a long way to restoring our badly damaged credibility in the world.

title: After Aung San Suu Kyis First Year in Power, Dismay Swirls in Myanmar
description: MAWLAMYINE, Myanmar  The scene would have been unlikely a year ago. Tens of thousands of demonstrators filled the streets to protest a decision by Daw Aung San Suu Kyis government to name a new bridge for her father.

title: Hindu Group Claims Christians Tried Forced Conversions in India
description: NEW DELHI  Police officers in the northern Indian state of Uttar Pradesh were called to a Christian church in the Maharajganj district on Friday by members of a Hindu youth group who demanded that the officers investigate a group of Americans they believed were engaged in forced religious conversions.

title: Philippines on Dutertes Order to Occupy Disputed Islands: Never Mind
description: MANILA  The Philippine government on Saturday walked back comments by President Rodrigo Duterte ordering the armed forces to occupy uninhabited islands in the disputed South China Sea after the comments caused tensions to spike with China.

title: Meteorite Finder Fights Chinas (Mostly Terrestrial) Property Law
description: BEIJING  One summer day, a Kazakh herder in northwest China noticed a giant black boulder that he did not remember seeing before in the grasslands where he raises sheep and cattle. He left it there, and it sat undisturbed for more than two decades.

title: Bush Steps Back Into Spotlight to Help Africa Fight Epidemics
description: WINDHOEK, Namibia  In a bleak hospital waiting room, a half-dozen women infected with H.I.V. described how they were able to deliver healthy babies because of drugs purchased with money from the United States.

title: Boris Johnson Cancels Moscow Visit, Citing Events in Syria
description: In a surprise announcement on Saturday, Britains foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, said that because of the situation in Syria, he had canceled a long-delayed official visit to Moscow that was to begin on Monday.

title: Boom or Bust: Stark Partisan Divide on How Consumers View Economy
description: Economics has a foundation in hard numbers  employment, inflation, spending  that has largely allowed it to sidestep the competing partisan narratives that have afflicted American politics and culture.

title: 8 Memorable Moments From the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame Induction
description: Whats a Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction ceremony without some drama? Its a night of speeches and performances.

title: Afghan Security Reforms Falter, With Tough Fighting Ahead
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Last year, the American military spent more than $100 million to rebuild the Afghan Armys 215th Corps, which is battling resurgent Taliban militants in the southern province of Helmand.

title: Bannons Views Can Be Traced to a Book That Warns, Winter Is Coming
description: WASHINGTON  Stephen K. Bannon has read the book three times. He still keeps a copy of it  one thats creased and copiously underlined  in a library with the rest of his favorites at his fathers house in Richmond, Va.

title: Variety Puzzle: Marching Bands
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  I love Marching Bands puzzles, cannot get enough of them. Who wouldnt love it when there are essentially two puzzles to solve for your money? I cannot stop marveling at how constructors get the words and phrases to march together in their Rows and Bands.

title: The Emerging Trump Doctrine: Dont Follow Doctrine
description: WASHINGTON  As he confronted a series of international challenges from the Middle East to Asia last week, President Trump made certain that nothing was certain about his foreign policy. To the extent that a Trump Doctrine is emerging, it seems to be this: dont get roped in by doctrine.

title: U.S. Strike on Syria Brings Fleeting Hope to Those Caught in Brutal Conflict
description: ISTANBUL  Six years of war in Syria have ravaged the life of Ebrahim Abbas, 27.

title: How Readers Helped Soccer Player on Next Leg of His Journey
description: When Idi Diallo shared his story with New York Times readers in December, he was staying in a shelter in Harlem and weighing whether to pursue college or chase his lifelong dream of playing professional soccer. He was working part time at a bar to pay for plane tickets for tryouts across the country. He had several tryouts but could not afford to get to them all.

title: From College Hopes to Immigrant Travails, Neediest Cases Had Global Reach
description: Three college scholarships. The possibility of a job after nine years without one. Temporary immigration approval after years of waiting. And a $10,000 check made out to a Honduran family at a time when President Trump is enacting strict policies on immigration.

title: Amid the Spanish Moss of Florida, a Treasure Chest of Chinese Literature
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  In 1971, Elling O. Eide was a promising young scholar of Chinese poetry, working on his Ph.D. thesis and teaching at the University of Illinois. Then came a letter that set in motion the creation of either a wonder or a folly: a great library of Chinese literature housed amid the Spanish moss and alligator ponds of Floridas gulf coast.

title: 59 Missiles Dont Equal a Foreign Policy
description: It has been a head-spinning week watching the Trump administration stumble into its first international crisis only to emerge with a transformed policy on the use of force in the Middle East, announced on Thursday with the unleashing of 59 sea-launched cruise missiles against the regime of Bashar al-Assad in Syria.

title: What Chinese News Reports Tell Us About Beijings View of Trump
description: They dined by candlelight, discussed thorny issues like trade and North Korea and took walks under palm trees. In public, President Trump and President Xi Jinping of China offered little more than smiles and clichs during a meeting this week in Florida.

title: Pitcher Charlie Morton Could Help the Astros, if He Stays Healthy
description: The Houston Astros, overloaded with talented position players and dominant relievers, looked like a contender in spring training. The only question would be their starting rotation  but Jeff Luhnow, their general manager, wanted to make something clear.

title: Congo President Names Ex-Opposition Leader as Prime Minister
description: KINSHASA, Democratic Republic of Congo  President Joseph Kabila of Congo has named a former leading member of the main opposition coalition as his prime minister, but the appointment seems unlikely to resolve the countrys political crisis or satisfy the opposition, analysts say.

title: Calgary Flames Come Together and Make a Fast Turnaround
description: EL SEGUNDO, Calif.  During Eastern trips, N.H.L. teams occasionally take the train from one city to the next. It is an opportunity for teammates to bond while paying homage to the leagues olden days, when players sporting trench coats and fedoras rode the rails in an era predating charter flights.

title: U.S.-Led Force Reduces Attacks on ISIS in Syria After Airstrike
description: WASHINGTON  The American-led task force that is battling the Islamic State has sharply reduced airstrikes against the militants in Syria as commanders assess whether Syrian government forces or their Russian allies plan to respond to the United States cruise missile strike on a Syrian airfield this past week, American officials said.

title: Hillary Clinton, Free to Speak Her Mind
description: In the most wrenching, humiliating way possible, Hillary Clinton has been liberated. She is now out of the woods again, and speaking her mind.

title: The Passion of Southern Christians
description: NASHVILLE  In the world of apostolic betrayals, its Judas who gets the headlines, but the everyday believer is more apt to fall in line behind Peter. Coldly handing Jesus over to his death in exchange for 30 pieces of silver was an over-the-top, cartoon-level move, but Peters terrified denial of the man he believed to be the savior of the world? That one seems immensely human to me.

title: The Unions That Like Trump
description: Like Ronald Reagan, Donald Trump racked up the support of millions of blue-collar white voters in Midwestern swing states, and like Mr. Reagan, the 45th president is pushing to nail down more blue-collar support to ensure a lasting Republican majority. In doing so, Mr. Trump has championed many issues straight out of organized labors wish list  he is pressing manufacturers not to ship jobs overseas, he has promised $1 trillion in infrastructure spending, he has threatened a 35 percent tariff to slow Mexican imports and he has vowed to overhaul Nafta.

title: Now, the Ball Is in John Robertss Court
description: Over the past two months, as the nation has watched a new president drop one depth charge after another  banning Muslim refugees; ordering the demolition of broadly accepted rules protecting air, water and American consumers; flouting conflict-of-interest and other ethical standards honored by his predecessors in office  Americans have looked to the courts, the one aspirationally nonpartisan branch of government left to them, to stop him.

title: Up Against the Wall
description: A. By the way, if you want to know if a wall works, just ask Israel. Israel built a wall and it works.

title: What Happened to Who?
description: I first noticed it during the 2016 Republican presidential debates, which were crazy-making for so many reasons that Im not sure how I zeroed in on this one. Who was being exiled from its rightful habitat. It was a linguistic bonobo: endangered, possibly en route to extinction.

title: All the Presidents Generals
description: BY the standards of recent American presidencies, two very normal-seeming things happened in the Trump administration last week. On Wednesday, Steve Bannon, the presidents not particularly effective strategist and ideologist, was demoted out of the National Security Councils principals committee. And on Thursday, the president rained cruise missiles onto Syria.

title: The Myth of Main Street
description: Shortly after Donald Trump was elected president, John Solak, a resident of Binghamton, N.Y., began lobbying the city to rename its Main Street Trump Street. The proposal, though quixotic, succinctly captured the hopes for economic salvation that Mr. Trump represented to so many voters in country towns and small cities across the nation. At each and every campaign stop, Mr. Solak explained to a Binghamton radio station, he mentioned the blight of upstate New York and the economy here.

title: The Gorsuch Fight Changed the Senate. Will It Change the Court?
description: Seattle  The ascent of Judge Neil M. Gorsuch to the Supreme Court has changed the Senate. No longer will a minority of its members be able to block the confirmation of nominees to the nations highest court. And his appointment has changed the presidency, which now benefits from an easier confirmation process. But what about the Supreme Court itself? Is Judge Gorsuchs appointment likely to change the body he is joining?

title: Learn a Rivers Name Before Its Gone
description: Once, on a road trip with friends from New York to California, I kept a list of every river and stream we crossed, starting with the Hudson.

title: The Utter Uselessness of Job Interviews
description: A friend of mine once had a curious experience with a job interview. Excited about the possible position, she arrived five minutes early and was immediately ushered into the interview by the receptionist. Following an amicable discussion with a panel of interviewers, she was offered the job.

title: Covering Sports. Including Smelt Fishing. And Bighorn-Sheep Hunting.
description: MARCH Madness is a three-week binge of fast breaks and alley-oops, of brilliant shots and embarrassing bricks, of reigning champions and stunning redemptions. If you are a reader of The New York Times, the NCAA tournament is also a time to learn why rubber shoes squeak on wooden floors, why some coaches prefer an open collar to a necktie, and why Marquette tried  and failed  to push its players to eat veggie wraps rather than hamburgers.

title: Bannons Worldview: Dissecting the Message of The Fourth Turning
description: WASHINGTON  Stephen K. Bannon has great admiration for a provocative but disputed theory of history that argues that the United States is nearing a crisis that could be just as disruptive and catastrophic as the most seminal global turning points of the last 250 years.

title: Hannah Is a Girl. Doctors Finally Treat Her Like One.
description: NEW HAVEN  Hannah is a 14-year-old girl, clad in leggings and an oversize T-shirt, with long brown hair that she curls around a finger. She was also born a boy.

title: Dont Make Passover Too Easy
description: Eleven years ago, I stayed with a Jewish family in Zimbabwe for Passover. There was no supermarket with kosher holiday foods nearby, so nearly every dish was made from scratch, from the chopped herring down to the stuffed grape leaves. My hosts had roots in both Lithuania and the Greek island of Rhodes, and each dish was rooted in the familys distinct story; a few even featured the avocados growing in the backyard.

title: Seeking Insight Into Trump Voters
description: To the Editor:

title: The Dread of Taxes That Even Beyonc Cant Fix
description: Right now, in my inbox, there are 367 unanswered emails. This is not because I dont care about email  I very much do. I compulsively check mine every 10 minutes or so. But there is a whole batch of emails  367 of them  that I have seen only a preview line of and then not even bothered to open. Instead, I let them linger, glaring at me.

title: Basque Separatist Group ETA Hands Over Weapons to French Authorities
description: The French police on Saturday collected weapons, ammunition and explosives from the Basque separatist group ETA in a step toward the groups disarmament, a development that prompted a wary response from the Spanish government.

title: Indian Man Accused in Multimillion-Dollar Call-Center Swindle Is Held
description: MUMBAI  The police on Saturday detained a 24-year-old man suspected of running a multimillion-dollar fraud from a network of Indian call centers, tricking hundreds of unwitting Americans into believing they owed money to the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Yankees Gary Sanchez Heads to Disabled List With a Strained Biceps
description: BALTIMORE  This was supposed to be the season in which the Yankees would begin their youth movement  an attempt to rebuild the team as the kind of homegrown contender that attained four World Series titles in the 1990s.

title: U.S., Mexico and Canada Likely to Affirm Joint World Cup Bid
description: Top soccer officials from the United States, Mexico and Canada have scheduled what they billed as a historic announcement for Monday in New York  the clearest indication yet that the countries will mount a joint bid to host an expanded 48-team World Cup in 2026.

title: Ex-Ranger Derick Brassard Helps Carry Ottawa Past His Old Team
description: Ottawa clinched second place in the N.H.L.s Atlantic Division and home-ice advantage for the first round of the Eastern Conference playoffs with a 3-1 victory over the visiting Rangers on Saturday.

title: Having Nothing On
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  I dont know how many people actually read the puzzle bylines, but if you do, the name Byron Walden might make you quake in your boots. Mr. Walden is known for his tough cluing and his ability to come up with entries that can make you feel that perhaps you have a lot more to learn about the English language than you thought.

title: Quotation of the Day: Rising China Waters Imperil a World of Progress
description: What climate change says is that if you want to maintain the city as a good place to live and work for everyone, business as usual wont do.

title: Justin Rose and Sergio Garca Top Leaderboard at Masters
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  The 81st Masters tournament is being played in the memory of Arnold Palmer, but it could be dedicated to spine specialists.

title: Jordan Spieth Returns to Contention by Playing Without Fear
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Jordan Spieth stood in the woods, his line of sight blocked by a tree and his ball 228 yards from the 13th green.

title: Hacking Attack Woke Up Dallas With Emergency Sirens, Officials Say
description: Officials in Dallas said the citys warning system was hacked late on Friday night, disrupting the city when all 156 of its emergency sirens sounded into the early hours of Saturday morning.

title: A Kentucky Derby Contender Slips Out From a Santa Anita Crowd
description: ARCADIA, Calif.  In the paddock and the walking ring before the Santa Anita Derby, the ratio of trainers to horses has rarely been smaller than it was Saturday. Animals outnumbered their human coaches by nearly two to one.

title: Devils Send Off Patrik Elias, a Star From Brighter Days
description: NEWARK  Paige Schector had nearly two hours to kill at Prudential Center on Saturday before the Devils played their final home game of the season, but she was first in line outside the doors.

title: Corrections: April 9, 2017
description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: After the Mets Praise Robert Gsellman, the Marlins Bruise Him
description: The Mets pitching blueprint this season depicted a steady procession of dynamic pitchers to send out to the mound each night, with the back end of their rotation bearing a load equal to that of the front.

title: Eugene Lang, Investor Who Made College Dreams a Reality, Dies at 98
description: Eugene M. Lang, an investor whose spur-of-the-moment promise to an East Harlem sixth-grade graduating class that he would pay for their college education inspired a foundation, led to the support of more than 16,000 children nationwide and made him something of an American folk hero, died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 98.

title: Caroline Boneparth, Michael Dechert
description: Caroline Anne Boneparth, a daughter of Heather H. Boneparth and Peter Boneparth of Kiawah Island, S.C., was married April 8 to Michael Douglas Dechert, the son of Susan Schultz Dechert of Rock Island, Ill., and Kenneth S. Dechert of Avon, Ohio. Rabbi Arnold M. Belzer led the ceremony at the River Course Clubhouse at the Kiawah Island Club, with Chaplain Patricia A. Tillman, a Lutheran minister, participating.

title: Amanda Woodruff, Enrique Santos
description: Amanda Lee Woodruff and Enrique Raphael Santos were married April 7 at the Mackey House, an event space in Savannah, Ga. Franklin Martinez, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Ann-Marie MacFarlane, Yves Lawson
description: Ann-Marie Rene MacFarlane and Yves Anthony Lawson were married April 8 at the Monastery, an 1812 building in New Orleans that is now a wedding space. The Rev. Fred Luter, a Baptist pastor officiated.

title: Erin Hartigan, Marc Lavallee
description: Erin Ann Hartigan and Marc Edward Lavallee were married April 8 at the Decatur House, a historic home in Washington. The Rev. Patrick J. Conroy, a Roman Catholic chaplain of the United States House of Representatives, officiated.

title: Lillian Blackshear, Clifton Peay III
description: Lillian Marie Blackshear, the daughter of Margaret A. Blackshear and Julian W. Blackshear Jr. of Nashville, was married April 8 to Clifton Lawrence Peay III, the son of Cathie E. Peay and Dr. Peay Jr. of Midlothian, Va. Judge Angelita Blackshear Dalton of the general sessions court for Nashville Davidson County Division III and a cousin of the bride officiated at the Union Station Hotel in Nashville.

title: Maressa Criscito, Jared Berkey
description: Maressa Christine Criscito and Jared Lee Berkey were married April 8 at the Vanderbilt Mansion at the Fisher Island Club in Miami Beach. Dominic Church, a Florida notary public, officiated.

title: Kathryn Marie Ogletree, Benjamin Story
description: Kathryn Marie Rimbey Ogletree, the daughter of Mary-Lynn Ogletree and the Rev. Dr. Thomas W. Ogletree of Guilford, Conn., was married April 8 to Benjamin Jason Story, a son of Andrea Story and Thomas Story of San Diego. The brides father, a United Methodist minister, officiated at the Prado in Balboa Park in San Diego.

title: Molly Cohen, Baishi Wu
description: Molly Samantha Cohen and Baishi Wu were married April 7 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Alisa Fuentes, a staff member in the New York City Clerks Office, officiated.

title: Rachel Lavipour, Daniel Nauheim
description: Rachel Lena Lavipour and Daniel Adam Nauheim were married April 8 at the Weylin, an event space in Brooklyn, by Rabbi Robert Levine, who officiated.

title: Randi Eichenbaum, Daniel Sternberg
description: Randi Michele Eichenbaum and Daniel Lawrence Sternberg were married April 7 at the Ritz-Carlton Dove Mountain, a resort in Marana, Ariz. The Rev. Brian L. Marsh, a Presbyterian minister, officiated, with Rabbi Helen T. Cohn taking part in the ceremony.

title: Gricel Okazaki, James Mutton
description: Gricel Okazaki and James Samuel Mutton were married April 4 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Alisa Fuentes, a staff member in the New York City Clerks Office, officiated.

title: Emily Miles, Joshua Smith
description: Emily Celia Miles and Joshua Benjamin Smith were married April 8 at the Strand, the bookstore in New York. Kevin Jennings, a friend of the bride and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Portia Rosemond, Patrick Ragen
description: Portia Danielle Rosemond and Patrick Mason Ragen were married April 8 at the Cathedral of St. Vibiana, an event space in Los Angeles. Billie R. Keller, a pastor with New Macedonia Missionary Baptist Church in Pasadena, Calif., officiated.

title: Gayatri Patel, Raamin Mostaghimi
description: Gayatri Mahesh Patel and Raamin Mostaghimi were married April 8 at the Torpedo Factory Art Center, an event space in Alexandria, Va. Arash Mostaghimi, a member of the Newton Massachusetts Bahai Local Spiritual Assembly and the grooms cousin, officiated with Brahmachari Sharan, a Hindu priest and a chaplain at Georgetown University, who performed the Hindu portion of the ceremony.

title: Emily Hirshey, Joseph Tracy
description: Emily Mara Hirshey and Joseph Michael Tracy were married April 8 at Calamigos Ranch in Malibu, Calif. Bryce Schramm, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Islanders Defeat Devils but Are Eliminated From the Playoffs
description: NEWARK  The Islanders stirring run, extended with a victory over the Devils on Saturday, came too late. A little more than an hour after the team won its fifth straight to keep its slim playoff hopes alive, it was eliminated from playoff contention when Toronto rallied to beat Pittsburgh.

title: Last Years Loss Propels Denver to Its Eighth N.C.A.A. Title
description: CHICAGO  For the better part of 12 excruciating months, the Denver University mens hockey team had gone about its business to leave the past in the rearview mirror, determined not to revisit the bitter emotions it has carried since last years Frozen Four.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Jonah Hill in War Dogs and The White Queen Marathon
description: Revel in the absurdity as Jonah Hill and Miles Teller play a serious subject for laughs in War Dogs. Take a refresher course on The White Queen before its sequel, The White Princess, arrives. And celebrate some innovative young directors with Noah Baumbachs Greta Ha.

title: The Oliviers vs. the Tonys: Mixed Rewards for Shows
description: LONDON  This Sunday night, the Olivier Awards will honor the best of London commercial theater. Theres a long history of Olivier-winning shows that went on to enjoy good fortune at Broadways equivalent prizes, the Tony Awards: Four years ago, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time, scooped a record-setting seven Oliviers before cleaning up with five Tonys when it transferred to New York. And last year, the Tony-coronated Kinky Boots, repeated its New York best musical triumph with a London win in the same category.

title: On S.N.L., Alec Baldwin Is Trump, Bill OReilly and Trump (Again)
description: In its first new episode in nearly a month, Saturday Night Live featured Alec Baldwin in a double dose of topical comedy, first in the shows cold open, portraying President Trump as he typically does, then later reprising the role in a sketch where he also played the embattled Fox News host Bill OReilly.

title: American Soldier Is Killed in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An American Special Forces soldier was killed in eastern Afghanistan during a joint operation with Afghan forces against affiliates of the Islamic State, officials said on Sunday.

title: Egypt Declares State of Emergency, as Attacks Undercut Promise of Security
description: TANTA, Egypt  Rattling a country already wrestling with a faltering economy and deepening political malaise, two suicide bombings that killed 44 people at Coptic churches in Egypt on Palm Sunday raised the specter of increased sectarian bloodshed led by Islamic State militants.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1.5 Million
description: 297 Oldwoods Road, Franklin Lakes

title: Syria, Trump Doctrine, Masters: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: China Investigates Regulator of Fast-Moving Insurance Industry
description: SHANGHAI  Chinas anti-corruption investigators are targeting the countrys top insurance regulator, throwing doubt over an industry that has been behind a wave of blockbuster global deals but has raised concerns about financial risk in the worlds second-largest economy.

title: How to Write a New York Times Headline
description: The story that landed on Arlene Schneiders desk was a Frugal Traveler column about the bars and clubs of South Beach, Fla., and her job was to write the headline that would appear in print.

title: Candidates Line Up Behind Legacy of Former Brooklyn District Attorney
description: In February, as Eric Gonzalez, the acting Brooklyn district attorney, was getting ready to run for a four-year term, he sent out a news release hinting at how he might conduct his campaign.

title: Stockholm Suspect Was Denied Asylum and Told to Leave in 16
description: STOCKHOLM  The Uzbek man arrested in the terrorism rampage in central Stockholm last week was an asylum seeker whose application was rejected and who in December was given four weeks to leave the country, the Swedish police said on Sunday.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: With Listening Tour, de Blasio Tries Courting Staten Island. Again.
description: The tables were draped in blue cloth, with white folding chairs arranged where city commissioners and their staff would soon sit, across from everyday Staten Islanders voicing their concerns.

title: A Polarized Supreme Court, Growing More So
description: WASHINGTON  Viewed one way, Judge Neil M. Gorsuchs confirmation will not do much to change the dynamics of the Supreme Court. His appointment is a one-for-one swap, a conservative replacing another conservative.

title: A Priests Legacy: Blessing His Flock, and Organizing It
description: Soft light shone upon the body of the Rev. Neil Connolly, which lay in repose under the dome of St. Marys Roman Catholic Church on the Lower East Side of Manhattan. A procession of mourners  nuns, priests, family and friends  made their way up the aisle, hugging one another as they approached his open coffin, stopped and prayed, then gently touched his pristine robe as a final goodbye.

title: Our Tangled World of Hair
description: This is a version of the weekly Race/Related newsletter. To get it in your inbox, sign up here.

title: For Obama, Syria Chemical Attack Shows Risk of Deals With Dictators
description: WASHINGTON  When it came time to make his case for the judgment of history, President Barack Obama had a ready rebuttal to one of the most cutting critiques of his time in office.

title: Arriving on Tiptoe, Smurfs Carry a Lesson for Hollywood Franchises
description: LOS ANGELES  Studios put forward two new wide-release movies over the weekend, and both were shrugs: not hits, not misses. Smurfs: The Lost Village took in about $14 million for Sony Pictures; Going in Style, about three feisty oldsters, managed to reap $12.5 million for Warner Bros.

title: Tebows 2nd Act Has South Carolina Giving Him the 1st-Class Treatment
description: COLUMBIA, S.C.  In the autumn of 2007, Tim Tebow came to this town to deliver a crushing blow. Then the Florida Gators dynamic quarterback, Tebow cemented his destiny as that years Heisman Trophy winner by accounting for seven touchdowns against the University of South Carolina Gamecocks.

title: SummerStage Season to Feature Mavis Staples, Parliament Funkadelic
description: Mavis Staples will kick off SummerStages 2017 season of more than 100 free concerts in parks around New York City.

title: 10 Die in Somalia Suicide Attack on New Army Chief
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  At least 10 people were killed in the capital of Somalia on Sunday when a suicide bomber tried to assassinate the newly installed commander of the countrys army, witnesses and officials said.

title: Syria, Stockholm, Egypt: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Canada Tries to Turn Its A.I. Ideas Into Dollars
description: TORONTO  Long before Google started working on cars that drive themselves and Amazon was creating home appliances that talk, a handful of researchers in Canada  backed by the Canadian government and universities  were laying the groundwork for todays boom in artificial intelligence.

title: Tillerson, on Eve of Russia Trip, Takes Hard Line on Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Secretary of State Rex W. Tillerson is taking a hard line against Russia on the eve of his first diplomatic trip to Moscow, calling the country incompetent for allowing Syria to hold on to chemical weapons and accusing Russia of trying to influence elections in Europe using the same methods it employed in the United States.

title: Hope for Knicks Future, and a Reminder of a Messy Past, Bear Witness to a Loss
description: Markelle Fultz sat courtside Sunday afternoon at Madison Square Garden, the latest stop on an arena tour by a player who is considered the presumptive No. 1 pick in Junes N.B.A. draft. A former N.B.A. star, Stephon Marbury, sat in a baseline seat the length of the court away. It was a ready-made juxtaposition of the Knicks past and what they fervently hope will be their future.

title: Review: The Great War, When America Took the World Stage
description: Speaking just over a century ago about national defense  at a time when he was still fervently engaged in keeping the United States out of World War I  Woodrow Wilson intoned, While America contains every element of fine force and accomplishment, America does not constitute the major part of the world.

title: Rangers Tradition Takes On Added Poignancy With Loss of a Hero
description: When Patricia Ann Norris-McDonald and Conor McDonald stepped onto the Madison Square Garden ice before the Rangers regular-season finale against the Pittsburgh Penguins on Sunday night, their annual moment was accompanied by swirls of emotion.

title: K.T. McFarland, Deputy National Security Adviser, Is Expected to Leave Post
description: WASHINGTON  K. T. McFarland, the former Fox News commentator appointed by President Trump as deputy national security adviser, is expected to leave that position soon and may be nominated to be the United States ambassador to Singapore, according to officials briefed on the matter.

title: Fox News Troubles Heighten Scrutiny of Rupert Murdochs Plan to Acquire Sky
description: Rupert Murdoch has long sought to add Sky, the British satellite and news giant, to his stable of global media outlets that includes movie studios, newspapers and cable networks like Fox News.

title: 5Pointz Graffiti Artists Whose Works Were Erased Will Get Day in Court
description: It was a crushing blow to nearly two dozen established graffiti artists when in 2013 the owner of the Queens building complex known as 5Pointz ordered a surprise nighttime whitewashing of their colorful murals, leaving them with little chance to document or save the spray-painted artwork that had attracted worldwide attention.

title: Review: Diving Deep Into Stauds Kaleidoscopic Music
description: Leaving the Miller Theater at Columbia University on Saturday evening, having just heard a concert devoted to the complex yet plainly appealing music of the Austrian composer Johannes Maria Staud, I thought about art  and not just because Mr. Staud has often taken visual culture as an inspiration.

title: A Partisan Books Editor Places a Bet on Balance
description: During his 30 years in editing, Adam Bellow has handled some of the most controversial and notorious right-wing books of our era, including The Bell Curve by Charles Murray and Richard J. Herrnstein, Dinesh DSouzas Illiberal Education and David Brocks The Real Anita Hill.

title: As Georgia Vote Nears, G.O.P. Asks if Ideological Purity Matters Anymore
description: ATLANTA  When Michael Fitzgerald, a local Republican leader, took a break from packing up the signs after a candidate forum here last week, he appeared momentarily flummoxed about the state of his party under President Trump.

title: Fewer Tomatoes in Ketchup? East Europeans Pursue Parity at the Grocery
description: BRATISLAVA, Slovakia  When Simona Budinska, a 31-year-old public relations specialist, had trouble finding lactose-free products at her local grocery, she and her husband began driving across the border to Austria, where the stores were teeming with choices.

title: In Sweden, Tribute to Victims of Truck Attack
description: In response to the terrorist attack in central Sweden last week, thousands came out on Sunday to honor the victims with a message for peace.

title: Documenta 14, a German Art Shows Greek Revival
description: ATHENS  Even today, in a supersaturated calendar of worldwide art events, no show matters more than Documenta, a colossal German exhibition of contemporary art, reinvented every five or so years as a museum of 100 days.

title: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child Sets Olivier Awards Record
description: LONDON  The Broadway-bound Harry Potter and the Cursed Child shattered records at the Olivier Awards for London theater here on Sunday night, picking up nine prizes, including best new play, and honors for the actors playing Harry, Hermione Granger and Draco Malfoys son, Scorpius.

title: He Buys a Lot of Ads, and Hes Frustrated With Digital
description: LOS ANGELES  Marc S. Pritchard, the chief brand officer of Procter & Gamble, has become the face of marketers frustrations with digital advertising this year. His message to the industry: Grow up.

title: Ex-Professor Says Dismissed Racketeering Case Is Still Devastating
description: Next month will be the seventh anniversary of the darkest moment in Joy Laskars life.

title: Words of Self-Empowerment
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle is a first for The New York Times Crossword in one sense: It is the first time that Will Shortz has run a puzzle created by someone who is currently incarcerated.

title: No Corrections: April 10, 2017
description: No Corrections appeared in print on Monday, April 10, 2017.

title: To Woo Young Moviegoers, AMC Thinks More Like McDonalds
description: LAS VEGAS  Adam Aron, the chief executive of AMC Theaters, the largest multiplex chain in the world, sat in a hotel suite here last month and sang the praises of a new menu item he called the Bavarian Beast.

title: Yankees Rally to Defeat the Orioles
description: BALTIMORE  It was a beautiful day for a walk in the park  70 degrees and sunny  so the Yankees enjoyed many of them at Camden Yards on Sunday. And one of those walks led to a decisive run and a badly needed win for the Yankees, a team that had been stumbling.

title: It Did Not Stick: The First Federal Effort to Curb Police Abuse
description: PITTSBURGH  Federal intervention to curb police abuse did not begin after chants of I cant breathe, viral cellphone videos or the Black Lives Matter movement.

title: U.S. Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of April 10
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: How Stephen Colbert Finally Found His Elusive Groove
description: One of the most surprising turnaround stories in recent television history began on one of the most surprising nights in political history.

title: Heng on President Trumps Meeting With Xi Jinping
description: The U.S. missile strike in Syria occurred while Chinas president, Xi Jinping, was visiting the United States. Some analysts viewed the timing as no coincidence, with the attack serving as a prod to push China to do more to deter North Koreas development of nuclear weapons.

title: Hans Dehmelt, Nobel Laureate for Isolating Electrons, Dies at 94
description: Hans Dehmelt, who shared the 1989 Nobel Prize in Physics for developing methods to trap a single ion or electron, allowing for a more precise way to measure their properties, died March 7 in Seattle. He was 94.

title: Masters 2017: Sergio Garca Finally Wins First Major Title
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  The Arnold Palmer of Europe was Seve Ballesteros, who was very, very good when he hit his drives straight and even better when they went crooked. In 1980, three months after Sergio Garca was born, Ballesteros won the first of his two Masters titles.

title: Galvanized by a Defenders Injury, Denver Stands Firm in a Title Win
description: CHICAGO  As the stretcher carrying Tariq Hammond was wheeled away, members of the Denver University mens hockey team stood on the ice nearby, determined, more than ever, to finish what they had started.

title: Can Bill OReilly Keep His Scolds Perch?
description: In 2000, cable newss transformational star  a telegenic scold who knew wrong from right as sure as he knew that a break from traditional values would be this nations ruination  wrote the following words in his book The OReilly Factor:

title: 10 Things to Know About Russell Westbrooks Triple-Double Record
description: Russell Westbrook tallied his 42nd triple-double on Sunday night, breaking the season record set by Oscar Robertson in 1961-62 with the Cincinnati Royals. Westbrooks 50-point, 16-rebound, 10-assist performance in the Oklahoma City Thunders 106-105 comeback win over the Denver Nuggets included a 3-pointer at the buzzer. And it capped a feat that is amazing in many ways  some obvious, some not as much.

title: Finding a Familiar Signature
description: Dear Diary:

title: U.S. Reroutes Warships Toward Korean Peninsula in Show of Force
description: WASHINGTON  The commander of American forces in the Pacific has ordered an aircraft carrier and several other warships toward the Korean Peninsula in a show of force by the Trump administration just days after  North Korea tested another intermediate-range missile.

title: The Trump Resistance Found Early Success. Can It Also Find Momentum?
description: CALDWELL, N.J.  Political reporters were calling, crediting them with helping to bring down Republican legislation to repeal the Affordable Care Act. Rachel Maddow made them the stars of a segment on her show, chronicling how they had grown into a legitimate political movement that pushed their congressman, the chairman of the influential Appropriations Committee, to come out against the bill hours before his partys leadership decided to pull it without a vote.

title: Spain Arrests Russian Thought to Be Kingpin of Computer Spam
description: MOSCOW  He refused to meet business associates in person and never talked on the phone, preferring instead to communicate via encrypted messaging services. But the elaborate precautions taken by the Russian computer spam kingpin known as Peter Severa appear to have failed him.

title: 100 Years Later, Battle of Vimy Ridge Remains Key Symbol for Canada
description: OTTAWA  Several hundred people gathered at Canadas national war memorial at sunset on Saturday to mark the 100th anniversary of the Battle of Vimy Ridge, a fierce World War I fight in northern France that looms large in Canadas national identity.

title: Quotation of the Day: Ringlings Artists Prepare for Final Bows
description: We are selling miracles. I dont care how old you get, how much technology advances, people will always be enamored with other people flying and doing daring things.

title: David Peel, Downtown Singer and Marijuana Evangelist, Dies at 74
description: David Peel, a longtime New York street musician whose song I Like Marijuana became a hippie anthem in the 1960s, and who collaborated with John Lennon and Yoko Ono in the early 70s, died on Thursday in Manhattan. He was 74.

title: A Talk With Yellen, and Debt Payments From Venezuela Are Due
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Storms, Though Over, Still Disrupt Delta Flights
description: Delta Air Lines continued to cancel flights throughout the weekend because of the cascading effects of storms that struck Atlanta last Wednesday.

title: Fox Asks Law Firm to Investigate Bill OReilly Harassment Claim
description: 21st Century Fox has enlisted the law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison to investigate at least one accusation of sexual harassment against the Fox News host Bill OReilly.

title: Illinois Complaint Against Navient
description: Illinois filed a lawsuit against Navient, the nations largest servicer of student loans, accusing it of extensive mistakes and violations, and of making predatory, subprime loans to borrowers likely to default.

title: Loans Designed to Fail: States Say Navient Preyed on Students
description: Ashley Hardin dreamed of being a professional photographer  glamorous shoots, perhaps some exotic travel. So in 2006, she enrolled in the Brooks Institute of Photography and borrowed more than $150,000 to pay for what the school described as a pathway into an industry clamoring for its graduates.

title: The Accusations Against Navient
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and state attorneys general in Illinois and Washington filed lawsuits against Navient, the nations largest servicer of student loans, accusing it of extensive mistakes and violations.

title: Voices of Navients Borrowers: The Biggest Mistake of My Life
description: Attended ITT Educational Services, a for-profit technical school chain that closed last year, from 2009 to 2012; earned an associate degree in computer networks systems.

title: WikiLeaks Documentary Evolves With Its Subject, Year After Premiere
description: About a year ago, the documentary filmmaker Laura Poitras introduced her portrait of the WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange at the Cannes film festival. She was fresh off an Oscar win for her work on Citizenfour, which focuses on Edward Snowden, the National Security Agency whistle-blower.

title: Snarled Commutes, Squabbling Agencies and Amtraks Penn Station Responsibilities
description: Commuters from the East End of Long Island to the western edge of New Jersey suffered a transportation meltdown and four days of upheaval last week  all because of the faulty maintenance of a federal railroad they may never ride.

title: Same Old Sergio Writes a New Script
description: AUGUSTA, Ga.  Throughout the first nine holes of Sundays final round at the Masters, Sergio Garca was greeted with thunderous applause from the grandstands. Just 15 years ago, when he was perceived as precocious but persnickety, he was ridiculed by crowds at American major golf championships. But now Garca, 37, was a fan favorite.

title: Feud: Bette and Joan Episode 6 Recap: Midnight Descending
description: If you think its twilight for us, its midnight for them, says the studio head Jack Warner to director Robert Aldrich. Them refers to Joan Crawford and Bette Davis, but the twilight of his own career haunts him. Theres a famous story of Dennis Hopper, high on the success of Easy Rider in 1969, coming up to George Cukor at a Hollywood event and saying: You are old Hollywood and were the new. We are going to bury you. In the 1960s, the behemoth studios started collapsing under their own weight. A tough old dog like Warner would never give up the brass ring willingly, but neither would Davis or Crawford.

title: Billions Season 2, Episode 8: New Money, Old Rules
description: You can take the boy out of Yonkers, but you cant take Yonkers out of the boy.

title: Stockholm, Egypt, Masters Tournament: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Noah Syndergaard Brings the Heat and the Mets Bats Begin to Warm
description: Two and a half hours before the start of the Mets game against the Miami Marlins on Sunday, the teams assistant athletic trainer, Brian Chicklo, strolled through the home dugout with a large box of hand warmers.

title: Whats on TV Monday: An Autistic Muppet on Sesame Street and a New Season of Better Call Saul
description: Julia, an autistic 4-year-old Muppet, makes her debut on Sesame Street. And Better Call Saul and Angie Tribeca begin new seasons.

title: A Spring Break for The Learning Network
description: Happy Passover and Easter  not to mention National Poetry Month, the beginning of baseball season, and, at least here in New York City, newly warm weather and spring flowers.

title: Homeland, Season 6, Episode 12: In the Finale, Carrie Deals With Death and Betrayal
description: What a harsh and sudden goodbye we faced, in the last episode of Homeland this season. And as the screen went black, it was hard to sort out what to feel and what to think.

title: Wife of Detained Activist From Taiwan Is Barred From China
description: TAOYUAN, Taiwan  Chinas Ministry of Public Security has barred the wife of a detained Taiwan-born rights activist from flying to Beijing on Monday, adding to the drama surrounding the mans disappearance after he entered China more than three weeks ago.

title: Gawking at Trump Tower
description: In the months before and after the presidential election, Yana Paskova sought out the crowds that flocked to Trump Tower.

title: Was Bo Diddley a Buddha?
description: CHICAGO  When I was in my 20s, I had the good fortune to play guitar as an opening act for the blues legend B. B. King. This lucky break opened many doors for me, and I soon found myself playing with other great blues musicians  Koko Taylor, Buddy Guy and Bo Diddley, to name a few. During one stretch time, Bo hired me whenever he played in Chicago.

title: Historically Black Colleges
description: To the Editor:

title: Publicity Stunts Arent Policy
description: Does anyone still remember the Carrier deal? Back in December President-elect Donald Trump announced, triumphantly, that he had reached a deal with the air-conditioner manufacturer to keep 1,100 jobs in America rather than moving them to Mexico. And the media spent days celebrating the achievement.

title: Jobs in Sustainable Fuels
description: To the Editor:

title: The Gig Economys False Promise
description: The promises Silicon Valley makes about the gig economy can sound appealing. Its digital technology lets workers become entrepreneurs, we are told, freed from the drudgery of 9-to-5 jobs. Students, parents and others can make extra cash in their free time while pursuing their passions, maybe starting a thriving small business.

title: How I Learned to Take the SAT Like a Rich Kid
description: FLINT, Mich.  The summer before my junior year of high school, I boarded an airplane for the first time. Three hours later I was in picture-perfect New England, where I was soon to be surrounded by a diverse and extremely accomplished group of peers. I had been awarded a generous scholarship to attend the Phillips Exeter summer semester  five weeks of classes and sports, with some optional SAT prep mixed in.

title: Native Americans and Coal: The Risks of Dependency
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: The Long Road to Trumps War
description: We now know how many cruise missiles it takes to turn you from pariah to respected member of the American foreign policy establishment: 59  the number President Trump fired on a Syrian government airfield on Thursday. I think Donald Trump became president of the United States, the CNN host Fareed Zakaria gushed.

title: The Extreme Foolishness in Extreme Vetting Proposals
description: Imagine that the next time you arrive at a foreign airport a customs agent asks you to unlock your phone, hand it over and, for good measure, cough up the login and password information for any social media accounts you have. You could then wait for hours while government officials sift through your address book, your emails, your chats and, yes, even your photos. If all goes well, you get your phone back, get a new stamp on your passport and start your journey with the sinking feeling that follows an arbitrary breach of privacy.

title: War as Political Weapon
description: Donald Trump has turned his back on pretty much everything he has ever said about United States military involvement in Syria and launched nearly 60 missiles at an air base in the country.

title: An Artist, an Arsonist and an Island of Trump Fans in New York
description: As a hometown campaigner, Donald Trump managed to win only one of New York Citys five boroughs  Staten Island, where an opponents act of arson only boosted his chances.

title: Americas Toxic Workplace Rules
description: Last month, President Trumps nomination of R. Alexander Acosta to be secretary of labor was approved by a Senate committee, even though the nominees testimony had left unclear whether he would be more interested in protecting employers prerogatives than in guarding workers interests.

title: How Soviet Dissidents Ended 70 Years of Fake News
description: In the summer of 1990, at a fulcrum moment when his country was tipping from reform to dissolution, Mikhail S. Gorbachev spoke to Time magazine and declared, I detest lies. It was a revolutionary statement only because it came from the mouth of a Soviet leader.

title: Gawking at Trump Tower
description: I searched the folded glass above me, smooth as tar and just as black. Trump Tower attracted an unending procession of gawkers  mouths agape, eyes scaling the opaque tiers, fingers twitching with a constant urge to self-record. It was Nov. 9, and I was there on assignment, the deafening cacophony of Election Day still in my ears.

title: Barclays C.E.O. Investigated Over Treatment of Whistle-Blower
description: The British banking giant Barclays is again facing questions about its leadership just as its efforts to turn itself around in the aftermath of the 2012 Libor scandal are starting to take shape.

title: Sculpting America in Japans Sand
description: A museum in a remote region of Japan is recreating American icons in sand. Take a 360-degree spin through Hollywood, Mount Rushmore and even Trump Tower, all composed of sand and water.

title: Take a Cruise With Oprah? Reservations, Please!
description: Randy Moss may no longer catch passes from Tom Brady or Colin Kaepernick, but for at least one week this summer, fans can find Mr. Moss, a former N.F.L. wide receiver, at the BodyHoliday resort on St. Lucia running guests through gridiron drills on the beach, organizing touch football games and offering nutritional advice, including extolling his favorite breakfasts  fruit salad and acai bowls.

title: New Report Details Exploitation of Hotel Industry Workers
description: Relaxing vacations mean little work for travelers, thanks to the host of people who work as housekeepers, bellhops and cooks. But a new analysis has found that the largely invisible nature of these jobs means workers can sometimes be exploited by those who market in human trafficking, even within the United States.

title: Robert Bentley, Alabama Governor, Resigns Amid Scandal
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala.  Gov. Robert Bentley resigned Monday, his power and popularity diminished by a sex scandal that staggered the state, brought him to the brink of impeachment and prompted a series of criminal investigations.

title: The Legacy of David Letterman, Icon of the Grizzled Generation
description: LETTERMAN The Last Giant of Late Night By Jason Zinoman Illustrated. 345 pp. Harper/ HarperCollins Publishers. $28.99

title: 11 Years, $300 Million and 3 Convictions. Was the Khmer Rouge Tribunal Worth It?
description: BANGKOK  After spending more than a decade and nearly $300 million, the United Nations-backed tribunal prosecuting the crimes of the Khmer Rouge has convicted just three men.

title: California Moves to Become Sanctuary State, and Others Look to Follow
description: A 42-year-old immigrant was on her way to church in Mendota, a small city in Californias Central Valley, one afternoon last month when the police stopped her because the tinted windows on her 2006 Nissan were too dark. What happened next says much about the growing conflict between states like California and the Trump administration.

title: Can This Man Revive the Yankees?
description: There was no grand unveiling, no ceremony to show it off. But when the Mets opened their 2017 season at Citi Field, a new placard was affixed to the overhang down the left-field line. It proclaimed the Mets as winners of a 2016 National League wild card.

description: A male colleague grabbing her leg. Another one suggestively rubbing her back. Others at work dinners discussing who theyd want to sleep with.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Sophie Calles Career, in Pictures
description: A look at the artists life and work.

title: The Fertile Mind of Sophie Calle
description: ITS POURING WHEN the taxi leaves me in front of Sophie Calles building in Malakoff, a working-class suburb 10 minutes from Paris. At first I question the address: The building  gray and nondescript  is as dreary as the day. Its not the home youd expect for a conceptual artist whose work can be uncommonly frisky. But inside, theres a leafy courtyard ringed by ateliers, one of which is blazing with light. I spot the artist through her studios floor-to-ceiling windows. She meets me at the door looking classic kooky-sexy Calle: low-cut black cocktail dress, elaborately crocheted black tights, massive tinted glasses and sheepskin slippers.

title: The Daily: Trumps Syria Evolution
description: Listen and subscribe from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Learning From Our Parents Heart Health Mistakes
description: Narrowed, aging blood vessels, which put most older American adults at risk for heart disease and strokes, are not inevitable. This fact was underscored by a newly published study of a population in the Bolivian Amazon.

description: James E. Staley, the chief executive of Barclays, is under investigation by the British authorities after he admitted to trying to learn the identity of a whistle-blower last year, the bank said.

title: Stada to Support Takeover Bid by Bain Capital and Cinven
description: LONDON  Stada Arzneimittel of Germany said on Monday that it would support a takeover bid by the private equity firms Bain Capital and Cinven that valued it at more than $4.3 billion, in the latest potential big deal for a maker of generic drugs.
